description:
We stopped by on a Sunday for a drink after brunch in the city and this place is great!
Plenty of seating, very clean, friendly staff and Benji at the bar makes a great margarita. Even tho we were full we ended up ordering the queso with chorizo which was delicious!
I'll for sure make a reservation on another night for dinner.
author: Albert Paris W.

description:
I've walked by here a bunch of times and the ambiance looks expensive but friendly. Finally got a chance to try it out when we got it for an office happy hour!

Mmm, unfortunately I'll have to agree with other reviewers that the food is could have used some more flavor. 

The chips and guac were pretty standard. The guac was definitely tasty, though I wouldn't have complained about some more salt and spice. It wasn't too creamy but I liked the cilantro pieces in this.

Next up, empanadas and flautas de pollo. The empanadas had a soft exterior with chicken, chorizo, and Menonita cheese filling. Tasty enough. The flautas were filled with chicken tinga (chicken in tomato and chipotle sauce) and topped with salsa verde, queso fresco, and crema. These just reminded me of the taquitos I used to heat up in the microwave as a kid. The crust was a little hard.

Enchiladas! We got the suizas enchilada and the mestiza enchilada. I suppose these definitely fell into the category of comfort food. The suiza enchilada was also chicken tinga with a creamy tomatillo sauce. The mestiza enchilada had chipotle-braised beef with mestiza sauce (which is reddish-brown, but also made with tomatillo. While these things are different colors, they tasted similar to me.

Finally, onto some cheese quesadillas. The cheese in these was pretty tasty, and the salsas weren't too spicy.

Overall though, it just felt like the same ingredients were used in different ways (based on what we ordered), whereas some variety would have been appreciated.
author: Nicole H.

description:
It was a sunny Friday afternoon in San Francisco, and there I was walking into Rosa Mexicano for a lunch date with a friend. This was my first time going, so naturally I had no idea what to expect. 

Immediately the first thing I noticed was the decor. The restaurant is set up in a way I think Bobby Berk from Queer Eye, you know the one who flips houses, would appreciate. 

Now it is time for the food. I first started out with ceviche, which I was swimming in it. The guacamole was so thick and creamy I wanted to rub it all over my body; you know millennials and guac. Since it was a lunch date and Friday I didn't want to gorge myself with food. I had people to impress later on that night. So I orders some tacos, and let me just say the tacos and I had a moment. As I was sitting there eating some juicy meat, I couldn't help but wonder... what would be the icing on top of a fantastic lunch? Oh yes, a frozen pomegranate margarita. 

You know that feeling you get when a cutie at a bar approaches you. Well, this was so much better then that!
author: Carlos M.

description:
3 stars is a perfect score for this average Mexican restaurant in the Financial/ Embarcadero area. I've been here quite a few times, and I'm always left feeling... unsatisfied.

Pros- great space for events, nice ambience, helpful and friendly staff, some (side) dishes are delish

Cons- the food in general is just not up to par. This past time I was there, I ordered the veggie "fajitas." I am a huge cauliflower, kale, and corn lover, all parts of this dish. It was disgusting. The cauliflower was uncooked, chewy, and had a gross spice on it. We all agreed that is was really not good. The rest of my dish was so incredibly bland and boring. I feel bad for actual vegetarians dining here!

Other dishes were just not great. I've tried a variety of entrees here, and never really loved anything. For $25-$30 per plate, please step it up. I mean this is ridiculous.

Drinks are also extremely overpriced, even for San Francisco. A $17 margarita? Come on.

So yeah, average at best. When my coworkers take me here, I'll go and order the steak, but would never pay for this food on my own dime.
author: Hannah S.

description:
Love this place!
It is just couple blocks frim my office and been here many times. They do not disappoint. Service, food, atmosphere are all excellent. Parking is a little bit difficult and if you like driving then it is okay. However if you do hate it, you might as well uber or lyft esp if you will be drinking. Less stress and less thing to worry about. You can also have a private party/event if you do decide to have one over here. There's a lot of room in the back and they use curtains to make it private. It is close to the Embarcadero shopping center, Pier and Ferry building so there's a lot of sight-seeings to enjoy. I would still come back over and over again.
author: Theresa M.

description:
First time here for happy hour for a coworker's birthday. The hostess was not friendly AT ALL which is not a good look since that's the first person customers interact with. She was very dismissive rather than helpful. Outdoor seating was open seating so we sat ourselves and pushed some tables together. Our waiter was accommodating which lightened the experience. Their happy hour menu was limited as far as cocktails goes and it wasn't the cheapest (but we are in SF). IMO, no chips and salsa will beat Chevy's, but theirs was okay. 
Their frozen margs somehow seemed a lot stronger than on the rocks. I loved how their fruity margs were not overly sweet and they had chunks of actual fruit in it. Their fish tacos was on the fishy side and the batter was thick (not on my top fish taco list). 

All in all, I wouldn't go out of my way to go to this place again. If you're driving into the city, parking is limited. It's more ideal for people who want to grab a drink and walk over after work or something. It wasn't memorable to me, but it wasn't a horrible experience either.
author: Jenna T.

description: After the manager read my review, he promptly followed up and treated my friend I to a wonderful dinner. The service was amazing and so was the food. I started out with a mocktail (fresh strawberries with mango purée). On the menu they have an upgrade option to add vodka or tequila to make it a cocktail. It was refreshing, delicious and really pretty. My friend, Rena, had a margarita. She enjoyed her cocktail. We shared table-side gauc, chicken fajita type dish, and I thought it would be good if we added some leafy greens so we ordered the kale, corn, pepper accompaniment. Everything was so yummy. And I really loved all the cheese on the main dish we ordered. Thank you for a great evening, and we will definitely be back.
author: Danielle S.

description:
Went here for a birthday lunch. Service right off the bat was disappointing. We waited for a while and then finally waived someone down to take our order. 

- Guac is def something you have to get - totally worth it.
- Camarones tacos were soo delicious.
- Hongos -  cauliflower wasn't cooked well, decent dish - could skip it.
author: Nikita G.

description:
I love Rosa!! So fun and lively! Happy Hour at the bar is Monday to Friday from 4-7pm. That was the big draw for me. I got the frozen mango margarita with a salted rim and pretty glass. You just have to really flag down a waiter or go up to the bar otherwise you're ignored. 

Good food, no complaints there. Filled up on salsa and chips before they came around with a cart where they make the guacamole in front of you. Warning, medium does not mean not spicy. Cuz that guac was on fire, I loved it just be careful if you don't like delicious hot spicy  stuff.

Oh they also offer rice and beans, just in case you didn't already loosen your stretchy pants. 

Got a quesadilla filled with cheese and vegetables. Omg so tasty, chewy, the sauce on top was a perfect finish. I was happy, and mad I couldn't finish it all! 

Nice spot on Mission! Not too hard to find and only a few minutes walking from Embarcadero bart.

What are you waiting for? Go!!
author: Liz B.

description: Came back here another night with my coworker, we had a very pleasant experience! I got the salmon poblano on the bed of kale and it was delicious! I asked for it with a side of pico de gallo and it came with rice and refried beans. My friend was also pleased with the flautas de pollo they got. We also got the spicy guacamole and it was delicious. As always, the margaritas here are on point and a great  happy hour spot. Thanks for the great service!
author: Kulmeher D.

description:
I caught this place just after the lunch rush but it was worth the wait! First of all, the chips were fresh and crispy while the salsa had a nice kick, and the cucumber mint drink (non-alcoholic cause work awaited :() was suuuper refreshing. 

Because I felt like I could eat a cow, I shared the chorizo/chicken empanadas with a friend to tide me over and oh my god. The flakiness reminded me of street empanadas I had in the Dominican Republic that I still dream of and can now live out at a much closer location, with its own rich flavor on the inside. 

Also got the baja fish tacos for myself, which were bursting with melty goodness and came in those cute little taco trays with a side of corn. Sadly, could only handle a bite of the rice and beans by the end, which I accidentally left at my desk instead of refrigerating so I could eat it the next day. Still bummed about that, but I'm totally returning to right that wrong.
author: Marjan M.

description:
Table side mortar and pestle guacamole so fresh it might as well still be in the rind!

Tinga de Res quesadilla that will take your socks off the meat is so tender and well seasoned.

House sangria that goes down all too quickly.

SPOILER  - All the poor reviews are referring to Rosa before new management as far as I'm concerned.
author: Christopher D.

description:
Upon my arrival, Appreciated the hostess with a welcoming smile . Absolutely loved the best friendly service and the ambiance was sexy and contemporary.  The food was an elaborate Mexican cuisine and went well with the fabulous spicy cucumber drinks that I ordered.   I will definitely return to try more on the menu!

It had to come back & try the main cuisine this time!  Highly recommended by my excellent server, Leslie, was the Salmon Poblano that I ordered.  It was crispy outside & tender inside flavored with the kale & Poblano sauce made a great combination!  I loved their version of Mexican Elote! I tried the Frozen Pomegranate, loved it!  Truly Rosa Mexicano did not disappoint.
author: Charmaine J.

description:
Found this place near my new job and I love it! Went in around the late afternoon and it was a very calm and relaxed ambiance. Everyone's so sweet and attentive. 

You can't walk up in there and not get their spicy guacamole. You're doing yourself a disservice if you do. Don't disrespect yourself like that. It was the most delicious guacamole I've ever had in my 25 years of life! 

After eating that and their flavorful shrimp quesadilla I was stuffed for the whole day. Don't miss out on this gem you guys.
author: Dayvon D.

description:
I came here with coworkers and wasn't blown away but also wasn't disappointed. Because I did not pay, that may change my perspective too. With that said, it's not a bad option for a group due to its large size and nice atmosphere.

If you go, you have to get the chips and guacamole as they make it tableside. Unfortunately, our chips tasted a bit stale. The main menu had decent variety but felt a bit pricey for what you got. The flavors were good. However, I have no doubt I could find better options over in the Mission. 

The convenient location makes it desirable for work functions, but it's forgettable and doesn't offer a wow factor. Will I be back? Possibly but I do want to see what other similar restaurants have first.
author: Brandon S.

description:
Good for a work-related junction. Which Rosa knows as well, because everything is grossly overpriced.

Huge venue so prime place for happy hours with the team. Highlights are the margaritas and the guac. Guac is amazing, though don't let the stone bowls they're served in deceive you. They're hella shallow - one share around the table, and you're ordering another one.
author: Vickie Z.

description:
Not impressed, to say the least. 

Their "happy hour" prices are... not happy hour prices. Our server was nice, but definitely tricked us into ordering $20 chips & guac that ended up being somewhat gross, we didn't even touch, told her we weren't huge fans of, and still got charged. 

They also charged the wrong amount on my card. Not the best first impression.
author: Nellie R.

description:
If you're looking to book a work lunch/dinner, this place is perfect. It's spacious, conveniently located in FiDi/Embarcadero, and they also have a lengthy list of cocktails and alcoholic beverages ;)

I came here for a team lunch on a Monday with a group of about 10. We were seated immediately (yay for reservations!) and from there service went downhill. The wait for our drinks, food, general service felt absurdly long. Between taking orders to receiving our drinks that took about 20 min. The time between our drinks to our food, felt like forever. Long enough that we were wondering what happened and definitely long enough that one my coworkers who had to leave at 1:30pm (we arrived at 12pm) did not get her food. By 1pm the restaurant had cleared out and there were only a few tables left so we didn't understand why the food took so long. I understand they serving a big group takes longer but I felt like this took too long overall.

Aside from the service, the food was okay. I loved the chips and guacamole! My quesadilla was slightly too burnt for my liking but the carne asada was good. Several of my other coworkers that ordered the tacos also set it was just okay.

Perhaps we came on an off day because it seems like a promising restaurant. Maybe next time is the charm.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
PROS: upscale atmosphere. Near downtown. Didn't have any trouble parking. 

CONS: food is less than average. For upscale dining, I expected better Mexican. Was disappointed. Had heard it was better.
author: Sara C.

description:
Great fushion Mexican food. Blend of old & new flavours. 

We did graduation dinner here with my wife and we had great time. No waiting (made reservations) and service was wonderful. 

Highly recommended.
author: Dan N.

description:
This place is a fancy Mexican restaurant. We got the guacamole which was like $15. They make it in front of you in a little cart, mixing everything. In my opinion, it was too salty!! But the nacho chips are soooo delicious. They are very fatty which makes it delicious.

I got the portabello veggie tacos. It comes with three tacos. Usually it comes with spicy sauce but I told them to put it on the side because I can't really eat spicy stuff. It was yummy. It comes with corn. I don't really like corn. My friends got beef tacos, this fish dish, and this other beef dish. I forgot. They liked it. It also came with this bowl of mashed beans and Mexican rice which was very yummy and mushy. I love mushy beans. This place has the best nachos ever!! They give you free salsa with nachos in the beginning. Yum! Good service. Fancy looking place.
author: Amanda L.

description:
Definitely my new favorite happy hour spot!! I don't write a ton of reviews but was so excited to find this place that I had to share.  The service was great, fast, and on point.  Also, a place with outdoor seating, bomb guacamole, and yummy margaritas?? Yes please!! 

If you're with a large group (or a few hungry friends) I would definitely recommend the 3 Feet of Tacos! Definitely a "wow" factor, and gives a great selection.  

Can't wait to come back and try even more!
author: Jessica K.

description:
A few weeks later update:

I got an email apologizing for the ridiculously bad service from the management. We have been back a couple of times and they do seem to have been working on it a lot. The food is kinda blah but I'd call this a decent downtown HH or lunch spot at this point (especially if someone else is paying for it.)

--

This might have been the worst service I have ever had. At 4pm on a Wednesday, it took 30 minutes to take our order. We asked multiple people if we could order, 3+ people said "just a sec." It then took us 20 minutes to flag someone down to get our check, and 30 minutes to get the check taken care of. My coworker missed his train. In an hour and a half, we had 1 round of incorrectly delivered drinks and 2 awful appetizers.

The guacamole was WATERY? WTF? I've had it before, and it is not supposed to have a pool of liquid in it. The deviled eggs were bland. I wasn't paying for it, but if I was I'm sure I was I'd think we'd been ripped off.

I ordered a glass of Albariño, which is on their menu, and the waiter looked at me like I'd ordered a fried elephant. I clarified that it was a white wine. 45 minutes later, I received an unknown red wine. Great job buddy.

You would seriously be better off going to Taco Bell Cantina than this dump.
author: Sophia C.

description: A fantastic Mexican food option in a prime location. Those who work in Financial or Mission District can enjoy a short walk to the best Mexican food I've had around the office. I will certainly be coming back to try more items on the menu. Guacamole is a must, chips and salsa come free of charge, tacos are perfect for lunch. This is the taste I was searching for.
author: Eric S.

description:
I went here during happy hour, which is when is the best time to go here for relatively cheaper drinks and food. The frozen margaritas are great and very strong - definitively worth the $8! I also got the white sangria which was a little too fruity for my taste, but was only $6! 

I ordered the fish tacos, which were honestly pretty average - they don't really put a lot of other toppings on it and it's just the fried fish in a tortilla essentially. Also, the tacos are $8.5 during the happy hour time and you get two tacos - that isn't terrible pricing but the tacos are just alright. The regular item menu food is very pricey - it's about $16 for guacamole with salsa and chips!!! I would just stick to the free chips and salsa they give you instead.

Also, the service wasn't the best when I went here, but it could have been due to how busy it was. It took like almost 30 minutes for my friends tacos to come, and it was hard to track down a waiter. Overall, I would say this is an alright restaurant for happy hour drinks, but if you're going here for the food I wouldn't really recommend.
author: Rithika V.

description:
So I went to have lunch here today to try something new in the city and let me tell you that I feel I have found a special gem here. The host/servers were all kind and checking up on me and my lunch date consistently through the whole meal while also explaining each item on the menu.

I started off with their guacamole and I can 100% say it is one of the best guacs out there. They bring a cart next to your table with the fresh ingredients and make it right there on the spot in front of your eyes. It was amazing! It is as if biting into a piece of heaven. This is a must have when you go visit.

After having that with several different salsas, I moved over to my entree. Everything on the menu looked so great that I didn't know what to settle on. So I went with the Tres Enchiladas, which is, you guessed it, three enchiladas. All different kinds. You get one of each of their enchiladas on the menu. It was perfect and filled with an abundance of flavor.

To say I was satisfied as I left this establishment is an understatement. I will definitely be returning and taking advantage of this newly discovered spot.
author: Danny K.

description:
*******Rosa redemption~ new GM is awesome*****

So everyone - remember my last review on Rosa Mexicano (as if y'all really follow me like that lol) well anyhoo- my review prompted a response from the new General Manager - Dan. 

He was extremely respectful and invited my family to return to the restaurant and give it another try on the house .

Here's my take: 

1. DAN is awesome: it's rare for a new GM to reach out considering they have much on their plate (getting to know the new staff, organizational changes etc..) so I appreciated his response .. like ...: basically day 1 after relocating to California from Florida. He was considerate, invited us to sit in the dining area, and comped our meal which was kind. I also appreciate executive managers with a personality and social ease  . I can tell the restaurant will get any better with his experience and southern hospitality/ friendliness 
2. Service was awesome- loved our attendant. Wish I remembered his name (miko? Nico?) whatevs - he was energetic and helpful  
3. Mango margarita is still my favorite but the pomegranate  was decent and on the saltier side  I appreciate how STRONG the drinks are - I left faded 
4. Spicy guacamole gives me chills- appreciate the guacamole dude making it right at our table 
5. Tres Enchiladas with 3 different sauces- my babe loved this ! I preferred the white sauce to the molé 
6. Beef Tacos : extremely juicy and ridiculously filling 

I'm pleased with my experience ! This was the Rosa I had heard so much about and I'd recommend it for business events. 

And again- Dan is awesome - which means his awesomeness will extend to staff and the entire restaurant and I love it 

Makes me wanna support this chain and you should too :-)
author: Mariana D.

description:
I came to Rosa Mexicano for a team lunch from work. The pictures looked pretty good, and the menu is really different and interesting, however, almost none of the people I went with enjoyed their dishes, in fact most people didn't even finish it. The one redeeming item was the guacamole that is made to order table side. It was one of the best, freshest, most authentic tasting guacs I've ever had, which is why we all expected more from the main courses.

I'd come here just for the guac/drinks for HH.
author: Farrah N.

description: One of the best Mexican spots I've ever been to. Drinks made tastefully but also quick. The food was delicious I almost licked my plate. I would come back here in a heart beat! Also don't miss their happy hour because it's one of the best deals in the area.
author: Zarina B.

description: Met a few gals here for happy hour after work. I was able to snag a table that fit all of us (this place gets BUSY for HH). Since it was so busy, you'd think that the service would be slow, and it wasn't! Our margaritas came out super fast, we got the frozen delicious ones that I'm pretty sure are made in an industrial mixer with whatever is the strongest tequila. Watch out! They sneak up on you...while you're on bart on your way home. We had the guacamole that they make at your table! And the queso fundido which is super delicious. I haven't tried any of the main meal items, so this is just for the happy hour. And I left happy, so well done Rosa.
author: Ashley S.

description: Great location, a nice nice walk from my office. Beautiful ambiance, lovely music, good people  and love the water flowing down on the wall. The guac, flautas and churros were on point.
author: Sunil R.

description: Five starts for this amazing Mexican Restaurant in the Embarcadero area. Staff is always friendly and helpful especially the lady at the front door (not sure if she's a manager or not), me and my friends come here for the special happy hour drinks, probably best bar atmosphere in an elegant ambiance. Only request we have is bring back the other small bite menu we miss it.
author: Tingting L.

description: the guacamole here is great. so are the margaritas, especially at happy hour prices. im currently obsessed with the frozen mango marg - it's becoming a problem :)
author: Christina L.

description: The quesadillas were very good here!!!! The sauce that they added to the top of the dish were very tasty and added a good blend of flavors. The freshly made guac was the highlight though, we walked in fairly late in the evening and I could tell the guacamole was not old at all.
author: Malvika T.

description: Mexican restaurant in the financial district area with strictly average food. Their only saving grace is the guacamole which they only make fresh if you are sitting at a table inside. They have extremely poor and slow service. Our table was dirty when we got to it. Had to ask for everything a few times. Also overpriced and small portions. We paid about $80 for 2 people without feeling like we really had much to eat. More of a touristy trap place. Not highly recommended
author: Ruchi M.

description: nice location, good service. Excellent happy hour prices and options. Best guac I've ever had.
author: Debbie M.

description:
Overpriced with poor service. 

We called ahead and were told that we did not need a reservation, but then could not sit in a booth because we didn't have a reservation. That should have been our first clue that the service was going to be bad. Our server - or the busboy as one of the other servers referred to him - did not seem to know what he was doing and kept disappearing. 

The best part about this restaurant is the guacamole which is made to order  table side. I ordered the carnitas and my husband had the mole enchiladas, both of which were greasy. They claim that everything is made from scratch; but the salsa tasted like it came from a jar.
author: Sarah S.

description: Horrible food, expensive and bad service. Plenty of real Mexican restaurants in the bay to try.
author: Tiyah H.

description:
This place is a bit too expensive for what it is.

I love their margaritas - super strong and their chips, salsa, and guac is delicious, so they get 3 stars.

The chips and salsa are obviously complimentary but the guac you have to order. Don't be annoyed though, you get a show out of it! They come right next to you to make your guac fresh to order, YUMMY!

The meals I'm not much a fan of. I'd rather hit up a taqueria in the mission and eat twice as much for the same price.
author: Inci A.

description: Stopped in at Rosa Mexicano before the Giants game for the first time the either day and am very happy I did! They have the most incredible guacamole, which they mix up for you right next to the table. It is hands down the most fresh guacamole I've ever had. We ordered a few things to share -- the Suiza Enchiladas are amazing! The sauce is super creamy and tangy. We also had the empanadas, which I have not stopped thinking about since. They were seriously so delicious. The staff is super friendly too, and their manager, Ornin, made sure we felt at home during our visit. I'll be back soon!!
author: Kelsey F.

description: Service is great, but the food is lacking in flavor, the salsa taste like marinara sauce and the mole sauce has a weird after taste, a little too sweet. I understand with down town the price but I thing it should taste accordingly.
author: Madolyn G.

description:
Great service, food, drinks, and most of all a great GM! Very clean space with outdoor seating, nice bar, and just a great team. Hope to get back down there soon and some BOMB guacamole. 

Thank you again to the team down at Rosa Mexicano!
author: Joshua M.

description:
I ordered the Pollo Adobado, which was placed very nicely. It was decent, but not really worth the price. The chicken was a bit plain if you don't use the sauces that are included. Personally, I thought the sauces were a bit too spicy, but I can't take much spice in general. 

The complimentary chips and salsa were pretty good though.
author: Jamie N.

description: Margaritas are average. Guacamole is to die for. All their food is very good. The chicken adobado is A+
author: Avital A.

description:
The food was phenomenal & the drinks were extremely strong just like the reviews said! My favorite was mango margarita 

The only complaint i have about this place is the service, maybe it's because of the table we sat at in the corner. It took forever to have someone take our order, after 30 min of waiting i got up & had to ask to order food.  

Not saying it wasn't worth wait, but if you're in a hurry this probably isn't the best place to go.
author: Myka S.

description:
I went here with coworkers for a team lunch and had a total of six people. Our reservations were at 11:30 on a Monday. We ordered guacamole and chips for the table and it was delicious. 

The reason Rosa's is a two star review instead of a three star review is because of the really slow service. We were seated at 11:30 and did not get our check until 1 PM because it took almost an hour to get our food after we ordered it.

I had the chicken tacos. Unfortunately, the chicken tacos had bacon on them that overpowered the taste. I like bacon, but apparently I don't like bacon on my chicken tacos.
author: David F.

description:
Please note: I visited this restaurant for an evening event during a conference. Food and drink was complimentary, and set up as a buffet plus passed appetizers in the bar area.

The space is very cool, and the staff was friendly and attentive. Although I didn't notice much after I spotted the largest bowl of guacamole I had ever seen in my life, served up in a giant stone molcajete. It took all my willpower not to just hover over it, scooping giant mounds of the stuff directly into my face. Instead, I made like an adult and sat down to enjoy a few Negra Modelos, the quesadilla buffet, the taco bar, and piping hot bites being served up by the staff. These included vegetarian and gluten-free options like spinach quesadillas and potato flautas, which were a welcome sight to some of my colleagues.

Based on what I sampled, I've added it to my list of places to check out for a real meal when in the city with visiting relatives. It wouldn't be a destination restaurant or my choice for authentic Mexican, but is cute and tasty enough to visit again. I've seen others comment about the pricing, so my opinion may change when the meal is on my own dime.
author: Christina R.

description:
Tried the Pescado (batter fired fish) taco , Tinga (braised beef brisket) taco and Guacamole at Rosa Mexicano today for a team lunch. 

After a impressive start with the Guacamole, which was made at the table with fresh ingredients, the tacos were dissappointing  to say the least. Priced at 17$ (before taxes) one would expect to get some value for money but unfortunately no. The batter fried  fish itself was flavorless and the cabbage escabeche and jalapeño-tartar within did not gel well at all. The beef brisket was super greasy too. 

Giving them a 2 for a good ambiance, courteous staff and the good guacamole. But the rest of the food was below par.
author: Avinash G.

description:
Came here for a team lunch with a group of 9. We surprisingly got seated immediately even though it was peak lunch time which was a plus! The location is larger and more upscale than what I anticipated and when we walked to the back I couldn't help but notice the wall with the figurines driving. You definitely need to check it out if you come visit. 

PROS: 

+ Guacamole! They adjust it to how spicy you want it. We ended up getting ours mild and it was great option for our group. One order was more than enough for our group. 
+ Nice ambiance and great location for small & large groups
+ Large portions 
+ Complimentary chips & salsa

CONS: 

+ Service was not that attentive to our group 
+ $17+ each dish

I ended up getting the brisket quesadilla for $17 and the portion was huge! The quesadilla itself was packed with tons of brisket and they add the sour cream & salsa to the side so it doesn't make your dish soggy. However, the meal wasn't anything memorable, especially for the price.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
I ordered the cheese nachos. They weren't very cheesy, and they definitely weren't nachos. =(

I really struggled cutting up the tacos they put under there. Really disappointing.
author: Anya K.

description: The tortilla chips and the guacamole were good. The chile relleno did not have much flavor other than the goat cheese in the filling. The poblano chile was supposed to be roasted, but I really couldn't tell. The interior ambiance was nice. La Tradicional margarita was a bit disappointing--mostly ice and barely any salt. Service needs improvement--interaction was limited to taking our orders, and removing the dishes.
author: David W.

description: Solid 3 because it wasn't the worst meal I've had. However it took extremely long for our food to come out, one large pitcher, two bathroom trips later and what do you know it finally makes an appearance. But to our surprise lacking so much flavor in every sense of the word. The "ceviche" was basically shrimp with some garnishments on the side. Fish tacos were ok just wish the fish was maybe cut up or slightly smaller was a little over powering. The list goes on... needless to say 3 of 4 meals at the table were finished. If you are looking for a great ambience, nice interior this is your place! But if you are looking for real authentic yummy mexican food and you truly know what that is... its a no sis.
author: Tiara M.

description:
One of my go to spots for happy hour or lunch with coworkers for upscale ish Mexican food (chevys +) since it's in the fidi. It's also large so you can generally get in without too much wait. Outdoor seating when it's nice out is also a huge plus. 

Get margaritas by the pitcher and fresh guacamole.
author: Daniela J.

description:
I went here for dinner with my boyfriend one evening. While the décor is beautiful, I was not impressed with my meal. 

We each ordered the three taco plate, and we had an order of guacamole, and two beers. This tab ended up running over 75$. 

I grew up in Texas so I may be spoiled, but I have had Mexican food of all varieties ranging from taco truck to gourmet, and have never paid that much for food that was - simply put - mediocre. 

The bar here is beautiful, and has a wide selection. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing, but this place may be better suited for an after-work cocktail than dinner. 

Cheers!
author: Taylor D.

description: Awful. Please dont go. Double guac for $30... ahhahahhaa suck me silly. Never again. Service terrible, orders forgotten. Never again. No smile, no touch. Never again. Quality here quality there but neither here nor there. Never again, never again.
author: Mirza P.

description:
I'll start with the positives: this restaurant is beautiful, spacious, and has ample outdoor seating (with heat lamps for when it gets cold). They take reservations, but smaller parties can usually get a table without a large wait. They have a fun happy hour vibe, especially on warmer days when one can sit outside. 

The so-sos: the food is over priced and really not that good. Overall, it also lacks any unique flavors. San Francisco has a ton of delicious taquerias (yes, I know, they aren't fancy) with way better food that tastes far more authentic than what Rosa offers. 

Brace yourself for the negatives: not only I, but at least two other people I know of, have found hair in their food - yuck. Of course, the staff is quick to rectify this, but it makes one wonder about the hygiene. This last visit included a strand of hair in the queso, and that has made me question if I would ever come back here for food (I'd come for the drinks).
author: Sejal D.

description:
Hola Amigos, Tequila & Margarita drinkers, authentic Mexican food connoisseur, was so excited to try the food and drink here! 

Here is my executive summary:-

-Pros, location, location, location. Good food, good service, drinks galore, friendly bartenders, authentic Mexican food. 

-Cons.. $$$$.. holy moly! This is the most expensive Mexican food, I have ever paid for! I mean, I understand your rent is high, but c'mon man ..

Apparently I didn't get that memo & arrived at the end if happy hour (4-6). The bar area went from super super busy to empty within 15 mins.. lol.. 

Ordered a few drinks, ceviche camarones, and tres enchiladas. Both tasted really fresh, enhiladas were rich, and very nice presentation :) check came at $125+

I'll come back, but only during HH :) 

Adiós Amigos!
author: Nawar F.

description: OK OK I read the reviews of this place and I have to say, the food that we ordered was really delicious.  We came during Happy Hour on our way to a  celebration and ordered the Carnitas tacos - 2 of them for $8.50.  If they tasted lousy, I would complain but they were probably the most delicious tacos I have eaten!  I really dislike thick corn tortillas  their tortillas were very thin and very good.  The carnitas were moist and very flavorful.      We sat at the bar and were very well taken care of.  We got chips and salsa right away and I asked for hotter salsa - our server gave us some green salsa which was the bomb!   Yes, the HH is probably the most popular time at this place as their prices are high.  You cannot go wrong with after work cocktails, a couple of tacos off of the bar menu and chips and salsa!
author: Ginger O.

description: Rosa Mexicano is my go to Mexican restaurant in SF! Food and service is amazing. They have a very unique way of prepping their food which really makes the flavors stand out... don't forget to try the Guacamole "AMAZING"!!!
author: Michael P.

description: Seems like a total tourist trap. Got some takeout, and the food was very very mediocre but still pricey. The interior was very nice so it seems like it's definitely more glitzy than substance.
author: Izzat A.

description: I like to enjoy Mexican food and usually get traditional food at a taqueria nearby me. However, I was in the Embarcadero area with my family and Rosa Mexicano was in the corner of our eyes. The outdoor sitting really caught our eyes, so we walked in. The staff kept smiling and the food came out at a timely manner. I got the regular size guac and it was freshly made. I also got a chicken casear salad for my main course. If you're looking for a nice meetup location to meet someone for drinks, this is your place. I wouldn't recommend this place for a heavy, full course meal, but a small bite here is worth your time.
author: Merrilyn W.

description: I've eaten dinner here twice and been to happy hour several times with friends. This is my new go-to when I want Mexican food and a very pleasant dining experience. All of the staff are friendly and helpful. Service is fast, great tacos and guac, and the frozen margaritas are delish. They have a nice patio and the inside is super cute too. All of the dishes are beautiful and tasty.
author: Hannah C.

description: Was craving fish tacos, and stumbled into this place. Very yummy! The fish crumbled apart, in the best way possible. The tacos are beer battered. I would have preferred them grilled. With the happy hour special, I got two tacos and was very full, almost uncomfortably so. The salsa had a really great flavor as well!
author: Angel B.

description:
Do not go here. Save your money. Food and staff (service) are not worth the overpriced slop that they serve. 

The staff are EXTREMELY rude. The bald headed host is a lot of words that I cannot even say on this site. The restaurant was nearly empty and open table had plenty of open reservations, but the only table we were offered as a walk in was this tiny, kids looking shared table pushed up against a window. I told this absolutely horrible host that there is lots of reservations available on open table and booked one and he told me to wait until the reservation time in Open table until I could be seated in an basically empty restaurant.
author: Dan S.

description: worst service ever!!! sitting here now!!! seems like i'm invisible!!! luckily my 9 year old daughter is a trooper.. i would have left 20 mins ago!! avoid this place at all cost.. horrible horrible staff!!
author: Frank M.

description:
A direct quote from my husband: "This is probably the best food I will ever taste. Everything else is meaningless."

Definitely try the guacamole!
author: Karen N.

description:
Came here for a weekday lunch with some old coworkers who work nearby. Our group had reservations, but when I walked in around 11:45 it wasn't that full. Nevertheless, I would recommend reservations, because why not?

We started out with two orders of their 'famous tableside guacamole ($15)', which is prepared by their server...you guessed it, tableside. It's an interesting idea, but we were all chatting and catching up and didn't pay much attention to our server, so the novelty of having it prepared tableside was lost on us. As for the guacamole, we all agreed it was on the salty side. And since I personally can't stand cilantro, I had fun picking out all the cilantro out of the guac as I was eating it. And trust me, they put a lot in...

Ordered the fish tacos ($17) for my entree and I was also not particularly impressed. The fish came in big chunks that were a bit dry and not flavored very well, and since I opted not to use their tartar sauce as it was spicy, the whole taco was super bland. There was a bowl of beans that came with someone else's meal on the table, and I started using some of the beans for flavor by the end.

For how much I paid for this meal, I was very underwhelmed. Would not come back again, but some people at the table seemed to enjoy their food.

Service was pretty good. Our server came to check up on us frequently enough.
author: Dianna H.

description:
I really dislike to tip this low but, I must!

Things that went well:
1. Very beautiful interior with many tables and clean atmosphere.
2. Seated at my requested table in a timely manner (on a booth by the window)
3. Benjamin, the waiter was amiable and greeted me as soon as I sat and checked in on me regularly.
4. Enchiladas with chicken were soft and tender. My friend told me green sauce resembled a delicious pasta dish.
5. The salsa. 



3 things that could have been better:
1. Pricey avocado dip $15 (did not receive the full experience of having a rolled cart to my table and having it prepped in front of me) I did not know this was a thing, till I looked at picture through yelp after, now this confirms that I did not get my monies worth. My friend recommended me to try Rosa Mexicano's Guacamole and I held high expectations but was disappointed.
2. Server forgot my drink order. (I gave him time 10-15 min but, I had to ask a busser if he could get Benjamin for me. He said sorry, brought the drinks asap and I decided to upgrade my 20 ounce sangria into a 60 ounce. So he was kind enough to not charge me the 20 ounce but, just the 60 ounce.
3. Maybe some limes could have increased the flavor of the enchiladas, but it's fine the way it was. The Guacamole could have used more limes.

Overall, I enjoyed but, do wish I get my full guacamole experience when I come back and will notify my server within the range of 5-10min if my drink does not come out of the bar in time.
author: Jray M.

description: My friends and I came here for happy hour. Typically happy hour food should be cheaper, but they had various tacos and quesadillas for $8.50. You got two tacos each order. That's $4.25 per taco. Muy expensivo, especially for happy hour. The food itself wasn't bad, but nothing out of this world. Service was slow and we had to ask twice for certain things. We also ordered patron shots, but we're not confident that what was given to us was patron.
author: Annie L.

description:
Decent upscale Mexican, not the best I've ever had.

I've been here for Happy Hour (Friday around 4pm) and lunch (11:30am)- this review refers mainly to the lunch.

Venue: both times we sat outside because the weather was good.  The umbrellas are big enough that they provide lot of shade.  The walking areas were a bit narrow so you had to watch where you were walking.  Inside looked decently lit with large windows though the sunny day may have helped with that.

Service: generally was good; slightly slower than I'm used too but not so bad that we had to wave the staff down.  Did take us a while to get our drinks/ water but food came out relatively quickly.  They'll check in once or twice during the meal to make sure you don't need anything.

Food:  interesting how they have 3 different menus for lunch; regular, gluten-free, and vegetarian.  Was in awe at how much variety there was on the gluten-free and vegetarian menus (huge plus for those with dietary restrictions).  
- Queso Fundido ($11.50) - sooooooo good if you are a cheese lover!  Definitely a shared dish for 4+ people though, especially if you are thinking of ordering something else
- Pescado a la Parilla tacos ($17) - they give you three tacos and esquites on the side (corn with cheese and chili of some sort).  The corn was tasty but slightly spicy for my liking.  The corn tortillas (one per taco) were nice and supple, but not so thin that it would break apart while eating.  The jalapeno tartar sauce had a strong kick, but unfortunately the grilled fish itself was severely under-seasoned that the whole dish tasted bland, even with the tartar sauce.  It definitely needed salt to drive the flavors forward, especially when the bland fish rested on top of cabbage which... let's face it... doesn't taste like much when raw.  
- White sangria ($9 for a glass) - was kinda disappointed with this one, because the overall feeling of drinking it was kinda heavy and stickingly sweet at the back of my throat (not the best thing on a warm day).  Also didn't help that there was a lot of triple sec / apricot brandy in it which, when mixed with cucumber, made it a bit bitter in the aftertaste in my opinion.  

Not the best Mexican I've ever eaten, but definitely not the worst.  Maybe I just ordered the wrong things so stay tuned for any updates!
author: Audrey H.

description: Great Service, delicious sangria, delicate flavorful menu. My new favorite place for classy Mexican cuisine.
author: Galia R.

description:
This place must survive off corporate and conference events.  In a city with so much good Mexican food, there's no way a restaurant that's this expensive could possibly survive with such mediocre food and awful service.  

Lunch for me and four friends came out to just under $50 a head, for which we each got one entree and one drink, and shared an order of guacamole.  My roast pork chamorro was cooked fine, but lacked any seasoning.  That might have been okay with some hot sauce, but of course, my waiter never brought any.  My Allende white ale ($10!!) was advertised as being on tap, but came in a bottle.  The guacamole was actually pretty flavorful, but we didn't get very much of it for $16, and despite asking us how spicy we wanted it ("very spicy"), there was literally zero spice in the guac.

Service was just awful.  Food took over an hour to arrive, and was supposed to come with fresh corn tortillas, but of course, came with none.  Our waiter took our order and never came around again -- we had to walk around the restaurant to hunt him down to ask for tortillas and hot sauce, which he completely ignored.  When it came time to pay, we had to hunt our waiter down a second time just to get the check.  

SF has plenty of overpriced Mexican food, but it tends to be tasty.  There's also plenty of mediocre Mexican food, but it tends to be cheap.  There is just no reason for a place like this to exist.
author: Matt Y.

description:
I walked in and was seated in the restaurant section very promptly. There was one big party that filled the whole restaurant with laughter. The first thing the waiter asked was for drinks and then if I wanted some guacamole. If the first thing a waiter recommends in guacamole, it must be something special. I looked at the menu after I ordered and realized it was $15! I wished I brought people, since I just ordered a family's worth of guac. 

Within a couple mins a guac chef rolled out this professional cart all decked out with guac ingredients. I didn't catch if she mashed the avocados directly in front of me since my waiter was inquiring about my next order, but it sure seemed like it. Often quac is overshadowed by a little bit too much lime juice to cover up an aging avocado, but this monstrous bowl was super creamy and very filling.

I was recommended the Tinga de Res, a beef brisket based Taco. This restaurant must really pride freshness as it looked like the guy who served it to me literally just made and plated it himself. The meat looks a little dry appearance wise, but it's got this moist chewiness hidden on the inside mixed in with quite a nice mild spicy kick. The outside shell is also mildly chewy and I'd prefer a little thinner. The corn on the side was well plated and very buttery taste.

Summary - good vibes, bring ppl, and okay value.
author: Dion L.

description:
It's all about the Happy Hour. I don't eat meat.  If you do - my review will probably be useless LOL.  But, I digress.  Since, I do not eat meat, my choices were limited.  I loved the black beans and rice, sangria, chips and salsa.  I also like the ambiance and the high seated chairs at the bar.  The restaurant is very close to other places I frequent.  Their main menu is quite pricey.  So, I do not see myself diving into their main entrees. 
 But, I could definitely go back for Happy Hour.
author: Shonda D.

description:
We came in on a Friday night after making a reservation. It seemed like the staff is overwhelmed. 
Everything took too long, from ordering to waiting for the check. 
Water was never refilled, we were never offered anything after the initial cocktails and both dinner and the check took way too long.
The pescado primavera was good, but came with about a third of a barely cooked onion. 
The fresh-made guacamole is clearly the star of the show, and it was indeed tastey.
But don't go when the place is busy.
author: Lisa D.

description: Jason the bartender was the highlight of our lunch very energetic and fun, keep him around all the other bartenders were very serious, which kills the vibe if you ask me!  Will definitely keep coming if he's around . Great service
author: Rafa C.

description:
When I worked in SF we could come here for Happy Hour since it was in a nice spot and easy to get too. The food is meh, if you come here just go for the margaritas. I will say the salsa isn't that great and they give you such a pathetic portion, they serve it in a spoon dish LOL I laughed when I saw that and said you'll need to bring about 50 of these bad boys.

There aren't many Mexican food spots around the area so this is really it unless you go further into the city or down the Embarcadero. I would recommend traveling a little more if you want to eat. Not to mention this spot is pricey for what it's worth.
author: Mal L.

description: If i could give it a zero star I would! The service is beyond lousy. The foods mediocre and the drinks are super weak. Worst waiters ever.
author: Dee Dee H.

description:
Came here solo for a weeknight dinner while staying the hood for a one night work trip. The hotel was around corner, I was lazy and I had eaten at other locations before and had thought it was fine.

Walked in to a basically empty restaurant, but waited 5 mins to be sat at the bar, then 10 mins to be given a menu. 

Order the fish special, first time I was raw to the point of being still frozen on the inside, sent it back, waited 30 mins to be serve fish over cooked to the point of being jerky like. Sides salty to the point of almost inedible. 

No apology was given, cold chips and stale salsa were offered to hold me over. 

So. I dunno 0.5 stars?
author: Ginger X.

description: Came here to celebrate 5 de mayo with friends. I ordered the assorted enchiladas and they where delicious. Their white sangria drinks where also delicious. I loved the decor and the indoor waterfall was beautiful. I spent around $80 just on 1 drink, the enchiladas, shared guacamole, tip & "sf healthy produce tax" (whatever that is). But over all it was a good experience!
author: Mabel A.

description:
There's no SF restaurant week menus. They are bullshitting customers.
All dishes are present in the menu and they don't serve them.
author: Yury R.

description:
- Ordered guac for appetizer. Tasted very fresh, and had the perfect amount of salt/pepper on top.
- For main course had the chile poblano relleno. Filling vegetarian entree, but was not a huge fan of the chayote on the side.
- Decent ambience, and server was helpful. However, my coworkers ordered an entree that wasn't available so they had to change.
author: Abhi M.

description:
This place is spectacular
Very cool design and great food. 
Don't Forget to try their tableside guacamole. 
Ornin, the managaer, provided us with exceptional customer service; professional & extremely nice!
author: Robert P.

description: Super crowded, lively restaurant that draws in mostly the finance, after work crowds. Would recommend only for the happy hour as the food is not amazing given the price. The frozen margarita machine was also broken which was a bummer for our party.
author: Joanna L.

description: This place was really good . The service wasn't the  best because the main server in our section got busy so know one came by to ask us if we wanted something to drink and by the time they did we were ready to order . We finally got our drinks 2 mins before our food came out. The restaurant seemed kind of slow so it was more of an organizational thing. Once our waitress  was able to take care of us she was great. it's good Mexican closer to gourmet style Mexican rather than your traditional Mexican spots.. I had the chicken flautas the guac and the enchiladas. All were good .
author: Jeff N.

description:
I only got to stop in for 20 minutes during a happy hour with friends, but what I saw was excellent! The interior was super awesomely decorated, and we all sat around a slice of a tree trunk that was able to fit maybe 20 people. 

The staff seemed to be super attentive while we were settling down, always attending to filling up water and asking us if we had everything.

We ordered the spicy guacamole and some nachos. While I didn't get to try the nachos, I did gorge myself on the guac; I couldn't stop myself, it was so good, and the slight spicy kick made it all the more better!

I can't wait to come back here and get some more chips and guac.
author: John B.

description:
HORRIBLE tasteless food. Drinks are horrible. Salsa was bad.

Only good things - location location location. Good view of the bay bridge. Good outdoor seating and decent service. Ok prices for downtown SF.

Can't make up for the bad food!
author: Briana L.

description: Some friends and I were hanging out in the city a couple of weeks ago. We sat at the bar. It was a great vibe. The bartenders were super nice to us. The best thing was their margaritas!! They were so delicious. Not too pricey. I wish they had happy hour on the weekends that would be nice. But other then that, I will be going back!!!
author: Jose L.

description:
Yummy but pricey. $16 for a margarita is quite a stretch... churros were good and so were the empanadas and mole taquitos. 
Close to bart, so it's a plus!
author: Sara P.

description: Food is average.  I had the carnitas and the ceviche.  Guac is good but the chips are really salty. This place gets busy and loud and service can be slow.
author: Andrew S.

description:
There's lots to love about this place. Their special all vegetarian (or gluten free) menu. Their outdoor patio area great for people watching in the sun. Their waiter who was so excited about their hibiscus tea that he let us bring home our own bag sample to try. 

However I felt the food was not up to par with the rest. The chips were bland, the guac was plain, and my budin de choyate (despite being big and beautiful) wasn't tasty enough for me to even want to box home. Although I saw the different ingredients, I could only taste tortilla mush. The side of plantains were good, but had the potential to be superduperamazeballs if they just drizzled on something sweet.

Everyone else has similar opinions about their entrees, perhaps they excel more on their expensive dishes? 

I did enjoy the churros for dessert, but who can deny fried sugary goodness covered in chocolate? 

No issues at all with service, although sometimes had trouble understanding our waiter.
author: Katy Q.

description:
The service is awful. They need to retrain their Staff. Our waitress was the worst. I don't think
She had any prior experience.

Other than that, everything was delicious. The food, guacamole, tacos and drinks we all phenomenal! Will be coming back!
author: Julz M.

description:
Have come in here multiple times after work. Must say I'm not the hugest fan, but my co-workers love it so I go along. It is pretty decent overall and I'll keep going. 

It is a pretty solid staple spot. I'd say a bit upscale Mexican food. Nothing incredibly pops, but it's good overall and the drinks are strong.

The margaritas are the highlight. I have had a few different ones and hands down the best was the pomegranate. Sweet but not overkill. They are STRONG. Also a bit overpriced but hey, it's SF. 

The salsa is meh at best. They push guacamole like it's a drug. It's also ok, but not stellar. And not cheap. $15 for guac is a bit high, but again...SF. 

The happy hour prices on some of the foods are good. For example, the quesadillas are like $6 and it's legit! 

I am yet to come have a full meal, so that could sway my thoughts one way or the other.
author: Sean M.

description:
Rosa Mexicano really should be three dollar signs.  The food is high scale and higher priced than your average Mexican taqueria.  The cocktails were actually very well made.  The margarita and tequilia selection was the most enjoyable part of the evening.  The interior decor was actually pretty nice with high ceilings and plenty of luxury modern decorative touches all around the room.  Service was actually pretty good too.

Only downsides: $$$ high pricing and a very loud room that makes it hard to talk.  I love a good margarita and guac with chips but it seems like one round of drinks and chips will probably set me back $50.  They do make the guac tableside but it does get tiresome staring at the person making it with our chips in hand...
author: Ben H L.

description: The food is amazing and the service is some of the best I've ever experienced. Highly recommend coming here!
author: Shannon B.

description:
This place is a fancy Mexican restaurant that tastes bland but is expensive AF. 

 Next time someone order tacos and a side of corn you should mention that the corn is already a side that comes with the tacos (It does not mention that the corn is already a side with the tacos anywhere on the menu in person or online) So thanks for the $30 lunch tab
author: Alexis M.

description:
I came here 1 week ago to have a social dinner with my boyfriend's former coworkers. I ordered Tinga de Res which came with three tacos (I forgot to take photos). Honestly, being someone who has tasted SoCal tacos, this is absolute crap. First of all, the taco tortillas weren't heated. It tasted as if they were pulled out of a plastic bag and assembled into a taco just like that. The tortillas themselves tasted like those you can buy from grocery stores.

I had pretty high expectations since this is a restaurant and it looked classy. However, I learned that the setting and ambience of a restaurant does not define the quality of food. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to those who want authentic Mexican food.
author: Jeanne P.

description:
The guacamole is the big draw to get you in the door and sharing a nice molcajete with friends.  The main dishes aren't as good as their Mission equivalents, are much pricier and take an unreasonably long time to prepare (about an hour when ordered at noon).  You're probably better off coming here for Happy Hour drinks and snacks (which they do well) and then hopping on the BART to the Mission for dinner.

Guacamole en Molcajete: You can't go to Rosa Mexicano and miss the guacamole made table-side (or, table-adjacent, in our case).  Not pasty like that pre-made green goo you pay extra for at Chipotle.  The chips are warm, thick and crunchy.  Also, the chipotle and tomatillo salsas provided a nice "light" bite between heaps of guacamole.  The only unfortunate side effect is that you can get pretty filled up and not finish your main.

Carnitas: I liked the idea of assembling my own taco from meat on a cast iron skillet.  Kinda like a bougie take on Chili's fajitas.  Unfortunately, it didn't come out sizzling.  In fact, the pork and pineapple felt lukewarm.  The carnitas themselves weren't crispy enough for my liking.  In the hole-in-the-wall taquerias in the Mission, the pork seems longer and thinner and crispier all over.  Also, the tortilla-to-filling ratio was way too low.  I still had half my skillet left once I rolled my four tacos.  And they seemed a bit skimpy on the salsas and sour cream too.
author: Adam B.

description:
While they're expensive, it's very rare to find proper queso fundido anywhere: some chorizo and peppers atop a whole lot of Chihuahua cheese with a side of corn tortillas? That's a meal right there!

(This is NOT to be confused with the "Velveeto notsofundido" you so often find being fobbed off as the real thing at other places. Hint: if it's yellow, thin, forms a skin after a while or otherwise stays liquid, it ain't queso fundido! It's nacho cheese. It may have previously resided in a can. On a shelf. At a warehouse club.)

Also, the made-at-your-table guacamole is really good. When they ask if you want it spicy, be prepared for *spicy* (another oddity is how many restaurants interpret "spicy" as "somewhat hot"... there's no grade inflation here when it comes to Scoville units.)

Finally, the three enchilada plate is commendable and satisfying (the mole sauce is excellent).

I'm not a fan of fish so I can't speak to that, but as a rare place that's both tasty and has real queso fundido I'm quite pleased with it.
author: Marty F.

description: Sad Mexican food. The rice was so bland rice a roni is better. The beans were horrid bland as well and the service was terrible. There was none in the restaurant and yet the server took forever to bring the check. Overpriced for trash food .
author: Vanessa L.

description:
A friend and I stopped here last Saturday (6/23/18) after we attended the Pride event.  It was our first time.  The decor is beautiful, especially the water that flows down the wall over the tile which reminds me of abalone shell.  The Mexican music playing over the sound system was not too loud and very upbeat.  Everyone that served us was very friendly, attentive and helpful, especially the gentleman that took our order.  The free salsa and chips were tasty and fresh.  We ordered the guacamole which came in a dark stone container that reminded me of a Mayan artifact.  Definitely one of the best guacamoles I've ever had.  You can request different levels of spiciness.  They brought us samples of the enchilada sauces to taste.  They were all good, but the mole was exceptional.  I've had it before at other places and never liked it, but Rosa's version was amazing and changed my opinion on mole sauce.

Unfortunately, I was already too full to order as much as I would like, but my friend ordered the three enchiladas and loved them.  I ordered the Sopa de Tortilla and it was unlike any other I've ever had and I mean that in a good way.  The chicken was mouth-watering and flavorful, the broth was divine--darker than I've seen before, and there was a slice of avocado in the toppings.  You could taste the Chef's pride in everything.  

Yes, it's a bit more expensive than some places, but it's in the financial district and rents are high.  We felt the price was worth it since the service was top notch and everything tasted wonderful.  You can tell by the flavor that they put a lot of effort into the preparation.

My friend liked Rosa's so much that it's now her favorite Mexican restaurant, leapfrogging to the top of the list past another restaurant she has liked for years!  She said, "All food was fantastic and the service was first class."  We were told that there had been some issues there before, but they have a new manager and changes have been implemented.  I couldn't have been happier with the entire experience and I give them 5 stars!  We will be going back in a few weeks to try their brunch.
author: John H.

description:
We ordered the enchiladas and they came out cold and then they took forever to bring them back out. The service is horrible we had to keep asking other waiters for help. 

The guacamole is such a waste of money, $16 FOR ONE AVOCADO!!

Chips are cold and we asked for warm chips and they brought us MORE COLD ONES!

Everyone is rude and food sucks. Do not recommend to anyone, especially when there are so many other places to eat in the city!
author: Brittany N.

description:
My girlfriends and I were meeting up Bobby L for dinner. Since we were right around the corner at Americano and it had just started pouring rain, we decided to go to Rosa Mexicano. I made a reservation about an hour before through OpenTable for Thursday, March 10th at 7:30pm.

Being the thirsty person I am, I ordered a pitcher of Sangría de Rosa Mexicano: Red wine, apricot brandy, triple sec, fresh orange, pineapple, cucumber and apple ($36 for 60 oz pitcher). Luckily, one of my gfs said she'd help me drink it. It was smooth and fruity with a little slight alcoholic punch. The rest of our party had wine. A Cabernet Sauvignon: Sean Miner, Napa, California ($10 glass) ×2 and a Malbec: Llama, "Old Vines", Mendoza, Argentina ($8 glass).

*Guacamole en Molcajete: Famous Tableside Preparation - Since 1984, preparing freshly made guacamole with avocado, jalapeno, tomato, onion and cilantro, Served with warm tortilla chips and salsa ($15)
*Empanadas de Pollo con Chorizo: Corn masa empanadas stuffed with Shredded chicken, Mexican chorizo and Menonita cheese, served with mestiza crema ($11)
*Flautas de Pollo: Crispy corn tortillas filled with chicken tinga, topped with salsa pasilla de Oaxaca, salsa verde, queso fresco and crema ($10)
*Ceviche de Camarones: Wild shrimp marinated in citrus with avocado, jalapeno, cucumber, jicama, mint, chile de arbol, red plum and yellow teardrop tomatoes ($15) ×2
*Elotes: Mexican Street Corn ($6)

We started with the guac. It's prepared tableside which I adored since we could tell them the spice level we wanted. I love everything super spicy, but some in our party can't handle spice. I ended up getting a side of jalapenos so I could add some to the guac as I was eating it. I got the flauntas which were just eh. I felt like there was too much going on in terms of toppings and sauce. It was crunchy, but I wanted more flavor from the chicken. The enjoyed the elote I ordered. The corn was cooked nicely for me. Not overcooked and mushy. Yum!

The ambiance here is festive. I think we were one of the last parties there and they never made us feel rushed which was much appreciated. Easy and fun given our last minute dinner planning.
author: Elena N.

description: Absolutely waste of money. Worst service very slow and worst food. Would never come back and doesn't recommend it. Big NOOOO..
author: Bhumi T.

description: Ordered takeout, three chicken tacos ($19) and guacamole (16$!) The tacos were the worst I've ever had. The chicken itself was not cut up well and had zero flavor. They came comprised of some corn tortillas, melted cheese and some soggy peppers next to an enormous amount of corn. Came with a side of rice and beans, both totally tasteless. The guacamole was okay, except for the large pieces of cilantro that were awkward to chew in each bite. I could eat Mexican food for every meal, I love it that much, but this one took the cake for worst taco ever.
author: Alexander C.

description:
Please don't spoil your meal with this place unless you prefer to wait for 1.5 hours and then get bagged food that's missing the meal for birthday girl! 
We were celebrating our colleagues birthday and they took 30 minutes to take order and after 45 minutes didn't show up with our food. Once we asked to-go, they packed wrong and missing items. 

We were not the only ones undergoing this pain of spoiled birthday and Friday lunch!
author: Sachin P.

description:
It's not your standard Mexican restaurant chain menu; however, it is middle of the road at best in terms of the caliber of their menu items. Though tasty, gaucamole made from a single avacado for $15 is simply overpriced. Same with the drinks, $16 for a Margarita. Beans and rice were served together in the same small bowl which was insufficient for 4 people. We asked about alterations to several menu items and were told the items were already prepared. The service was mediocre. Several times we needed to flag down our server to receive service. The restaurant itself is within a block and a half from the Embarcadaro BART station. The bay is one block to the east which is nice. 

In general, over priced and below expectation for what was delivered. I recommend to those looking to dine near the Embarcadaro to consider other dining options.
author: Paul N.

description: I don't the the price was worth the dish I got. I ordered the Alambre de Mexicano. The meat was so tender! But I wish there were more cubes of steak. Rice was nicely spiced, chorizo had good flavor, and the peppers were (a little too) spicy. Best part about this place was the fresh guacamole they chopped up and served right next to your table.
author: Serena W.

description:
Rude and nasty people, they hate Whites but love their money. We went in for a margarita but were brainwashed into eating dinner. Next thing you know we wait at a table while our old table is taken up by a crowd. I asked was that the reason you pushed us out. No, of course not. Sure, thing is the food was OK, but all this not worth the hassle. I also did not see ONE White person or any other ethnic group work here. WHY.
I thought this city was about diversity.
author: Doc S.

description: Over-priced, half-hipster BS. I threw half the food away. I cannot believe some people like the guacamole; $16 for a tiny container? And the container couldn't even be filled at least 3/4??? Only in San Francisco. I placed an order to-go over the phone and when I got there it took a while to be greeted, so it's very unorganized. I've said it before on other reviews, these workers get too complacent with the money tourists throw at this since these places are along the Embarcadero area and where most visitors stay. They need a reality check. Pics to come soon.
author: Marquis A.

description:
I've been here a couple times with a friend who really likes it, but both times I was left unimpressed. The location is nice since it's just a short walk from the embarcadero bart station. 

Now I like their homemade guac which is really fresh and you can control how spicy you want it, and their sangria is pretty good too. I always get suckered into getting the 20 oz because it's just $4 more! But I've never really enjoyed the entrees. This time I got the shrimp quesadilla and was looking forward to cheesy shrimp goodness, but the shrimp were tiny and covered in some spicy too salty sauce. I honestly couldn't tell if it was shrimp at first, it almost seemed like beef or pork :/ Luckily I enjoyed the sides, but will probably suggest going somewhere else next time we go out in the area.
author: Denise H.

description:
I've only been here for happy hour, so this review must be taken with a grain of salt (although any place with a good happy hour is one I'll support!).

They've got a good deal for pitchers of margaritas on happy hour, and they've even got happy hour late on a Friday night.  Awesome.  The margaritas were good, nothing amazing.  Chips and salsa are also good, nothing amazing.

It's a pretty big restaurant with a lot of seating, and an outdoor area.  The hostesses and waitresses were also very friendly and handled our large group flawlessly even when we walked in and took up one of their largest tables.  It's a good spot for a large group, and for happy hour.  Location is also nice - close to Bart and on Mission st.!
author: Kenna H.

description:
They serve the best guacamole I had in SF. The guacamole is prepared fresh in front of you. The first time I've been there they just made it for our group. It might depend on the size of the group.

They asked us how spicy we wanted it. I still didn't thought it was as spicy as expected, but it was tasty and fresh without any doubt. 

The food I had in my two visits was good. It has a fresh taste. And it's one of the few Mexican places where they don't put cilantro on everything.
author: Dario S.

description: I booked this place for dinner expecting a nice dining experience. The food was good, but the ambiance sucked! I've gone to the Rosa Mexicano in DC, which is a beautiful restaurant. So, I was expecting the same here.. not so much.
author: Shenna J.

description:
The worst experience ever! After entering into an empty restaurant of chit chatting employees, I was told my to go order was not ready and they it would be 5 more minutes. After waiting for ten minutes while the host chit chatted with the server in front of me, I checked in on my order. This is when she realized she never put it in. She tried to
Play it off as no big deal and I told her to cancel the order and I left. One star because zero is not an option.
author: Mike R.

description:
Rosa Mexicano is a chain of upscale restaurants - that being said, I don't think you can compare it with the SF local taquerias. The location is near the Ferry Building, in an area of many upscale restaurants. I would not come here if I wasn't already here, meaning I would not seek out this restaurant but I don't complain if I am here.

I like the drinks, they have some really nice cocktails and a lovely set of appetizers and a nice happy hour menu. They have lots of vegetarian (or gluten free) options too.
author: Shannon Z.

description: I recently ate lunch at Rosa Mexicano and the service was awful. We waited 25 minutes to place our order then had to wait another 40 minutes for our food to arrive. During that time our server was MIA and the one time we did see him we asked for a drink refill and he never came back. To add insult to injury we were sitting in a completely tented off patio and there were pigeons inside aggressively swooping by our heads. Then they all descended on the table next to ours eating all the leftover food because the restaurant took so long to clean off the tables. When I asked them to please get rid of the pigeons the server just shooed the pigeons off the table with her hand which caused them to fly onto some people eating at another table. It was a horrible experience all around.
author: karen f.

description: A-W-E-S-O-M-E!!!!!  I took Mom today for Mother's day and was not disappointed!  First, we were greeted by the General Manager, Dan Munteanu and shown to our window side table - lot's of light and great for people watching.  Our waiter, Jorge arrived immediately with menus, water and fresh homemade chips and salsa.  We chose the guacamole made table side and house margaritas to start - sooooo good!  I had the salmon special in a delicious mole sauce which was so ridiculously fresh and tender.  Mom had the Tampiqueña de Carne Asada - tender marinated skirt steak with perfect char from the grill that comes with a cheese enchilada.  a healthy serving of beans and rice was also served.  Ok, Mom and I gab and catch up like crazy on our outings but this meal rendered us happily speechless as we chowed down on some of the best Mexican in the area!  As an SF native, I know my way around the Mission and great Mexican.  I can guarantee you will never be disappointed at Rosa's as the food is unique (not your average taqueria), fresh and so perfectly seasoned they don't have salt and pepper on the table (a testament to a restaurant knowing what they're doing).  Beautiful surroundings with a blend of traditional Mexican and contemporary flare.  I would highly recommend Rosa's!  Happy hour, lunch, dinner and, of course, celebrations!  Thank you!!!
author: Q M.

description: Excellent Mexican food.  Maybe the best in my Life.  Red wine is excellent.  Prices are high on non happy hour food but it's excellent.  Love the Salmon salad.  Also Guac not to be missed.  Excellent.
author: Matt H.

description:
Great Guacamole, OK Carnitas!

I've been to Rosa Mexicano a few times, but this is my first review which unfortunately I am writing after my least impressive meal there! In the past I have tried various appetizers and entrees and they all have been delicious and impressive in their presentation. This time I ordered the Carnitas and it was not good! I found it to be too greasy and too overdone. I like the crunchy parts, and I would love to have some of it on my carnitas as it adds flavor, but I would not like it to be 75% or more crunchy!

The guacamole on the other hand made up for whatever that the carnitas lacked; well, almost!

The service was good, and our server was very attentive. The setting was, as usual, very nice and comfortable.
author: Afshin A.

description: Went here with a party of 9.  Restaurant has very good ambiance.  They have guacamole they make tableside.  The guacamole was delicious.  I'm rating it at 2 stars because we ordered 9 different dishes. The veggie quesadillas and the carne Asada were good. No one in our party liked any other the other dishes.  The Chile Pablano Relleno is probably one of the worst I have ever tasted.  I also got the Elotes.  That was good.  I wouldn't go back here. Food lacks any flavor.
author: Anita S.

description: Brought my boss here on a Saturday night knowing he's one of the hardest people to please. To my surprise the food made him feel right at home. And shoutout to Angela the bartender for the great drinks and excellent service we'll definitely be back soon.
author: Donminic W.

description:
Ceviche had good taste but only 3 shrimps so in that case over priced jimica salad.
The salmon I requested medium was bitter chared and way over cooked. Enchiladas had no taste. Drinks were watered down. Churros were dripping grease and crunchy but not warm and soft in the inside. The place was empty on a Saturday night and still extremely slow. Definately not returning.
author: DJ. N.

description:
Came here on a Saturday afternoon for lunch and got seated immediately. The space is really large, and has a decent ambience.

Fresh made guacamole was very tasty. Also had the grilled salmon in a creamy poblano sauce which was very tasty but the salmon was grilled a little much. 

Will be back to try some of the other stuff
author: Jardin M.

description: Amazing place, good food, nice vibe, excellent service. Went there for my birthday, few days ago, I had a very good time, me & my friends gonna go back.
author: Ioana J.

description:
Location is as good as it gets , with water view and convenience. Make an Open Table reservation and they'll seat you immediately. Otherwise expect a wait on weekends.
The guacamole they prepare table-side was delicious on my first visit but just ok on my second visit.  Too much cilantro perhaps the second time which gave it a bitter taste. The cucumber mint lemonade was refreshing and tasty. We had 3 different types of "build your own tortilla" meals to share - chicken , steak , and shrimp , each came on an iron skillet.
