The steak did not taste the quality steak I'm used to, I had one small slice and was put off by it. The chicken was ok but bland. The right amount of  basic salt and pepper would have sufficed though. The shrimp was also quite bland and looked as though they were steamed instead and just placed over the cast iron.  The tortillas did not taste good at all. One person at the table said they tasted like rubber (?) and my 8 year old asked why they had a weird taste. A disappointment, but we filled up on chips as they were delicious. Since there was plenty of room for dessert we ordered churros and I'm happy to report they were very good. I don't believe I'll be testing my luck with a 3rd visit here.
author: Hoda A.

description:
Overall, it was a disappoint experience. Drinks were tasty which is why there is one star, but the food is not worth it.

I was at a work function, and I wish there was a server just for our section due to drinks and food taking 25+ mins to get to us. I can understand that it was busy but this was appalling.

The food was bland, tasteless and uninventive. We had the following:

Quesadilla de Tinga de Res: Meat at least tastied good, but nothing amazing.
Quesadilla de Rajas: I did not get any, but it was fine, said my coworker.
Tinga de Res: Watery and flavorless
Pescado a la Parilla: FIsh was overcooked and tasted burned. DId like the sauce on top.
Camarones Capeados:Allergic, but my co-worker said it was good.
Mestiza: Weird mole taste.
Chips with Guca and Salsa: Guca was a little salty in certain parts and bland in the other.
author: Mei L.

description: $26 double vodka sodas? $8 CANS of Tecate????! Subpar $16 guacamole? AND terrible food with no atmosphere? No thanks. Don't waste your time or money here. Literally just don't. lol
author: Nicole M.

description: I have been to Rosa Mexicano several times in the past and service has always been as you would expect from a restaurant like this. It was great! The staff was friendly and engaging. The staff never missed a moment to make the evenings special. Order time takes a while, but it was no problem for us, as the drinks kept us occupied. I really like their Braised Beef Brisket Tacos (they are a million times better than the tacos other restaurants have on their menu). The Guacamole is served in a large bowl, and is big enough for 3 or 4 people.  I always order it to get something fast while I wait for the main course (they also have chips and salsa but I try to avoid them because they seem to be high in calories). If you're ever in the area then I recommend trying Rosa Mexicano out. They aren't perfect, but they are damn near perfection!
author: Leah S.

description: I really don't get all the poor reviews. The only real downside I can see to Rosa Mexicano is the price point. When it came to dinner for two with three drinks in between my girlfriend and I, we paid $150 altogether. A little twinge, but we had a great time, and the food and service were fantastic. $16 for table-made guacamole is a little steep, but it's a show, and the guac is fantastic and well-seasoned. It also comes in a traditional mortar and pestle. What else is good? All of their drinks are about 75% alcohol, so if you're looking for a strong, stiff fix, this is the place. The fish tacos come in threes, and they're really, really good, but my personal favorite was the carnitas. You get freshly made, warm tortillas to go with a large tray of delectable pork and pineapples. You would think the interplay between the large tropic fruit chunks (grilled, by the way) and shredded pork would be a little strange, but it's absolutely fantastic. You also get a tray of 2 salsas and sour cream as adornments. Really good stuff. Would love to come back and eat and drink on the patio.
author: Danny C.

description:
My wife and I ate here 3 times out of the 5 nights we were in town...mostly due to proximity to our hotel.
The first night we kind of splurged on appetizers, cocktails, guac, entrees, desert...and I think its the first time Ive spent $250 on Mexican food.
The 2nd and third meals we came here for a pitcher of Sangria and double order of Guac.  My kids ate a meat taco.  
Really great ambience.  Service was different all three meals...kind of spotty and felt artificial and weird, hard to explain. 
If I was close to this place Id defiantly stop in again for the Pitcher of Sangria and Guac...maybe the empanadas too!

Steve
author: Steve M.

description: Even on Cinco de Mayo (a Mexican restaurant's tax day) the service was amazing.  Friendly, attentive and quick - you were made to feel like a VIP.  The food was excellent and the Ritas were tasty.  But it was truly the above and beyond service that makes this a must stop.  A special shout out to their new GM -  top notch all the way.
author: Y M.

description:
Hoo boy. We really wanted to like this place, but they just kept fucking everything up. The ambiance was great and the menu was impressive, but the wait staff was just clueless. They clearly didn't have an understanding of the menu. First of all, it took forever for us to get service and there were maybe 5-6 tables with customers. I pray that they never have a full house, because they definitely aren't ready. The server brought us our guacamole without chips. My Mom got a chile relleno without cheese. My wife asked for cheese on her mushroom tacos and they completely spaced on it. The margaritas tasted like a mix. 

Then we got the bill. 15 dollars for "table prepared" guacamole? They didn't prepare it at our table, and I've had better for half the price. Then they charged us two more dollars for my wife's tacos and I had to point it out. 

Get it together, yall. You have a good menu, an amazing space and location. Hire some experienced front of house staff.
author: Roman H.

description:
I was having a solid three star experience the other day on their patio.  I enjoyed three cans of Tecate and some chips amongst friends.  The bill then arrives and my Tecates clocked in at $8 a piece.

It was jaw dropping.  $8 for a can of Tecate?!?!?

Shame on me for not checking the price.  Shame on Rosa Mexicano for being extortionate.  And shame on you, my readers, for considering going there.
author: John S.

description: This is a good place for dinner Time, but for lunch it sucks. The quality of the food for lunch is terrible. I had enchiladas today and it truly felt like the tortillas were microwaved or undercooked because they were so hard to cut through. Not crunchy hard, but stiff. Really strange texture, but since it was lunch time, I am assuming that the kitchen is more production based. Other than that, good flavor.
author: Monica F.

description: I had the best experience at Rosa Mexicano today at lunch (~1pm)! I am currently avoiding grains (I know, I know...) and our server noticed I wasn't eating any chips with our guacamole - he proceeded to bring me a plate full of veggie sticks (carrots, celery, jicama) to eat instead. I thought that was so sweet! Our group was 4 people: we were seated quickly, had great, attentive service, delicious food. Definitely a 5-star experience! Our company recently moved into a space about a 5 minute walk away, so I will be telling everyone that this is our new go-to spot for lunch!
author: Riley M.

description:
Discovered this place two weeks ago and instantly became a top favorite for happy hour or even dinner. We enjoy sitting at the bar and have been impressed by the multiple dishes we have tried. You can go wrong and can tell they take pride with the food. Our go to order is the guacamole. The presentation is awesome they make it table side! 
If you plan to visit for happy hour keep in mind it's hard to get spots this place is a hot spot!
author: Danielle C.

description:
Came here for the first time for a company lunch and I loved it. 

The tables first off were definitely interesting, they werent round or square like traditional tables. They were pretty much shaped exactly how the tree might have been shaped which definitely gives this place some character. The waiters were very attentive and always made sure we had everything we needed. 

I ordered a raspberry fresca (no watermelon that day ): ) and it came in a little cool pitcher. They gave 2 cups for it: 1 cup with ice and another cup (or mini pitcher) which would equate to probably about 1.5-2 cups of fresca. It was definitely different. 

As for my meal, I ordered what the waiter called a "chicken pie" which felt like a stack of tortillas with chicken and sauces intertwined within each layer and topped off with melted cheese with a verde sauce. Overall, it tasted pretty good but very soft to my taste and didn't offer a variety of textures. 

Good place for a lunch meet up with a friend or perhaps a company lunch like I did. Not too sure if I would "crave" the food given here but definitely wasn't bad food.
author: Robbie P.

description:
The chips and salsa here is really nice. But everything else was all down hill from there. Food was just fairly bland and tasteless. I feel like I've had more tasty food at Taco Bell for 5$. 

Would not recommend and would not return.
author: Johnny B.

description:
If you want "higher class Mexican food" than this is definitely the place for you! This was the first time I tried this place out and I was surprised by pretty much everything! The service from the beginning to end was amazing! We got seated right away since the place was pretty quiet for a Saturday night, minus the bar area. The decor indie was lovely and it had a somewhat romantic vibe to it which was great. 

The menu is small and they have a huge alcohol drink menu which seems to be the hit of this place! All the platters are pretty large and anything that you order you will be blown away. We ordered an order of guacamole and it was made right in front of us and I cannot stress enough how amazing it tasted! I was in heaven. I ordered pork tacos and the meat was the best meat I have ever tasted. Everything was really good and couldn't have tasted better. 

Like I mentioned the service was great and fairly quick. The place is large and great place to host a gathering or party! It is also very clean and you can tell its maintained. Loved the modern decor inside as well. The place is located downtown near the bay bridge and sometimes it may be hard to find parking but that evening we parked right across the street which was great! Give this place a try if you haven't already, the prices are a big higher than normal Mexican food places but once you have a taste you will know why you are paying so much at the end of the evening!
author: Anne R.

description:
Standard chain. Good for groups. Good for work-related lunches or dinners. Easy-to-make reservations. Attracts people that work in the area. There are plenty of tables outside for when the weather is nice.

Spicy guac can get spicy--be careful!
author: Yad L.

description: Rosa's guacamole is off the hook. It's super fresh and yummy. The happy hour menu is great. I had the chicken nachos and they were really good. The waiters are really nice and the service is quick. All in all it was a good experience and I look forward to coming back.
author: Andrew A.

description: Came in for lunch while visiting the city from New Jersey and chose this restaurant for lunch on a Sunday. I had their Tampiqueña Carne Asada which is a $27 plate. The food was good, but I guess I expected a little more for the price. Before the meal came out, I was served with salsa and chips which were good. The chips were warm and were not stale. The restaurant looks upscale and is decorated beautifully. The seats are comfortable and the waiters and waitresses are very professional. Overall it's a laid back atmosphere which is perfect for having lunch or dinner with friends or family. They have seating to eat outside. If I'm ever in San Francisco again in the future, I'd consider eating her again.
author: M. A.

description:
I am very much impressed with this place ~ right from the service, the ambiance, the food!
We heard about this place from a friend who was raving about it and we weren't disappointed. We came in here as a party of 4. Just to make sure, I had made a reservation online.
The interior decor was pleasant and indeed the right feel for an upscale restaurant.

We ordered guac and chips as appetizer. They make the guac fresh and right in front of you.
We had the stuffed poblano, fish tacos and shrimp tacos. For the drinks, we had Honey dew agua fresca. The sweet corn that came with the tacos was delicious.
The food tasted great. 

A special shout out to Cesar, our very friendly waiter!

A little on the pricier side, but hey, this is in FiDi and a good Mexican place indeed! No regrets!
author: Steffi C.

description:
The bar tender was super friendly and nice. I love the plantains here. The mole sauce was super sweet for my taste. The rice was old and dry. the beans were nice and smooth with great flavor. 

Over all I really like this place bar wise;  the food was a hit or miss. some things were super delicious and some others on the plate not to much. 

I ordered the chicken mole and the chicken was wonderful. the mole sauce, way too sweet. the beans were delicious and the tamales was also good. the rice was hard and old but the plantains were awesome. 

The chips and salsa was also really good.
author: Leme K.

description:
Went for happy hour on a Friday 
Pretty nice atmosphere, the bartenders where good and the drinks and food was even better.
I had the margaritas (little strong) but can't complain about that really huh? 
I also chose the pollo tacos and quesadillas that were so good!! 
Def recommend with a nice work crew or a small meet up with a friend until your next adventure. I'll def be back for $8drinks, $6apps and fun. (Now prices all went up with a blink of an eye here)
author: Timothy F.

description:
Went for an afternoon late lunch. Three of is dined so we decided to share. I love sharing so I can get a good taste of various dishes.
We started with the freshly prepared Guacamole and chips. The chips were served warm and the Gaul was yummy. Next we shared the chili relleno, the 3 enchiladas plate and the shrimp tacos. I would have today I enjoyed all three. It might be somewhat spice for the no spice lover but I love HEAT.
Great service and very nice patio for those warm afternoons. I will dine there again.
author: Geoff F.

description:
You can eat at a Michelin star for less money than this run of the mill Mexican restaurant.

Boulevard is across the street and costs less.

You can go to Sushi Hon, get the omakase sashimi and an appetizer for the price of guac and enchiladas here.

Rosa Mexican is clean, a good location, but...I won't be back. Paying $15 for guac and $4 for a club soda plus $10 in taxes or something? I don't know guys? Rest of menu is equally as expensive. I've gone a few times but when I think about it now - it's just not worth it. I feel foolish for having gone here more than once and paid $60 for enchiladas.

My biggest issue is not the price alone; it's that instead of trying to turn you into a repeat customer they try to jack you as much as they can for having stepped in the door. That is not a business model I would like to support.

Edit: I'm now getting threats from the manager. He claimed my review was 'fraudulent'.

Not sure what he meant by that, but whatever. Pretty sure what I said was accurate.
author: E C.

description: The location is central to all the major businesses in the Financial District, and close to public transportation. The venue is nice, and appropriate for most occasions: dining with friends and colleagues, business lunch meetings, to happy hours. Food is decent depending on the day. Cocktail drinks are good. But, I've had multiple experiences to sadly say this place lacks customer service. We are all paying customers after all. But when treated as though we're imposing burden by being there, and despite all the other positive qualities, it all comes down to how you're treated and how you're received throughout the dining experience. When you are told the kitchen is backup to excuse the delay, while others who came after you are enjoying their entrees, makes you question. Not sure if the staff is trained to engage with certain people one way, and different with others. But needless to say, you're better off spending your hard earned money elsewhere.
author: Bisrat T.

description:
Dropped in for an impromptu post-Earth Hour dinner and we were very, very impressed. The staff is super friendly and helpful, the ambiance and decor was fantastic. 

Be sure to order guac with your chips and salsa, they make it fresh at your table-side, which was quite a treat. Definitely not something I've ever seen before! Our server was a lovely man named Luis who took such good care of us, so thank you Luis for contributing to a lovely evening! Delectable and unique entrees to round out an incredible dinner. 

Overall, a delightful dining experience!
author: Manal M.

description:
I think my mistake was stuffing myself with the guacamole dip and downing that with tecate.  Speaking of the tecate, they serve it with a fancy glass cup which makes me think I'm drinking a really expensive beer even though it's the ordinary tecate.

If you have room in your stomachs, there's more than a handful of entrees that are good. Chile releno, flauntas, empanadas, and the Churros are the items I loved and wouldn't mind eating again.

*** Note: Beer goes well with the food so order 1 or more.  I'm not a margarita person but my friends liked it so I'll trust their word and say order that too.
author: Ronald L.

description: Pricey, and the quality of food overtime has been dwindling. This place is in a prime location, so it's naturally packed. Great for people watching within or outside, but the price as it compares to the food could be better. The taste has also not been consistent (especially the guac).
author: Nich D.

description:
My husband and I have been to this restaurant a few times now and the food has been okay, yes definitely over-priced. But it's convenient when we are taking photos on the Embarcadero. Last night was our farewell dinner. We arrived and asked if we were with (garbled) party? No, then I can seat you in the bar. We were given dinner menus. A young waiter asked if we wanted drinks and some guacamole. .   I ordered Captain Morgan and Diet...I don't know if we have that...no we don't. Okay, you have a spiced rum? Dark Rum? This is a bar...right?
People were seated behind us and at the bar. Then we were told that they could not take dinner orders until 8pm...it was 7:00. Why did you seat us without telling us that first? Do you want some guacamole while you wait? (Yes, the $15 guacamole)The two tables that came in after us received their drinks and were on a second order before we received anything! We got up and left. They had some private party in their dining room and rather than close the restaurant, they lured in potential customers for drinks and guacamole (about $50) while they wait an hour to order.The service SUCKED! They should be ashamed!
author: SetTheBarHi S.

description:
Okay, yes, I was skeptical when I heard that my husband's department dinner was here, but Rosa Mexicano didn't disappoint.  Well service was friendly, but they were super slammed with Super Bowl City visitors on the Saturday night before the Super Bowl.  So our dinner party was a very long 4.5 hours.  I felt like our main waiter provided great service though.

Let me start by saying their guacamole was like crack!  It's addicting with their tortilla chips!  The guacamole is so fresh and creamy and has a spicy kick to it.  Since we were a large party of 30, we had a set pre fixe (we just had to choose which entree we wanted).  I got a sampling of a few of the appetizers which included the chicken flautas and the beef quesadilla.  Quesadilla was standard to me, but I enjoyed the crispy chicken tinga flautas topped with fresh crema, salsa verde and cheese.  Also sampled the quesadlias de res, which was filled with cheese and braised beef.  

My husband and I both chose for our entree the Tampiquena de carne asada which was a grilled flank steak.  It was marinated in chile and tequila and was so tender, and medium rare!  Accompanying it was some guacamole, crema and a tortilla with cheese (i.e. almost like an enchilada) and covered with a tomato sauce.  Last up was the dessert, which we all thought was going to be bomb, but was a bit of a disappointment.  The little churros weren't served piping hot, and they were a little stale.  They were served with chocolate and raspberry dipping sauces.  

Again, we did take awhile to get started, but about 4.5 hours for dinner was so long!  I felt that the staff could have took our entree orders once they started passing out the appetizers (which was when everyone got there).   They were very busy due to Alicia Key's performance at Super Bowl City, but, nonetheless, I don't think this should have contributed too much to such a long dinner.  Though, again,o ur main waiter was wonderful!  BTW, I heard the bathrooms were absolutely disgusting that night.  It's expensive for sure, so if you're not here on someone else's dime, definitely take advantage of happy hour or go for lunch instead.  3.5ish stars but I'll round up, since Rosa Mexicano pleasantly surprised me.  Rosa Mexicano tiene comida buena!
author: Cat C.

description:
Rosa Mexicano has great happy hour! It's from Monday to Friday from 4PM-7PM.  I love how they have outside seatings and if you want a big group to sit outside, you are able to hold multiple tables. Others might get annoyed but at least you'll have seats for your friends ha! 

The only reason why I'm giving it a 3 stars is because they definitely need work on having better service. It took them at least 15 minutes to get me water and barely comes by to see if you need anything. Other than that, the food is great.
author: Jenn L.

description:
This place has amazing guacamole! It's fresh and they make it for you table-side too! (Just make sure you choose the regular dining area as they don't make it in front of you if you choose bar/happy hour seating.)

I ordered the ranchero enchiladas, which tasted good but nothing too special. Our dinner came out to be over $30 per person, which is a bit pricier than I expected considering the food was just okay to me. 

I would be open to just sharing guacamole next time and maybe trying some drinks on their happy hour menu.
author: Alice S.

description:
Came here for a work birthday lunch.  The reviews are right. It is "meh" Mexican food (much better food to be founding the Mission).

But the place is pretty inside, they have outdoor seating - you can pretty much always get in with a few lunch people on a workday. 

The service is "quirky" - sometimes good, sometimes worse.

I have been there before for Happy Hour, which I think is a better deal.
author: Amy W.

description: Love their happy hour - BUT I heard about the mojitos they used to have on their happy hour!  They definitely need to bring those back!  We had red sangria, red wine, and we ordered the mojitos off the regular menu just to try it - and they were good!  Please bring mojitos back to the happy hour menu!!  If they are brought back, we will be super regular customers - I promise!!  Please consider bringing them back.  Gracias!
author: Maile N.

description:
It feels wrong to pay $18 for 3 tacos. Especially when you can get the real deal in the Mission for less than that.

Here's the thing: Rosa Mexicano isn't striving to compete with the taquerias in the Mission. They cater to the expense account crowd who's willing to shell out $14 for tableside guacamole preparation while sealing the deal. 

SF Restaurant Week gave us a chance to try this fancy Mexican restaurant for a fraction of the cost. Instead of the usual 2 course lunch, Rosa Mexicano offered 3 ample sized courses for the same $25 price.  A hearty pozole de res with a base of guajilo chiles and garlic anchored the tender beef and sweet white corns. My flaky Pacific Cod was roasted traditionally in a banana leaf, a bit bland but easily fixable with the spicy salsa verde. For dessert, I had the churros shaken with sugar in a hot pink paper bag and then presented table side. They were left in the fryer too long, but I can't stop eating them! the 3 dipping sauces it came with rocked my tastebuds: chocolate, caramel and raspberry. 

Admittedly, service needs improvement. But in a gorgeously decorated restaurant with orange, purple and browns splashed before your eyes, I didn't really care. 

Solid, upscale Mexican cuisine status achieved.
author: Janice C.

description:
Restaurant Week in San Francisco - $25 for a 3 course menu in an upscale Mexican restaurant, sounds like a deal, huh?

Before you get in there you should probably erase everything you know about Mexican food, at least if your memory is made of Mission-like burritos or Southern Californian tacos. This place in the Financial District aims at people with a high six figure income, how else would you explain that a taco is $18 on their menu? 

Just wow. If you earn minimum wage that's one and a half hour for one taco.

That being said, I was happy to get the $25 deal! My tastebuds were satisfied with the WHITE CORN SOUP (when it came out it had cooled down a little too much though), the MARINATED PACIFIC COD (steamy hot, soft and tender on the inside) and the CHEESECAKE for dessert (with sweet apple pieces in the middle). 

The restaurant was almost empty at lunch time on a Sunday but service was sloooow. Maybe they wanted us to fully enjoy the spacious and beautiful inside of the restaurant.

$$$.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
Worst service ever. 

Our dude only came by our table about 3 times for a table of 8 people. Every time he came by, he forgot something and yet still managed to charge me for it all at the end. We didn't get half of the drinks that we ordered and I got an entirely different meal from what I ordered but I didn't want to send it back because it would have taken an eternity to get it. 

My second complaint is the terrible indigestion I woke up with at 2 am and the stomach problems that I have now 19 hours after my meal. Every single person at our table last night is sick today. 

Won't be coming back here any time soon.
author: Maggie P.

description: imagine a cross between chevys and chilis and then throw a 2x multiplier on the menu price and you have rosa mexicano. everything here is average, from the entrees (had the fish) to the drinks. the guacamole is made fresh tableside but at $18(?) per serving it makes you wonder if they're sprinkling gold dust in there. save your money and head to the mission for an authentic mexican food experience
author: Alexandra K.

description:
Carnitas were solid (great crispy bits and seasoned well) 
Pineapples added a nice touch of sweetness and paired nicely with the pork 
Outside seating is amazing on a great day 

Overall Thoughts

Food is good but the cost doesn't add up for what you get especially for the drinks
author: Eddie W.

description:
The only saving grace about this place was that we were able to make a reserve a table during super bowl weekend but otherwise I'd never come here again.
Once we got there we had to wait a few min for our table. Once we sat down, it took quite some time for our waiter to stop by. We got a pitcher of sangria and chips & dip. 2 of us got enchiladas and one got steak & shrimp. The enchiladas was mediocre at best, but we were staving so we ate. Though the enchiladas came with rice & beans, they gave us the rice & beans in bowls as oppose to plates. I got the chicken suizas and they were drenched in the sauce. 
Once we got our food, no one came by. We even had to try to flag our waiter to no avail. We wanted to pay but had to wait for forever. I then turned around handed a waiter the CC to charge. All around us, I noticed people waiting for service. 
Also, I found something weird in my ice. I pointed it out to the waiter, and yeah, he apologized and walked away.
author: Sarika S.

description: The food is ok, but what really make this restaurant a 5 star is the customer service!!!
author: Ivette T.

description:
In a town filled with amazing Mexican restaurants, this place is underwhelming and way overpriced. The Baja tacos were flavorless...
The inside decorations were nice though.
author: Andreea C.

description: I've worked with Rosa Mexicana a handful of times over the past few years regarding private dining and highly recommend them for a work/client happy hour.  Especially on beautiful fall days, their outdoor patio suites the needs of a cool venue within walking distance to the North FiDi area and great food for an even better value.  I highly recommend Rosa Mexicana if you are looking for something right in the middle with regards to private dining.
author: Kelsey K.

description: I order a guacamole through ubereats for 15 dollars. It came in a small Tupperware and was only half full (I uploaded a picture). I don't think by any measure what I got was worth anywhere close to 15 dollars. I also ordered a quesadilla, which supposedly comes with guacamole but that was nowhere to be seen. I called the restaurant to make sure that this is not a mistake. I was told that it was not. I hope no one repeats my mistake ever again.
author: Mike H.

description: Went there with a group of 6 at non time today. Had to ask them to refill water, chips and salsa. Waited at least 35 mins for our food. For a pricey Mexican restaurant, we'd expect much better service and more staff. Food was just ok. Better off going to a mom and pop Mexican restaurant instead.
author: w m.

description:
After a night of stand up comedy, we wanted to find a place close by that stayed open late enough for us to relax and enjoy dinner. The gentleman serving up drinks and information at the Variety Club Preview Room suggested Rosa Mexicano.

Well... it was a walk, but we made it and I, for one, was starving! We arrived around 10:00 and they were open until 11:00. 

We started off with the guacamole. It was super fresh and chunky. I love avocado, so the roughly diced deliciousness in the stone bowl suited me just fine. The wooden spoon was a little awkward. It was thick and dishing up the guacamole was tricky. Still, it was very good.

There were many options, from tacos to enchiladas and many specials. I was torn, but ended up with the Tres Enchiladas, chicken, beef and cheese. The Chihuahua cheese enchilada was fantastic! The sauce and the cheese!! After tasting all three, I left the cheese enchilada for last so I could savor the flavor. The chicken and beef enchiladas were tasty. Not as extraordinary as the cheese, but good.

The place is gorgeous. Kudos to the design team. The full-wall diving waterfall was interesting and soothing. Everything seems very high end. The red, orange and black color scheme was a treat. I believe the impact of the decor was greater because it was dark out.

Staff was very helpful and attentive. Water was filled regularly.

If we ever go back I'd like to try one of their specials.
author: Scott N.

description: It's GREAT. Love the quacamole/chips, fish tacos, and their sangria!!!!!! The new chef is off the charts!!!
author: Mrs. M.

description:
Their guacamole is AMAZING, their shrimp tacos were pretty good. Their drinks were good, but there are definitely a few problems with the service. 

Our waiter was very nice, don't get me wrong, but I asked for shrimp tacos and he somehow heard that I wanted fish tacos.... I guess that would have been easy to understand the mix up if I said it in English (they can probably sound the same in a loud restaurant) but I said camarones ... which is shrimp in Spanish ... and he was a fluent Spanish speaker ...  lol. 

Also, when the bill came, I told him to put a certain amount on my card and then the rest on my friends card ... he came back and definitely did two transactions, but they also happened to be both on my card ... I hope his head just wasn't in the right place and he doesn't make these mistakes nightly. He was very nice, but attention to detail would have been appreciated.
author: Jen L.

description: Always come here when in San Francisco love the service and the food is amazing. I have tried different plates and appetizers and all are so delicious ! Best Mexican spot in San Francisco
author: Frances G.

description:
Very convenient location just a block away from the Hyatt Regency. Pretty interior (almost identical to Rosa Mexicano in New York - even same wall art installation in New York).

Food was very bland and expensive. Three drinks, guacamole and nachos was $91.00 with tip. The guacamole was fresh but little flavor. The nachos consisted of 3 small tortillas stacked one on top of each other with a few toppings - very small.

The service was nice and attentive - hence the award of two stars.

If you are looking for really good Mexican food this is not your place. If you're looking for an expensive $15. drink and people watching this might be an ok selection.
author: Teresa G.

description:
it's higher-end Mexican, but not dumbed down for gringo tastes. not all authentic cuisine has to be street food. 

I give it four stars because the service is always great. I've been here many times (I work really close by) and service is consistently good. as others have mentioned it's great for larger groups, they go out of their way to accommodate big tables.

they make the guac at your table which is nice. unless you like no spice, tell them to make it spicy. their version of spicy isn't hot at all. 

I love the carnitas, camarones and Cobb salad (lunch only I think) and mahi tacos, but there's nothing I've ordered I wouldn't have again

bar scene is pretty good too with regular and specialty margaritas
author: Bob U.

description:
Called a few hours before the reservation to tell me that "We had the restaurant reserved for a private event" so sorry but your reservation is cancelled. 
And they figured this out only a few hours before a reservation?
an hour later: "no, it is not really closed, so you can come"
GET YOUR ACT TOGETHER.
You don't treat weekend clients like this. We have lots of choices and definitely your incompetence takes you out of the choice list. You need our business on weekends.
author: A A.

description: Yummy!  The enchilada plate with 3 different sauces was delicious!  The guacamole made at our table could not have been fresher or better. Love the diver wall of water. Very nice atmosphere. Service was excellent. Will definitely return.
author: Liz T.

description:
Went here for a bunch of us high schoolers getting together after so many years.  Since our musical heroes at the time were Madonna and Michael Jackson with a twinge of Earth Wind and Fire and Blondie, we all decided to meet sensibly downtown for everyone to get to easily.  It was easy, and yet if you are a driver like I am, well, it took some time to get parking.....

Location - Ground floor of the Spear One tower across from Rincon Annex.  Outdoor seating for when the weather is just right and plenty of space for all different size parties.

The Menu - Interesting American style Mexican Food.  You can easily browse it online.   From the appetizers, to the Enchiladas, to the specialities, I found the menu to be about par for your typical Americanized fare.

What impressed me:  Guacamole - They serve guacamole at your table and it is very good. A bit overly large in terms of chunkiness, but overall very tasty. They don't serve you a lot of tortilla's with the guac, and maybe that is good so you don't too filled up on the appetizer...  The next thing that impressed me was the Chamorro!  This hunking piece of pork shank is cooked in the style the German Schweinhaxe.  So you get this huge peace of port that is charred on the outside and tender on the inside.  It is a fantastic barbaric experience to eat this piece of meat.

Tookillya - The tequila selection here is amazing.  Going from your 10.00 per shot to the triple digits.  The Gran Centenario Anejo is what I had and it was a reasonable 15.00 per shot.  

Overall - Decent service, we were ten and I liked that they did not gratuitously add the tip onto the bill already. Yep we left a larger tip in this case.  Filling the water up came slowly however I liked the place.  I think this is a better lunch place, and if they want to be busier on week nights, they will need to liven up the place with happy hours, food choices that are lighter or more authentic and make it a destination place to eat.

I liked it, however not sure if I would go out of my way to come back.
author: Greg K.

description:
Just got home from happy hour at Rosas! 

I'm surprised at the poor ratings for this place! I've been wanting to check it out since it opened. Not sure what this place used to be and none of my friends who work in the area could tell me either. The turnover for restaurants in SF is just too high! A lot of the poor reviews I'm seeing are from 2013 so I can only assume this place has taken the complaints into account and stepped their game up. 

Arrived at 5:15 on a Monday for happy hour and found a seat at the bar. Well I found the little seat next to the salsa station and my friend was having none of it when he saw me at the little bar so we moved to a table by the window. Service was super attentive with two of the bartenders asking if I was ready to order and water right at my table. When we were seated at the table there was instant water for my friend and complimentary chips and salsa for us! 

I hadn't planned on eating since I already had enchiladas and black beans for lunch but my friend was hungry and ordered three of the $5 dishes off the happy hour menu. I got the pepper quesadilla and it was bomb! Shared it with my other buddy who arrived later and three dishes was plenty of food for the three of us. 

This restaurant is HUGE! Didn't realize until I went to the restroom in the back of the place. I think there was some company happy hour going on in the back. They have an awesome fountain wall installation that I was glad I was able to check out. Its huge but easily missed if you just sit at the bar the entire time. 

Under $50 for three appetizers, four drinks, and chips and salsa. Done deal! Was already recommending this place to all my friends before the check even arrived.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
I know I am one of those exception but I really like this place. Though the food doesn't come in the category of authentic Mexican and it's costly but I love it.
I have been here several no of times and never got disappointed by  their service and food quality.
Their fresh avocado prep is bit overpricey and overhyped but I really liked it. The menu has a lot of varieties and they have special menus too which is really good.
Totally recommend this place.
author: Mimansha B.

description:
Glam Mexican food in the FiDi.  Great place for a nice meal, but not a bargain bite.

Beautiful decor, good service, but the food is the real draw here.  Delicious, spicy, and fresh food that's a real step above the usual casual Mexican food you find all over SF.

Does not hurt if you are on an expense account when you dine here.
author: Patrick S.

description:
While in town for business a friend and I grabbed dinner here. We had an enjoyable meal.

Décor: Both outside and inside this is a more upscale Mexican restaurant. It still "feels" like a Mexican restaurant but everything is nicer and very well taken care of. There is a bar area, which was packed when we were there (on a Thursday night) and then a very large dining room that had ample amount of tables and booths. Additionally, it appear that there were a few "private" rooms/areas (they were really just behind a curtain) where private parties were being held. The lights are kept low to keep a more low-key and intimate vibe but everyone, including ourselves, were having a great (loud) time!
Bathroom: clean, mood-lit, and inviting

Staff: The hostess seated us right away and our waiter took very good care of us (despite us taking FOREVER to order anything!). He was patient, understanding, and totally chill. Additionally, the bus boys cleared away any dirty dishes promptly and always kept our water glasses filled. Great service.

Food/Drinks: We started with a few beers, Coronas of course, and then moved on to some tableside-made guacamole. They made it to taste and it was delicious! We then ordered, and enjoyed, our entrees: we both had enchiladas and they were tasty. We had both the Suizas (tasty) and the Tres Enchiladas (ranchera, suiza, mestiza) (yum). They came with sides of rice and beans, standard, and those were also very enjoyable. The portions are pretty sizable and after all the chips we ate we were certainly stuffed!

Value: This is a nicer place and located near the water so it commands a bit higher of a price. However, we greatly enjoyed the entire meal and I do not feel like we didn't receive the level of service deserved.

This is a solid Mexican food restaurant that I will be recommending to friends and look forward to returning to again in the future.
author: Mark B.

description: Nice place to get try Mexican recipes. Freshly prepared guacamole and corn tortillas chips are awesome.
author: Yogendra B.

description:
Really nice bar area with TV's etc. and awesome bartenders that know how to make a good drink! 

What really turns me off about a Mexican spot is when they cant even get the chips and salsa right. But this place serves really good chips and salsa and their fresh guacamole served table-side is the bomb!

As for the rest... meh.

I really like their location in downtown LA and thought Id give this place a try. This might be more of the type of place to have a business lunch (which is normal in this part of SF) but not a good place to have dinner while out in the city.

Service was really slow even though the place was half-empty on a Friday night. Food arrived lukewarm. Their prices are high for what they deliver in quality and quantity. I had the Arrachera which should be a signature dish at any Mexican restaurant and I got a tiny, paper-thin piece of meat that tasted just OK.

I would return only to have a drink and a bite from their bar menu if Im ever in this part of SF (which I rarely am)
author: Rimar T.

description: I got the tres enchiladas and each one was outstanding. I was prepared to think it would be overpriced, but it was well worth it. The guacamole was great, too, though that really was overpriced. The free chips and salsa were also very good. It's a really nice restaurant and the service was good for a large lunch group.
author: Kevin M.

description: Their guacamole is second to none. It is one of the most delicious things in the world. Be sure to order. Service for hh in the bar area can be sparse and not up to par. Waiters disappear and food orders get dropped. Thankfully the guacamole makes up for it.
author: Michelle L.

description: Came here for a co-worker's going away party. It's a great spot, convenient location, and always good for groups. We tried to make a reservation because we were going to be a large party (25), and they wanted us to pay $2,500 to reserve a spot. No. So, we got there a bit early instead and all was fine. The margaritas and guac are always great and the service is always good here. Portions are big! Free wifi - you just have to enter your email. And the bathrooms are clean.
author: Shoshana G.

description:
I came here for a work lunch. Overall, I enjoyed my meal here. Service was a bit slow, but I wasn't in a rush so I didn't mind. I initially wanted to try the mahi mahi tacos, but they were out of them =(.

Guacamole (4.5/5) - Really great. Fresh chunks of avocado with the perfect level of acid. Pretty large portion as well. 

Tinga de Res Tacos (3/5) - Nice flavor, but the meat was a bit dry, and the tortilla was soaked from the juices. I had to eat it with a fork. I enjoyed the Mexican style corn on the side, but I wish the loose kernel portion had less sauce. 

Ice Cream Sundae (3.5/5) - Standard ice cream with a surprise brownie on the bottom. My favorite part by far was the plantains!
author: Cynthia M.

description:
I have been going to this restaurant since 2009 (Washington DC location) and have been a loyal customer. 

However, I was very disappointed on my last visit on Saturday when I arrived at 12:00 noon for lunch and was charged dinner prices.

When I inquired about the issue, the staff member said that on weekends, they are serving "dinner all day" and "lunch" is only served on weekdays. 

This is a policy change that I had not experienced before and is not indicated on their website which says that lunch is served from 12:00pm-3:30pm on Saturday and Sunday. 

I feel that the information on the website is inaccurate and I am not sure if I will return.
author: M T.

description:
DO NOT COME HERE ON CINCO DE MAYO! They give you small plastic cups of $15 margaritas & throw down half portions of rice & beans for a $30 burnt carne asada. I get that it's a popular day for the restaurant & no one can make guacamole at your table but $130 for two entrees, guacamole & two dinky drinks is sooooooooooo not worth it! 
Save your money & go elsewhere.
author: Amy J.

description: Person that seats you and the manager were very rude - especially the manger.  Food was so-so.  Used to go here quite a bit but based on yesterday's experience we probably won't be back any time soon.
author: Stacey N.

description: Great place to go with friends for a yummy dinner. Everything from the drinks to entrees was completely satisfactory. Nothing memorable, but still enjoyable. The outdoor seating ambience is also really nice. I'd probably try for another Mexican place next time, but wouldn't mind coming back here.
author: Priya B.

description: Food was just ok when i went and seemed kinda pricey, i know its the Financial district but damn.  $18 for 3 shrimp tacos that only had 1 shrimp in each of them.
author: Dr. G.

description:
Five star for service. And a shout out to Cesar who mixed the guac.

I love this place, it is solid food, great service, and a good happy hour place. It is kinda weird to spend $20+ on a Mexican dish so that's the 3 stars. Otherwise, good lunch place and great happy hour place.
author: Massimo M.

description:
Holy guacamole, I love their guacamole!

The happy hour is pretty good, strong and delicious margaritas. There are some discounts but it's still an upscale Mexican restaurant. They offer a nice back room for private events.
author: Jess C.

description: Went for a friend's birthday mid day/ work day lunch. When I made the reservation I told them it was for a birthday. We arrived, hostess was incredibly rude and unfriendly. Told us the rest of the party was in the back area, motioned the back of the restaurant but didn't bother to show us to our table. Service was very, very slow. One of my 2 empanadas was completely empty. When I flipped it over you could see it had opened/popped, all the filling had fallen out and the kitchen still plated it but didn't bother to even refill the empanada. It was just a fried shell. I didn't say anything because everything took so incredibly long - we had already been waiting an hour before our apps arrived! It was a small group of 5 of us eating, but 6 at the table. Service was very slow, it all took 2 hours! It was a mid week lunch, nothing crazy. They brought a cake for our friend and sang happy birthday. When the bill came they charged us $10 for the cake. I didn't ask for one, I wasn't told there would be a charge for the cake. Many restaurants give a complimentary dessert to a birthday person, it's fine if they don't but they should've have told us there was a charge. Shame really. I want to like this place but each time the service is terrible and this last time the entire experience was so poor that I'm hard pressed to ever want to go back.
author: Kasandra V.

description:
After a long ferry ride from Napa to San Francisco my hubby and I were tired, tipsy and starving. Not really knowing where to go or what to eat, we hit the streets walking from the ferry building. The streets of San Francisco happened to be quite "dead" on a Friday night. As we walked down Mission St. we saw Rosa Mexicano, a modern Mexican chain eatery known for table-side guacamole & creative margaritas.

Reading the words "Mexican Food" was like music to our ears because in Texas it's comfort food... and after our long day, comfort food is just what we needed.

We ordered the Nachos de Tres Quesos topped with queso fresco, white cheddar, Menonita cheese and the Tinga de Res Guerrero, Braised beef brisket with tomatillo-habanero salsa, house-made slaw and pickled red onion. The Tingas come with  Served with esquites, achiote rice and black beans. The Equites or "Mexican corn salad" was a life changer. So yummy and creamy!

We capped our meal with one of their signature "Frozen Pomegranate" agave cocktails. Their Frozen Pomegranate has been on the menu since 1984 and is made with blacno tequila, triple sec, fresh pomegranate and lime.
author: Renia L.

description: It looks like a nice atmosphere from outside, but once you're inside you feel like the staff just do not want to serve you and are annoyed by having customers to wait on!  Actually have had a waiter say out loud while we were walking in that they didn't want to serve us.
author: Tim K.

description: Didn't really enjoy my experience there.  We arrived shortly after 9pm on a Friday night.  We were seated in the bar area.  We sat there for about 10 minutes with no interaction from a waiter.  Then a huge party of about 10 people arrived.  They were immediately given chips and salsa and waters.   Our waiter came and took our order but never gave us chips salsa or water.   We assumed this was extra.   We ordered nachos as appetizer.  But then shortly thereafter another waiter brought us chips and salsa.  If those had come earlier we would not have orders nachos.  We ended up filling up on nachos and never actually ordered dinner as we intended to.   The Nachos were just ok.  I actually enjoyed the free nachos and salsa over the nachos appetizer.   I could blame this on the large party but my experience was just ok.
author: Charles J.

description: This is a gourmet Mexican restaurant. One of the best specialties here is that they make guacamole at your table and it is the best. The meat tacos are excellent as are most of their dishes. The refried beans are not as lardy as in some restaurants. One downside, I tried the Tres Enchiladas which used to three meats with different sauces. Now it is KALE enchiladas with different sauces. Believe me, kale enchiladas are yucky. It is a bit pricey, and quite noisy, but they deliver gourmet Mexican.
author: Alice M.

description:
Go for the happy hour from 4-7pm. My friend and I stumbled upon this place as we left the free Ellie Goulding concert at Justin Herman Plaza. We were seated in the main dinner section until we told them that we just wanted drinks so we moved to the area near the outdoor patio. We both got the mango margaritas and it was quite strong so I got buzzed pretty quickly. Every table had the guac and chips but since it was just the two of us, we didn't want to get too much. We did get the carnitas tacos which I loved for its sweet pineapple taste that paired excellently with the taco. We also got the nachos and it was amazing as well but by that time, I was buzzed so I was just having my drunk cravings. 

I would definitely come back a second time, hopefully with a bigger group of friends so that we can get that guac.
author: Diana C.

description:
Why so LOW reviews? Or maybe because its fusion mexican food? i know a lot of people think why would you wanna spend $$$ on mexican food when you can just go to Mission for a $5 burrito BUT you know what? sometimes its nice to just eat semi fancy or nice in a sit down restaurant with GOOD service.

Dont get me wrong...i love the dirty fast restaurants ie. El Foritto for the burritos but sometimes i like to feel pamper or just sit in a nice decor restaurant with  my girlfriends and i got that at Rosa Mexicano.

Satisfying and even got a good buzzed. PERFECT NIGHT! 

FIrst time dining at Rosa Mexicano (recommended by my sister who lives in NY). The place itself reminds me of Dos Caminos in Las Vegas.

1. Nice decor
2. Easy parking especially after 6pm
3. AWESOME HAPPY HOUR SPECIAL -- 4-7pm
4. White & Red Sangria pitchers = GOOD and STRONG ($17 during Happy hour)
5. Pork belly and Scallops tacos (happy hour = 2 tacos for $6 on Tuesday = $3 a taco) = TOO DIE FOR
6. Crispy chicken tacos = ok....prob wont order again
7. Baja fish taco = GOOOOOOOOOD. Less fattening then Nick's taco way from Underdogs. 
8. GAUC and CHIPS = MUST GET
9. CRISPY PORK SHANK (regular dinner item) = WORTH THE $27...i want more
10. Great customer service

i love the ambiance of the restaurant and I think Rosa Mexicano will be one of my favorite places to bring my girlfriends or even the hubby (if i can get him to dine a semi-fancy mexican restaurant because he LOVES the authentic mexican food from Mission). 

Thanks Rosa Mexicano for a great Christmas Eve night especially since many restaurants were closed. 

and also thanks to the waitress who gave us the churros at the end.  YUMMOS!

**12/31/13 update:

Went here for New years adn again the service was consistent especially the food too!

THANK YOU AGAIN. :)
author: Carol Y.

description: It's a decent venue for the area but the food and drinks are overpriced.  The quality of the food is ok but again more than I'd like to pay.
author: Thomas F.

description: I am extremely disappointed in the lack of attention and attentiveness I experienced tonight at Rosa Mexicano. I expected to experience a nice romantic dinner but instead it was shear disappointment. On Saturday April 7th at 9:01pm we came to Rosa Mexicano. Upon walking in, we were seated by the nice hostess, but as we were walking to our table I noticed four to five uniformed employees surrounding the corner of the bar...taking shots. My fiancée and I were seated at the table for exactly 17 minutes without a single employee acknowledging us. Not even the employees with the guacamole cart passing by. We sat with empty water glasses and concern that no one approached us. We immediately regretted choosing Rosa Mexicano. The absence of respect at this restaurant forced us to leave. I will no longer choose Rosa Mexicano for my family nor for my clients as I do not wish for them to receive the same amount of disrespect as we did tonight.
author: Sammy B.

description: Beautiful restaurant and good service.  However, my dish was awful.  I ordered the salmon and it was really overlooked and dry.  It was supposed to come with some sort of sauce, but there wasn't any.  Disappointing.  Will not be back.  There are much better restaurants in SF.
author: Michelle C.

description: After 3 times in this restaurant I can definitely write a review. Very good Mexican food and friendly staff. Guacamole . Recommended and I will be back soon!
author: Alberto T.

description:
Maestro, strike up some Mariachi music. Make it a Son Jalisco please, for the Mexican state where tequila was invented in the 16th century. Bartender, snifters of Herradura Selecion Suprema for everyone! I have a story to tell. It's a tale of two Rosas. Take a sip of that extra añejo magic in a glass and savor the story.

Primero, la historia de Rosa muy casual. She is an excellent Happy Hour option for the downtowner. Great patio seating - good thing they have plenty heat lamps 'cause there aren't that many truly warm days and eves in ess-eff. There's also an 8-seat bar (with sports on TV) and a good number of tall tables. Best of all, the price is right. Rosa casual isn't quite a cheap date, but she's a good deal - daily, 4-7. Happy hour-seeker please note, it's part of a chain, so don't expect a nabe-Mexican restaurant vibe. Instead, it feels slighty swanky, but pleasantly casual. Good vibes. A fun place to get your date on or hang with friends. 

Segundo, la historia de Rosa mas formal. She is good for lunch meetings and expense account dinners. This would be a go-to if it were closer to the office. The large, L-shaped dining area is nicely appointed. Large enough that you might be able to get in without a reservation, Appropriate for the business lunch and in no way reminiscent of the taco truck. Rosa formal ain't cheap though. She's not that kind of girl.

La comida -  keep sipping if you will, while I tell you about the food. Happy hour first. Dos tacos, for just $6, is the way to go. I highly recommend the camarones - shrimp, kale and chipotle aioli. Pollo is good too - cheesy grilled chicken with bacon. Tinga de Res is just OK - beef brisket with salsa, slaw and pickled onion. Quesadillas at $6 are the other best bet and easy to share. They have Pollo and Tinga de Res (see above), as well as Rajas - a vegetarian option with poblano chile strips. Margarita are just $7 per glass or $30 a pitcher. Good prices on sangria, vino and cerveza too. The other bar fave is never discounted but always worth it, the Queso Fundido - I'm drooling thinking of it - a melty dish of cheese and poblanos with handmade corn tortillas - kind of a Mexican fondue. It would be easy to share, but you'll want it all for yourself. Order two and you won't look as greedy! 

No matter where you sit, you'll love the made-in-front-of-you guacamole. Though it's not such a large serving, it's soooo good. So pay the $15 for the experience before your eyes and in your mouth. The regular lunch and dinner menus have always satisfied me. Shrimp ceviche, Mexican Casar salad and enchiladas are all good. Elotes - Mexican street corn in a nice change of pace, especially if you're here as a tourist from beyond California's borders. Try it at least once... 

Bebidas - at the bottom of the review, but the real reason I love to visit Rosa. Perfect for a good time with friends. The house margaritas are pretty good. They're $12 if it's not happy hour (see above). I like La Unica, their version of a Cadillac margarita with 1800 reposado tequila and Grand Marnier. Meanwhile, I wouldn't go there, but a tequila-lovin' friend of mine likes the pomegranite margies. They even have skinny margaritas - I guess that's how Rosa keeps her fine figure.

If it's a special occasion, or just a regular occasion you'd like to make special, check out the top-of-the-top-shelf añejo tequilas to order in a snifter in my order of preference (taste vary but these are all worth trying): 
Herradura Selecion Suprema 
Reserva de la Familia
Don Julio 1942
El Tesoro Paradiso - extra añejo 
Casa Noble 5-year
Fortaleza 
Partida 
Ocho
Tapatillo
Gran Centenario
Chinaco
Don Julio
Pueblo Viejo
Chamucos

Y mas - other details: Gluten-free menus available if you need one. Noise level varies. 

It's highly debated in the Yelp reviews, but I've always had reasonably good service. Yes, it can be slow when the place is packed. Um, that's true pretty much true everywhere in the known universe. At least they're never unfriendly. Shout out to the bartender who saw empty glasses on our table after he had clocked out and he still came over and took our order. 

If you're driving, it may be hard to find parking. Some spots become available at 6pm, but you better show up by 5:55 to get one. It's pretty convenient to the Embarcadero Station for BART and Muni access - so don't drive and you can have one for the road!

El total - five stars for the happy hour and excellent tequila selection ('cause did you read the review?), three stars for lunch and dinner (good food, but pricey) - I'll give Rosa four stars overall and will keep meeting friends here for HH.
author: Ted R.

description:
Only experiencing the drinks (which were all amazing) from the margaritas to the wine list I was a happy camper here. 

The patio seating is amazing at night. The perfect spot to relax and enjoy the company your with.
author: Evan A.

description: I really wanted to like it here more. I've been a few times for happy hour and those always have been nice. Friendly bartender, and nice drinks. When it comes to the food...it's okay. I mean, wouldn't anything be delicious after four margaritas? I wouldn't recommend for dinner. It's a nice happy hour with nice outdoor seating.
author: Samantha R.

description:
Is Rosa Mexicano the name of a wronged woman in a Quentin Tarantino spaghetti western, the one with the permanent sneer and the lazy eye who seeks revenge on the nameless man she fell desperately in love with when she was working at a bordertown bordello? OK, that has nothing to do with this place as this Rosa Mexicano is part of an international chain of upscale restaurants that put a fashion-forward twist on familiar Mexican dishes. That's my euphemistic way of saying this is no Mission taqueria with combination plates. For example, Slow-Braised Short Ribs (Tablones) are $28, and even Beef Enchiladas are $21. This stylish place is not for the budget conscious. That may account for the predominance of suits with presumably hefty expense accounts.

And that is likely the reason Jamie W. and I have yet to make it into the dining room. However, I have now been twice to the bar and have been rather mixed in my feelings much like the other conflicted Rosa. We came here the first time the night there was an opening celebration for the Bay Lights. Despite the number of revelers in the bar (photo: http://bit.ly/10XxjVW), we landed at a small table where we ordered the $7.50 Ice Cream Sundae, the proceeds of which go to Alex's Lemonade Stand, which raises money to fight childhood cancer. Not only was this a great charitable move by the restaurant, the dessert was actually decadently good. It consisted of scoops of vanilla ice cream ladled with raspberry-guajillo and piloncillo-espresso chocolate sauces and topped with fresh strawberries and cinnamon sugar plantains (photo: http://bit.ly/13LWE99).

I came back solo weeks later for lunch, this time for the $13 Cobb Salad, a south-of-the-border rendition of the classic that combined chorizo sausage with grilled chicken and added Cabrales blue cheese, avocado, cherry tomatoes, and habanero-pickled onions to the mix. All of those sharp, jagged flavors covered a salad of mixed greens already doused in avocado-dill dressing and topped with chile-dusted croutons (photo: http://bit.ly/13LWIWj). The result was too spicy for my taste to the point of me precariously avoiding certain ingredients with my fork. It was challenging for a full-gusto eater like me to pick at a salad. Perhaps when I get an asbestos tongue and a permanent sneer, I'll come back for an actual dinner here.

FOOD - 3 stars...nice sundae surprise but a way-too-spicy Cobb salad
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...big, spacious, upscale and full of suits...the anti-Mission Mexican restaurant
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...nice if a bit unctuous the first time, perfunctory and curt at lunch
TOTAL - 3 stars...with all the choices in the Mission and even Colibri offering alternatives, this Rosa Mexicano better walk away from the gunfight
author: Ed U.

description:
Good sangria and a nice outdoor seating area but the tacos were pretty mediocre. 

I may come back for drinks but probably will have my food elsewhere.
author: Gokhan T.

description: This place is a joke. Went there for a birthday party... it was WAY overpriced, drinks were watered down, salmon was inedible, service was extremely slow.   I would never recommend this place.
author: Chris R.

description: Pathetic experience. Specifically asked for vegetarian food. Was served chicken. The person who took the order and the manager were gracious to accept their mistake. However, this combined with the fact that my daughter has fallen sick on both occasions when we went there.
author: Suresh S.

description:
Happy New Year! I have decided to come out of my Yelp retirement with a review on my favorite Happy Hour spot in the City. Since my move to SF, I've been looking for new go-tos. Although I had been to Rosa Mexicano in West Hollywood, it wasn't until my SF friends took me here that I realized how amazing it is.

Happy Hour specials generally fall in one of two categories - cheap food or cheap drinks. Luckily, Rosa has both and it's done with class.

I had never been a big drinks person, probably because I don't love how alcohol tastes. The Frozen Mango Margarita ($6) here is so yummy and you can barely taste the alcohol but don't be fooled, it is strong. You will feel it after one and get a nice buzz after two. If you're brave enough to go for three, get ready for a long nap afterward.

In addition to the wonderful drink specials, I love the empanadas, tacos, and nachos. Benji (the corgi) also appreciates the outdoor seating, where Happy Hour is also available.

I'm not sure how the dinner menu is but Happy Hour is a steal!
author: Yi Z.

description: I've been here for happy hour twice, and it's been garnered a similar reaction each time: it's just OK. I absolutely love their super super fresh guacamole and happy hour menu, and the drink selection isn't awful.  Just like any other place in the FiDi/SOMA area, seating is really tight and it gets overly boisterous after 5PM (ala Rickshaw-noisy).  In any case, it's a fantastic option if you have small aka less than 5 party and bar seating is plentiful.  No one really seems to come here for dinner, so it really just seems like a happy hour spot.  Rosa will always be in the mix for places for happy hour, mostly because of its location of being close to BART, the TransBay terminal, and Muni.
author: Lisa I.

description:
Came here for happy hour and ordered a few pitchers of margaritas with co-workers. along with chips, salsa and guac. Server made the guac at the table and it was delicious. 

Don't remember the rest b/c the drinks were strong and I blacked out... Will definitely come back ;)
author: Denniz S.

description: This place is very good when you have a larger group that you want to have a sit down meal or dinner with. The margaritas are good (I am always surprised at the number of taquerias that are in the city, there are relatively few places with nice seating and a full bar, both which Rosa Mexicano has). The food is decent, albeit not too spicy. Anyone used to taqueria mexican food will want more spice and flavors. Come here for a nice setting, good service, margaritas and okay food.
author: Patrick S.

description: Rosa mexicano some dishes are good but others not  so much, the service super slow at the point that I needed to stand up for request the check. They should work more in the presentation of the dishes. Hopefully they will improve and offer a better service to the client. Until then I don't pretend to return back.
author: Julie C.

description: I went here for a dinner on a Saturday night and it was quite a different experience from the work week lunch experience.  Service was inconsistent; the restaurant was out of two menu items; the restaurant was dead - only 1 other party was there.  Yes, I was disappointed with dinner.  Lunch on the other hand has been good, so I'll only go here during the work week.
author: Donna G.

description:
I haven't been here for a real meal, only for the happy hour, but it's a good one! 

Guacamole made table side, and happy hour margaritas?! Enough said! The guac was pretty good, and the margaritas are strong! I think I may just become a regular!

Oh, and the tacos were good too!
author: Lisa N.

description:
The things we do for love...

Came here because the boyfriend's (now husband) son wanted Mexican, and we were in the FiDi, not the home of the best Mexican in the city.  It seemed like a viable option.  I had eaten at the Rosa Mexicano in DC back in the late 90s a couple times and remembered it as being pretty good.  I guess quality has nose-dived with all the expansion.

What to get?  Guac, very good.  Margarita, also good.  After that, I would say the food was very average to below average Mexican fare that would never call me back again. I had enchiladas, BF had fajitas, his son had nachos. All were decent, just not memorable and definitely not the better offerings here in SF, and not the best prices either.

They do have a decent happy hour menu, and if I was down here during HH it would be worth stopping by for a margarita and guacamole.  Otherwise, head to the Mission.
author: Kathryn E.

description: Good for a happy hour after work but not much else. It's overpriced and portions are small. Also the drinks are not strong at all. Food is great more Latin inspired then traditional Latin cuisine.
author: Omar H.

description: Great guacamole, not the most authentic but way better than most Mexican restaurants in the area
author: P E.

description: Rosa has great tex-mex, and superb margaritas. However, a little more on the pricey side. Definitely not authentic mexican but nonetheless it is still good! It has a large space and in a good location so it is a great place to grab dinner with co-workers or meet a group of friends. Definitely get the table side guac, worth the price!
author: Sarah R.

description:
Best churros I've ever had.

I can't believe they have pitchers of sangria but wont do pitchers of margaritas.  I would've given 5 stars if they did.
author: Rego S.

description:
My husband works in the building so I've sat in the car across the street and watched the crowds walking in. You'd think judging the crowd it'd be a great place. Today my husband asked me to meet him and his colleague for pre-dinner drinks. They got there just before Happy Hour ended and the waiter suggested a jug of margarita (which he claims is 5-6 glasses). Like some men, my husband didn't ask about the price. When I signed the bill, I got sticker shock- the jug costs $84! It was basically billed as 7 glasses of the El Jimador Clasico!!! 

The bill was $111 for a jug of margarita, 1 order of guac and a (Happy Hour) beer. And to make matters worse, we were sitting just off the bar and it took the staff 10 minutes to notice us signaling for the check and another 5 minutes to bring it. Ok, first AND last time then.
author: Farah A.

description:
Came here for HH with a bunch of coworkers.
We ordered a pitcher of white wine sangria which was very good. Nice and strong, not too sweet or overwhelming with the taste of alcohol. 
We also got guacamole which they make fresh in front of you! It was very good. Maybe just a little bit more salt to make the flavors pop would be nice.
The flautas were OK. They were small like the size of skinny eggrolls. 
Lastly we had the queso fundido. It's essentially melted cheese with chorizo. It was OK. Nothing too special or tasty about it.
author: Michelle T.

description:
I've been here multiple times but this was the first time I sat at the restaurant;  we usually go to the bar area (in that area, it's a pleasant experience, fast service, and good drinks).

I really wish I could give this place more stars. Everything was so overpriced for its quality. I felt like  the problems were more because of poor management  and training. Our server made a lot of mistakes but he was trying really hard and he was definitely overwhelmed and in the weeds. He was triple sat three 6+ tables within ten minutes and he was stretched thin. I felt bad, but that's no excuse. The restaurant team should have been helping him more (at least the manager should have jumped in or visited us). One busser was backing him up, even taking our orders. Being short-staffed is not a good enough reason for the storm we experienced. I think the manager partially delivered our food. I specifically told him that I ordered the small salad with NO chicken ($8) and he's like "this is it." Two of our other orders were completely off and had to be re-fired. The server tried really hard, this was definitely a deeper problem of dynamics.

Between everyone else at our table trying to get the unresponsive/busy staff's attention, I gave up on trying to tell the restaurant that my chicken was raw on the inside, and as a result i was afraid to even eat the romaine around it. I'm so disappointed in the whole thing. The server was very communicative and apologetic. I feel that this was a situation where the manager should have been present or aware of what was happening at least. Our bill came to ~$350. So not worth it. Though I used to frequent this spot, I don't really feel the urge to be a frequent customer anymore.  :(
author: Zara S.

description: We went for happy hour. Delicious margaritas and $30 for a pitcher was a great deal. Quesadillas, nachos, and salsas were pretty good too. Good experience overall.
author: Divya S.

description:
Came here for a small team lunch ~5 people. Great guacamole & chips but nearly took 45 mins to get our meal... I wish they offered complimentary guac or something to hold us over for the really long wait... 


Update: manager reached out to apologize and was quite genuine about it
author: Hina P.

description: Upscale and a bit expensive Mexican join but my friend and I still had a good time dining at this restaurant. The interior is modern and well decorated with a wall of water running down. The service is attentive and friendly. We went for their table-side guacamole ($14). It's a must-order if it's your first time dining here since they make the guac right in front of you. It was super fresh and delicious, but at the price tag, it was more for the show. We also got their carnitas tacos and the tres enchiladas. The carnitas were delicious and the sauces for the enchiladas were very good. This is one of those places where I had a great time dining at but probably would not return.
author: Hoyan L.

description: Great location and atmosphere but service and drinks are lacking and expensive. Went here for a weeknight dinner after work and waiter asked if we wanted any guacamole with our chips. Of course we said yes thinking maybe an extra $5 since it is the city. Little did we know they came out with a huge bowl of guacamole and charged us $15! I wouldn't be too bitter about it, if they actually gave us the experience that other tables were getting with the guacamole being made right in front of them. But they just sat it on our table like two girls would finish a whole bowl of guac? Margaritas were also lacking tequila and overpriced.
author: Taylor D.

description: Steak was  ruined. The  outside was burnt and tasted like charcoal . Didnt bring a proper knife for the meat.. bartender didn't know what we ordered.. we had to repeat our order 4 times.. $70 for 3 coronas, I appetizer and one entree. And service was just awful. I've been living in the city for over 10 years and this is one of the worst spots I've had dinner..
author: Omeed M.

description:
This review is only for the frozen marg - not the service or the food since we didn't have any.

The frozen marg was SOOOO GOOD!!! I know many places in sf won't do blended drinks bc it's not "fancy" or "authentic" but whatever I love them, so I was really happy to find this place had them for happy hour. The consistency was the best! More of a very thin slushy like drink that kept its form if that makes sense (I don't really like ones that are watery or have course ice). Taste also delicious! Located in a convenient place too, where I have to restrict myself from going after work every day haha.
author: Foodeater F.

description:
- Very bad service by the host  (the two ladies at the front need serious customer service training)
- Waiter/Chef do not follow proper instructions (one of the client I was with requested to serve his food minus certain ingredient - the waiter brought the entree with that ingredient...not once but twice!...I can understand making a mistake once...but after re-ordering and waiting another 20 minutes brings back with the same mistake yet again!)  DON'T GO WITH CLIENTS here.
- Billing (charged those entrees as two different charges and took forever to resolve that issue...it should have been quick.  Spent another 15-20 mins until the waiter resolved the billing issue).
- Food quality has significantly deteriorated from when I used to go take clients/co-workers here from 6-10 months ago.
bottom line....DON'T GO WITH CLIENTS/CO-WORKERS here.
author: Raj S.

description:
There is way better Mexican in SF.   And this is really expensive.   The margaritas are about three sips-worth, and probably $14 or something.   The guac is good, yes.  But the fish tacos were forgettable.  I brought a bunch of clients.   Everyone had a nice time, but no one said that they loved the food, actually no comment at all.  

I am giving it 3-stars because they were flexible with an ever-growing group, the service was very nice and friendly, and overall - having 10 or so clients to dinner for $60-80 per person including drinks was a good price.
author: Scott H.

description:
Very nice place with amazing service - but the food was just alright and overpriced.

Everyone loves the guac - which comes in a big giant stone bowl for $18. I didn't think the guac was worth the price. I also had their ice tea which I also heard was good, but it wasn't great to me either. I had the beef tacos - which came on a stone platter with tortillas in a pink dish with a cover. I thought everything looked good, but not worth its price. Probably won't return unless it is with my coworkers.
author: Amanda C.

description:
$26 tacos. 

I've passed this place many times on the weekends on my way to the Ferry building thinking I'd probably never go here. But somehow i found myself here not too long ago for HH with a friend who flew over to SF for work. 

In between us catching up and guzzling down on our imbibe of choice we decided it might be a good idea to order the guacamole (am I the only one that is bothered by "guac"? It's right up there along with words like "delish", "wifey" and "fab". Cringe.) and chips as snack to absorb the alcohol since we both had somewhere to be afterwards. 

The guacamole didn't look finished. Although I've had chunky guacamole before this one was the chunkiEST. The largest chunk - a fourth of a whole guacamole was just sitting in the bowl so we had to use our chips to slice off bits of the avocado. Later, I just took a fork and mashed it up. I'm really not sure if this is just how they make their guacamole or if they didn't mix ours as well as they should have. The favor was just okay. 

Drinks were good (I had a mango margarita - not a drink I would typically order) but service was pleasant and prompt. 

Not horrible but if I end up here again most likely it was not my decision to come back.
author: Esther A.

description:
Wow, if you've ever been to Rick Bayless' Frontera Grill in Chicago, this place...doesn't even come close. I had really high hopes going in because my coworker said it was great and was charmed by its nice decor, but I left somewhat disappointed.

The meal started out with the typical Mexican appetizer: chips and salsa. How can someone get chips and salsa wrong? Well, they did with stale chips. Even good guac and salsa could not save bad chips. 

For the entree, I had the Pollo Pobil. It was quite good. Surprisingly, it didn't come with tortillas like most restaurants. Guess they were 'extra'.

There are not many gourmet style Mexican restaurants in the City so it's a nice addition to the local variety. But it should live up to the price and this place didn't.
