What was good about Rosa is this place is spacious and includes outdoor seating. The staff was also great and didn't make a stink when we were drunkenly loud.
author: Albert L.

description: Loved the food! I ordered guacamole, chicken empanadas, and shrimp tacos. The guacamole is a must have and is on happy hour menu. Very fresh and spicy and a generous portion! The empanadas are pretty small for $11 but tasty. I would skip them just because of size and price. Tacos were very crafty, with corn meal dusted shrimp and kale. Yummy!
author: A. K.

description: Great food and great service. We went here for a company event. We had guacamole, salsa, enchiladas, salmon, chicken tacos and churros. All the food tasted fresh and delicious.
author: Joey R.

description: Beautiful place for dinner in FiDi!  Came here to celebrate husband's birthday with a group of 10 and was able to make a flawless resi on OpenTable.  Everyone was amazing.  We had a couple of different servers who helped our party.  We ordered queso and tableside guacamole for the group.  Two of each app was perfect for 10 people.  The tableside guac was awesome and custom made for your level of spice.  For my spice fans, the medium is good but I'd order spicy if I was with a different crowd.  Entrees are pretty sizeable.  I ordered the chicken flautas off the appetizer menu and husband got the enchiladas suizas.  The enchiladas were OK... I think the rancheros would've been a better choice.  The flautas were delicious... smothered in a green chili and a red sauce, they were crispy and delectable.  They brought us out desserts including espresso flan, tres leches cake and a ton of churros con chocolate.  Each one was delicious!  Drinks were really tasty.. I had the mojito di pina and it was delish.  I loved how beautiful this place was and how amazing the service was.  I'd definitely be back for more tasty eats!
author: Reena P.

description: My boyfriend and I checked out rosa Mexicano after a lovely day of hiking and sightseeing. We wanted to try the guacamole in Mocajete and pomegranate margaritas. The hostess was nice and kindly recommended the bar. While there Jose the bartender was extremely polite and knowledgeable about the menu. The manager came over and said hello. I asked him about the ppx appetizers and he said that they would be right out. We also ordered our guacamole (medium spice) he said he would input the order and proceeded to leave the bar area. Our drinks came out without a problem. Sadly we asked to order a boudin de pollo and asked about our guacamole. Jose checked and let us know that the order was not entered. It was extremely frustrating. I loved rosa! I was a former employee. Jose rushed ordered our boudin and guacamole and really tried to remedy the situation. We left and promised never to go back. When we got back to our hotel room I noticed the boudin was missing the tomatillo base that I had grown to love. :/ it is my hope that the staff gets it together to not disappoint future customers. What would Josefina (Howard)DO? #WWJD
author: Jermaine J.

description:
I went there during lunch on a weekday and it gets pretty full. Love the location and the food. Food takes a while to come on the table but it's worth it.

Recommendations:
1. Guac (we ordered medium spicy and it was good)
2. Rancheras Enchiladas (3 cheese enchiladas with cream and tomato sauce. Delicious)
author: Hiral P.

description: Great place for groups if you're looking to hang out in the Embarcadero area. That's pretty much it. Hard to judge my experience here because I had an amazing time with the friends I was with, but the food and drinks were average. I mean the good Mexican food is on the other end of Mission St, what can I say? There were plenty of chips and salsa. The guacamole looked alright, though I didn't try any. I had some of the quesadilla that was ordered for the table, but the meat tasted dry and starchy. And the sangria tasted like fruit juice. Blergh.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
We were walking from the Ferry Building to the ballpark and stumbled across this place and stopped in for some food. The restaurant has a very cool feel, the decor is very modern with a Mexican flare.  We had a large party of ten and it only took them a few minutes to push a couple tables together to seat us.  

The service was exceptional but the food was just OK.  Everything I tasted seemed to be just a little bit bland.  Chicken tacos didn't have the flavor I am used to and the guacamole tasted just like it was just smashed up avocados, there just wasn't enough seasoning.  With that said, the queso appetizer was exceptional it had great flavor and the cocktails were great; try the sangria.

All in all exceptional service, ok foo, and great cocktails.  I will definitely give it another chance, I might have just ordered the wrong meal.
author: Eric V.

description: Loved this place!!!   Had lunch here with my good friend, Linda the Great. How great is she?  She's so great, she makes Alexander the Great, look like Alexander the Wuss!   Her Greatness had pineapple juice(tasted fresh) and I created my own margarita!  Of course it was perfect!  The guacamole was made at our table in a huge mortar(they sell them), and we both agreed that it was the best guac that we eva had!  Her Greatness had the Rancheras Cheese Enchiladas and I had the Baja Tacos(Dos XX battered panko crusted local white fish, house made slaw with jalapeno tartar sauce and grilled Mexican corn).  We both loved our dishes, and I would have to say, the best fish tacos I eva had!  Armando was our very wonderful, handsome server.  Beautiful restaurant and close to the Embarcadero Bart.
author: Blondie R.

description:
Hand-made guac before your eyes!  That's the best part of Rosa Mexicano. I also really liked their mushroom quesadillas. Never had anything quite like that. Unfortunately, I don't think this was on the regular menu. It was served as part of the hors d' oeuvres for our company gathering.

Other than that, the chips were just okay, and their tacos were also just okay. I think you have to be a bit drunk off of happy hour margaritas to really enjoy most of the food here. It has a great space for a corporate gathering or other meetup. They are very accommodating to large groups, and they have lots of standing space in the back. I think they created this place specifically to cater to the big corporate gatherings that run off from the financial district.
author: Audrey L.

description:
This place was perfect for a Saturday date with my fiance.  We arrived at 5pm and were greeted promptly by the host.  It wasn't too busy, maybe 6 tables had guests.  Our server came by quite often to make sure we had everything we needed.      Very bright and airy atmosphere.  My favorite feature was the wall long waterfall, gorgeous.  The prices were great, considering the large portions and freshness.  I'm always hesitant to order steak, well done, because often well done at most restaurants means chewy and tuff.  But I figured I would give it a try.  It was perfect, juicy and tender!  Our margarita was quite strong but nothing a little ice couldn't fix.  You get your monies worth.  We also had plantains, Mexican street corn, rice, refried black beans, shrimp and a cheese Enchilada.  Plenty for 2 people to share with a yummy take-home bag too.
  I must admit that I was hesitant to eat here from their 3 star rating as well as some of the negative yelp reviews I had read.  I strongly disagree. This place deserves 5 stars!
author: Frisco T.

description:
Ok, I have been here several times now for Happy Hour and for a dinner party.

Happy Hour is 4-7pm and a seat yourself where you can atmosphere.  The drinks and food are priced right, so everyone and their damn mother is there trying to get the same great deal. My coworkers and I always get the pitcher of Sangria and guacamole - you can't go wrong.

For the dinner party it was another story. We had a reservation for 12, the hostess for the evening was not very polite. The point of having a hostess is to graciously welcome your patrons to the restaurant, not give them attitude and a cold shoulder. Mind you yes she did her job correctly and no she was not unprofessional, it just did not feel warm and inviting. We ended up having about 15 people show, we had just about everything on the menu and the bill was about $35 each in the end. Not bad for drinks and food. 

Recommended for happy hour, no more than a group of 4 otherwise good luck trying to find a place to sit !
author: Lynette G.

description: A fun place to stop for a bite of lunch on a Saturday afternoon. We were looking for a spot to avoid the Super Bowl crowd and stumbled upon this place. The margaritas were good, the arrachera was delicious, and you can never go wrong with the tableside guacamole. The decor inside was nice, there's plenty of room, but we really enjoyed sitting outside and people watching. The service got a little slow as they got busier but that's to be expected, especially with the Super Bowl in town. The prices were fair given that it's in the city. We would definitely try this place again.
author: Sandy M.

description:
Three strikes are you are out Rosa! SERVICE is the worst. We had no server for 15 minutes after sitting down, then someone else drops off the food, no refills for the empty glasses, no check in for another 30 minutes, so we flag someone passing by down to ask for the check....they can 10 minutes later, take our bill and credit card and don't come back for another 20 minutes! We still don't know if we had a server. 

FOOD - 
Mediocre at best. So sad.
author: Jason P.

description: We had a bad experience!  We had a reservation and the restaurant was basically empty. The hostess seated us at a cramped table next to the bus station. I asked her politely if she could give us a window booth. She said because all the tables are reserved!  Well the place was empty and by the time we finished eating SEVERAL booth tables remained empty. She basically flat out lied to me for no good reason.  Then we had to wait more than 15 minutes for someone to come to our table, ANYONE. I finally asked a passing bus boy to get our waiter.  The waiter came with hurried aggressive energy. It was awful.
author: Karim D.

description:
Trendy expensive Mexican food. I don't feel the need to go back. 

Pros: The ambiance is nice. The staff and service was good. The food tasted good.

Cons: It's not the type of place that serves margaritas by the pitcher. $11.50 for the house margarita, in a small glass with lots of ice. $26 for guacamole ("serves 4-6"). $19 for chicken enchiladas with a really creamy green sauce. Also, no chili rellenos (it's not that type of Mexican restaurant.)

Recommendation: If you like creamy, trendy Mexican food, then you will like this place. If you like the more traditional Baja type Mexican food, you will need to look elsewhere.
author: Jac M.

description:
I went there with my family for dinner.  The food is above average and their guacamole is exceptional but will run you at about $25.  In a nutshell, the food is WAY WAY overpriced.   They don't have any of your fundamental mexican dishes like burritos and tacos - it's all fancy-schmancy chef-concocted mexican.   I guess you pay for the location. 

If you are on the business credit card, go for it.  Go sit outside and watch the streetcars  and doubledecker buses go by with the bay bridge backdrop and "feel" San Francisco.
author: Khash C.

description:
TL;DR: Strong drinks. Fresh ingredients. Pricey. 

I walked in with a friend on a Friday night during happy hour. The place was crowded, but I guess that's not too much of a surprise when drinks are $6. 

The mango margarita was strong. It didn't taste like mango at all, and upon inspection of the happy hour menu, I realized that it's just tequila, triple sec, and agave. It wasn't a big deal, but if you're looking for something that tastes like mango, don't get this drink. 

The pineapple mojito actually tasted like pineapple. It was tart and sweet and also strong. I'd highly suggest the mojito if you're looking for a sweet cocktail. 

We were planning on meeting with 5 more friends so I asked the front if it was possible to squeeze us in without a reservation. The hostess said that our chances were slim but to put in a name and a number, and they'll try their best. I got a call in 20 minutes for an open table for 7. 

The food is very good, but extremely overpriced. I ordered the Quesadilla de Res from the appetizer menu. It was $11. It was a bit small but the quesadilla was flavorful and delicious. My friends ordered entrees and the portions were quite large, so keep in mind that appetizers are truly appetizer sized here. We also shared 2 orders of the guacamole, which was great with the fresh chips and salsa. They were $14 apiece. 

Although the service and happy hour drinks were fantastic, I probably wouldn't back to this place for food. You're spending an exorbitant amount of money for food that you can get in the Mission for half the price (with double the portions). It was a nice experience, but not a place that I would visit regularly as my stomach and wallet would hurt.
author: Steven L.

description: This is a high-end Mexican restaurant because of their high-end prizes. I ordered three tacos and my brother ordered a plate of chicken quesadilla. We ordered mild salsa for our chips. Chips were fresh. Our main entrees though were below expectations.  My tacos was very salty and spicy. I did not even finish the last taco on my 3 small taco plate. My brother on the other hand could not even finish half of his plate. Not worth the price. The worst is that the server will ask you if you want guacamole for your chips like it was complimentary dipping sauce for your chips. You get a stone bowl full of guacamole salsa instead. And they will charge you $15 dollars for that guacamole! Had the waiter told me at the outset that it will cost that much then I would have declined. He served it to us like sweeping dust under a rug. Sneaky.
author: Ramil M.

description:
I had a crummy experience here today.  Ordered at 12:15, didn't get food until 12:50 and had to take it to go.   But more importantly  - and this is a message to the owner and chef.   You guys ruined the Pollo Pibil.   This used to be a very generous portion of chicken breast, peppers and plantains.   Now it's a 80% plantains, 10% onions and a very small dry sad piece of chicken.    Not remotely satisfying and while the new presentation is 'cute' it is no longer worth the inflated price.    It's a half price serving at best.  

Please change it back.
author: Rick R.

description:
Came here for lunch and dinner and really enjoyed myself both times! When I came for lunch I had reservations but a took a while to get seated. Service was good generally.

Love how they bring out a cart and make the guacamole in front of you. Had the enchiladas and really enjoyed them. 

Decor is cool here.
author: Azizi A.

description: Tried the guacamole, pescado de mahi mahi tacos and alambre de camarones and white wine sangria. All excellent.  They have a kids menu which includes drinks and ice cream.
author: Andy Y.

description:
I really like this place.
Always has room (even on big nights like Halloween) and the food is pretty decent.
author: Niloufar M.

description:
I've been a fan of Rosa since I lived in DC. So, I'm a bit biased. Is it the best Mexican food that ever was? - No, but it is excellent. 

 Is the service impeccable, and the frozen pomegranate margarita delicious? - Yes.  I also really like their Mole, and the fresh Guacamole made to order at your table.
author: Greg F.

description:
I'll echo all the previous reviews that say if you want your food in a reasonable timeframe, don't come here.  We had a group lunch there recently, and we were there from before 11:30 until almost 2.  And in case you think we were eating the whole time, it was a fixed family style menu (so they knew what they were making before we got there) with guac, a salad, entrees and dessert.  It doesn't make sense that we were there for two and a half hours.

The food was fine, I suppose.  I didn't much care for it, but others might have.
author: Megan V.

description:
The first time I tried Rosa was in Dubai when I was visiting the UAE. I didn't know that it was a global brand! While venturing around SoMa I spotted the familiar looking interior. I was in the mood for Mexican so I decided to pop in.

Carlos, is an extremely attentive bar tender. He suggested a few different drinks and I ended up getting the house Marg. They have a great HH menu--try the chicken quesadillas.

Overall, for the price and quality I would definitely be back. It's a great place to catch up and they have outdoor seating which is always a plus!
author: Shana B.

description: I used to come here almost religously every Tuesday and every experience has been different. First they had bottomless guac and now they don't, one day they might have churros and the next they won't, and the choices of sauces they for the churro have gone from 3 different flavors to just 1. But the most unforgiving change of Rosa Mexicano is changing the 2 salsas (red and green) they give you with chips to a mild pace picante salsa that literally tastes it came from a plastic bottle. We asked twice if they could bring us some of the spicy red at least and we were told "we changed our salsa,". My coworkers and I have decided to start going elsewhere after the inconsistencies.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
The guacamole is probably the only 4 star aspect of this fancy mexican restaurant.  I loved that they made it in front of you and you could adjust the spiciness as needed, also, DELICIOUS!

For the quality of the food, I felt this place was overpriced, but not surprising given the location and decor.  It's definitely not your typical mission style restaurant and the prices reflect this. My $14 quesedilla was unimpressive.. it reminded me of cafeteria food, although my work cafeteria offers better chicken quesedillas for $8 with a salad..so likely not a repeat here.
author: Melody T.

description: $18 for2 Pacifico beers?!!  Aye yay aye...  Excellent Mesacal selection, but no real ginger beer to mak Oaxcan Mules.  I won't be back - way overpriced and bartender didn't even know the extensive mescal selection.
author: Jim H.

description:
I work two buildings over and walk by this place every day. I've been wanting to try it forever and finally did on Friday evening. A coworker and I went there for Happy Hour and sat at the bar. The staff was very welcoming and friendly and there were plenty of places to sit. It was about 4:30 PM when we got there and when we left at 6:00 the place was packed so get there early if you want a good seat. 

We each had a mojito and they were super tasty. Only $6 too! We shared the queso fondue and the nachos. This was plenty of food and extremely exceptional for bar food. It was high quality, tasted great, not a long wait and filled us up! 

We talked about how great of a place this is and how we will definitely be coming back more often! Give this place a try, it's one of the nicer bars in this area and very affordable. Also easy access to the Embarcadero and Bart.
author: Dusty N.

description:
Came in and ordered a chicken Caesar salad to go. It took them 30 minutes and it didn't even have any chicken on it. Didn't figure that out until I got back to the office. Came back and the hostess who took my order brought it back out with chicken in under a minute, proving the initial wait was unnecessary. Never going back.

EDIT: and the new chicken is cold. Brilliant
author: Jim O.

description: I work around the corner and have been here multiple times for happy hours and dinner.  I think they are best for HH drinks, incredible chips, quac and salsas, and select dishes.  The service can sometimes improve but I also know they get slammed.  Try it out and you'll walk away happy, especially after a few margaritas!
author: e w.

description: OVERPRICED. Service was terrible. Yes, i know it's busy here during lunch hour. But the staff should have it down with the hustle and bustle of the financial district, as all the other retaurants do down here. Food was meh. Salsa was lacking. I think the only thing that was actually decent here was there guacamole. No need to review anything else, as it's not even worth my time.
author: Ann T.

description: This place has an amazing happy hour!!!! Great margaritas, sangria, tacos and guacamole. Get the guacamole mild as it is really spicy!! Very attentive service as well. Get there early to get seats!
author: Christine E.

description:
Lunch was decent, but expensive.  15 base price for fish tacos (3 of them).  The tacos were tasty, nicely fried and breaded, but it's just too pricy.  They also have a happy hour, which seems a little more reasonable, so I might check that out.

Service is very kind and quick, no issues there.  Stars are given basically on price vs quantity/quality, but what can you really expect from fidi?  Still, with so many other places to check out, for the price, they have to step up their game.
author: Andy V.

description:
Rosas is one of my favorite happy hour spots. I met up with a friend there for happy hour last night, and they didn't disappoint! The nachos are BOMB (I've had both the short rib and chicken nachos, and would recommend the short rib!), and their drinks are really good for a really reasonable price during happy hour. It consistently delivers.

Service can be a bit slow sometimes, hence only a 4 star review.
author: Grace M.

description: We stopped into Rosa's for lunch on a Saturday. Decor is lovely and service was okay. The frozen pomegranate margarita was fantastic! And they had green tomatillo salsa, which is always my personal favorite. We tried the shrimp tacos (camarones capeados) and enchiladas rancheras. They were both fantastic and filling. If you can't be bothered to get to the Mission, the Mexican food here will do!
author: Cassandra J.

description:
Place is very interesting as it has a water wall
It's really wide, and really tall
with little weird diving figurines all over
one thing for sure you won't a place like this in Dover

OK, I guess this place is hip, but to me it's just OK.  The food is actually pretty tasty (guac is over hyped in my opinion).  Had the steak skillet and that was really delicious as it's a square piece of meat over melted cheese (which tasted really really good) but all in all, the cost and the ambiance didn't do it for me.  I guess it's a good place to go for business meetings, but yeah, for some reason this place being a "Mexican" restaurant but upscale felt weird.  Though other may like this, I have no argument, as I'm sure some people would like this place, but just ain't for me.
author: Dennis K.

description:
There is something about Rosa Mexicano that perturbs me. I felt like I was walking into a Mexican restaurant that you would find on the Las Vegas Strip or something. There are a lot of bright colors and the decor is quiet beautiful, but something about it seems off. Like a pig wearing lipstick. 

I went for happy hour and got a $6 margarita (great price, could have been stronger, but it was still pretty tasty), a $5 happy hour quesadilla (decent) - which is served with complimentary chips and salsa. The salsa bowls are SO SMALL they are more for design rather than the function of scooping salsa onto a chip. My friend got the white wine sangria. It tasted like a sweet juice... and if super sweet drinks are your thing, then you'll enjoy the sangria. We opted NOT to have the $14 guacamole. Seriously? $14 for guac? You gotta be kidding me. 

The servers were VERY nice and attentive... But you will find better drinks and MUCH better food if you go to the Mission. Rosa Mexicano is a glorified Chevy's at best.
author: Leonie S.

description: Went last night 9/10/16 for a birthday dinner with a party of 11. Really, really savory, crispy (yet not dried out) carnitas!! Absolutely delicious cocojitos!! Rice was a little dry and bland. Guacamole was freshly made table side, and had a slight heat to it...very yummy. Churros for dessert was enough to share between 2-3 people, and were crisp and awesome with a Mexican chocolate dipping sauce! They didn't have the cheesecake for dessert any longer, which I was kind of bummed about, because I had heard great things about it. Service was awesome. we had 2 attentive waiters. Very good 1st time experience!
author: Malika A.

description:
A solid three stars. This is a good place for happy hour. Not overly crowded on week days and plenty of space. 

They have decent Sangria and guacamole. Neither really stood out. I also tried the pork and scallop tacos here, but they were just OK as well.
author: Catherine C.

description:
This review would be a five star if the prices weren't so high. It just seemed like they were gauging... getting greedy or something. I had to apologize to my buddy for booking this place. We both walked out $26 poorer after just an enchilada, some chips, and an ice tea. Ouch! I stole their pen to compensate a little. 

The food, enchilada mole, was really pretty good for mole - which I like. The chips are those thick kind, lightly salted. Love those. The salsa was very good. I thought the menu offered a lot of very authentic-looking (I have no idea) dishes and some of the $24 items looked amazing. But, hey, it's lunch. That's a lot of money for lunch. Decent pen though.
author: Todd A.

description: This place seriously went downhill.  Their food used to taste fresher and now its pretty clear everything is processed and there are no fresh ingredients. Also they do not use organic avocados. They removed things from their menu as well and were not very accomodating with substitutions the way they used to be.  But seems most people come here after work for happy hour and are too inebriated to realize this.  You lost me as a future customer.
author: Stan W.

description: Had lunch here today. We ordered guac which was delicious along with the green and chipotle salsas. I ordered three tacos with short rib. It was okay but they would have been better with cilantro instead of watercress. The meal came with street corn. The corn itself was delicious but there was way too much crema/mayo which made it heavy. The rice was not bad but slightly undercooked and not seasoned enough. The star of my meal was the pineapple agua fresca. Sooooo delish! For the price it was just okay. I would probably go back for drinks and apps but not for a meal.
author: Lina L.

description:
This review is based solely on Happy Hour drinks/food.

My buddy and I went in to meet some other friends and found a nice 4 top in le bar area. We were quickly greeted by a very nice waitress who took our drink orders, and complimented us on our choices (the 1800 marg - very tasty and strong). She was attentive, our drinks were brought out soon after ordering each time.

Later, once we were all lubed up, we ordered some of the chicken flautas, very yummy. Lots of sauce drizzled on top, not overwhelming, but very tasty. 

I will be back for more soon!
author: Crystal C.

description: The food, service and atmosphere was great here. Get the guacamole, its made table side and you can choose how mild or hot you would like it. Our server was excellent, as were the host staff. Great experience all around.
author: Amanda X.

description: The tableside guacamole was very good and a great start to our meal.  The menu is a little tricky to understand because the spices were unfamiliar to me, but everything was delicious and everyone in our party was happy with their meal.  Although the restaurant is kid-friendly, the menu and spice level isn't kid-friendly.
author: Sheila C.

description: This place has the best customer service. Everyone is so friendly and accommodating. Our server Julio was so fun to talk to and actually from Mexico. The food was great I enjoyed the Tres Enchiladas. The salsa is great and they make guac at your table. But I stress that the service is awesome.
author: Christina R.

description:
This was my second visit here to Rosa Mexicano and would highly recommend this restaurant for a date or just a causal afternoon lunch.  We were promptly greeted by the smiling hostess who asked if there were any vegetarians in the party so she could bring the additional menu.  She had a great smile and made us feel very welcome.  This time I dined with my family and my mom was present, Party of 4.  We were promptly greeted with a friendly smile, chips, salsa (amazing , chunky and flavorful) and water.  The server asked if we dined there before and welcomed us back.  Suggested the guacamole to start, the cart was rolled over to the table and a beautiful mocajete was the foundation of our soon to be devoured perfect guacamole.  I was telling the table the queso fundido was to die for, so we ordered that as a second appetizer.  When the cast iron skillet of ooey' gooey melted deliciousness was brought to the table, we served our mom first with one of the perfectly cooked and homemade I might add, corn tortilla.  I mean honestly, if butter was served with them, I would have proposed.  The peppers in the queso fundido add a small amount of heat and the vibrant green cilantro adds a freshness to the melted, salty, creamy cheese we were about to enjoy.  Two native Texans agreed the cheer was authentic and clearly imported!  We talked mom (really had to twist her arm) into ordering a Paloma cocktail, this is the cocktail I had, ok fine, a few I had when I was there the first time in my date.  A very mild and smooth tequila with red grapefruit juice, the rim covered in their original concoction of amazing.  A must try!

We then moved on to entrees, after all the apps I had the chicken tortilla soup which was absolutely delightful.  It is a unique soup here because the broth is more of a sauce (like a red enchilada sauce) with moist and flavorful chicken, plenty of cheese, tortilla strips and fresh cilantro.  Mom had the tinga de res tacos, which were served with a very generous portion of flavorful, juicy and well seasoned meat.  Of course the home made corn tortillas were divine!  The pickled red onions was a great addition of acidity to the tacos!  I love that they serve the tacos on a plate with the cool taco stand so the tacos stay upright, whoever invented this was pure genius.  The others had the Arrachera which was a perfectly cooked medium, with a warm pink center served a top beautifully grilled green and red peppers and onions, oh and I did I forget to mention, more cheese?  It was also served with two other salsas, a green tomatillo salsa, which had a sweet note and a fiery red salsa that had heat.  The entrees were also served with perfectly cooked, fluffy and well seasoned Mexican rice and black beans (retired style).  Both were a great accompaniment to the meal and we were all very impressed with the flavor extracted from the beans and rice.  

Lastly our outstanding waiter suggested churros for dessert, he painted a picture I could taste, but unfortunately we were stuffed from the lunch.  We will definitely be back to enjoy the rest of the menu and our new found favorites!  

I hope you give this amazing restaurant a try, it is only two blocks from Embarcadero BART stop and they have a great outdoor eating area and bar area!
author: Gregory M.

description:
guacamole en mocajete es muy bueno. 

My take on this  place is that it is one of those new "designer" mexican restaurants that have been popping up around the bay area. The guacamole is made at your table which is a nice touch and you can request your level of spicyness to suite your personal tastes however for what you get the whole menu seems a tad overpriced even for the embarcadero. Worth trying out for the guacamole and the desserts to which I've applied pictures for here on yelp but with the high prices and the overcrowding at peak times I'm not keen on bookmarking this just yet.
author: Norris T.

description: Very meh Mexican food.  The person who I went with did not like her meal at all, she didn't even finish it.  No free chips and salsa in the beginning of the meal.
author: C L.

description:
Long post - for the short review it is this - The chef has delusions of grandeur, management was rude and overbearing, and service was, in general, deplorable.  

I was in yesterday, for the first time, with two friends who had been there previously.  We were meeting up for happy hour, and the place was definitely busy, but for the location (just off the Embarcadero) this was to be expected.  My friend got there first and got us a table near the back.  It was, also to be expected, quite noisy, but with a little yelling we could hear each other.

So, our complaints were really all about the service, which was awful.  Simply awful.  My friend arrived promptly at 6:30pm, had her drink order taken fairly quickly, and was just getting her drink when I arrived at 6:50pm.  My drink order gets taken fairly promptly, and I also order the happy hour nacho's.  

Being a bit of a picky eater I specifically order several of the toppings on the side, and then, to clarify, indicate that I want nothing on my nacho's except beans and cheese.  The waiter takes the order, and the order of my friends, and heads off.  My friend's orders come first, and one is wrong, so we point it out to the waiter.  He takes the wrong dish back to the kitchen and comes back a few moments later with her correct dish, and my nachos.  It has now been about 20-25 minutes since we ordered.  

My nacho's come with the requested beans and cheese, but also with salsa fresca and cilantro.  I immediately, but very nicely, indicate to the gentleman who brought the dish that my order is wrong, and I didn't want anything except the beans and cheese (ie, no salsa fresca and no cilantro).  He takes the dish back to the kitchen....only to have my waiter immediately bring back the same dish to me indicating that I should eat it because there is "nothing spicy in it".  

I need to repeat this - after I sent back my dish, he brought it back to me and tried to convince me to eat it.  

I tried to explain that I wasn't worried about the spice, but that I could not eat onions, which is true (the results are not pretty).  He pretty much talked over me until I repeated myself several times that I was not going to eat it, that he should take it away, and that I wasn't going to pay for it.  My friends and I then had a good laugh at how ridiculous this was.  That the server was arguing with me over my food.

Next someone who appeared to be the manager came out, again, with the same dish!  He indicated that the way I ordered the dish was not actually nacho's.  For those of you who may have never had them:

na·cho
näCHō/
noun
plural noun: nachos

    a small crisp piece of a tortilla, typically topped with melted cheese and spices.

Sure, nacho's can come with all sorts of toppings, but to try to tell me that ordering mine with only beans and cheese didn't make them nachos didn't make any kind of logical sense.  He then explained that they could make them the way I ordered them, but it would take a very, very long time.  Because they were busy.  Soooo, making them with fewer ingredients would take longer.  I again indicated that this did not make sense.  He then offered to bring me chips, a side of melted cheese, and a side of beans, which, he pointed out, was essentially what I ordered.  So, again, using logic, they can bring me all three ingredients separately, but not put them together?  And the chef is the one doing all this incredibly hard work?  Not some line cook?  I, of course, refused and indicated that, at this point things were beyond ridiculous, and that I wouldn't be ordering anything or giving them any more of my money.  I mean, I just wanted some nacho's without any onions on them.  Unless I missed the michelin star on my way in I feel pretty darn comfortable saying that this is not a haute cuisine restaurant.  It's a crappy Mexi-Cali  restaurant with a great location that does booming happy hour business and not a whole lot else.  

The manager also mentioned that the chef takes pride in his work and presentation, so really what we have is some chef with a seriously over inflated sense of ego for what his job really is offended that I dared to ask (politely, I never raised my voice, I just remained firm) for something in a way that he didn't like.  My order wasn't up to his standards, I guess.

After my friends then sent back their food (they certainly weren't going to give them their money either, after that display) the waiter came out and was kinda sorta apologetic, but not really.  No one ever really apologized for not getting my order right and not being willing to fix it.  The waiter let slip that the chef told him he wasn't going to make the order the way I ordered it, but the waiter did not bother coming back to let me know, therefore giving me a choice.  He also told us stories about other times the chef refused to make an order the way a customer requested because he fundamentally disagreed with it.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Let the low Yelp reviews lead you elsewhere, this place is nothing special.

I truly wanted to love this place after all the good things I heard about their sister restaurant in NY. But, for the prices this place charges, they should have done way better. Despite the low Yelp review, I reluctantly went here for a friend's bday.

First off, the good:
The decor is really inviting and the location is pretty convenient as there are meters on the street nearby making parking somewhat easier. The atmosphere is lively and the booth seating is great for group dates! Thus, 2 stars.

And the meh:
- The home made guacamole was bland. I make my own guacamole and I'm no pro but it's way better than this. I don't get why they make it in front of you as it's not rocket science and there really wasn't much of a show either.
- The chips were just deep fried chips.
- The sauces were OK but there was no complimentary salsa :(
- I tried the tequila flight. There were no limes served with the tequilia. It certainly needed SOMETHING as it tasted bitter.
- The main dish: My fiance had the shredded duck whatever dish. It was OK however I am pretty sure I bit into a bone at one point. I had the mole, the entire dish was brown since it was served with refried beans. I kid you not, it was brown and then more brown.. my dish looked like a pile of mole if you know what I mean ;)

We were 4 people and barely drank and the tab was $170. Meh.

**Note, I wrote that this place was good for kids! I noticed a couple here with a crying infant and it was loud enough that I couldn't hear it! So bring your babies here by all means!
author: Kathy S.

description: What you want to be doing at this place: eating and drinking. Excellent food, superb margaritas. What you don't want to be doing at this place: paying. Having said that, it's a great choice on a corporate card or expense account, and you'll avoid experiencing "buyer's remorse" when you order the $18 guacamole.
author: Sarah A.

description: Ambiance was great, menu options were mediocre and very overpriced. The $15 guacamole and chips was not  prepared at your table (even though the menu states it's a table side service). The complimentary chips and salsa are good though.
author: Mary R.

description:
The food is hit and miss. Some dishes like guacamole, carnitas, salsas are very flavorful. I like that when they say spicy, they really mean it. The chili relleno was disappointing. They fill it with some rice mixture. I was expecting the traditional cheese filling. They also have really great non-alcoholic fresh juices like watermelon, mango, pineapple. 

The service is super, super slow no matter how small or big your party is. I've been there for lunch with a party of 2 as well as a party of 10. It takes like 30 minutes to an hour from the time you order to when your food is served. So, make sure you have lots of time if you want to eat there.
author: Tina C.

description:
This rating is for their happy hour.

I came here twice with coworkers within the same month.  I really liked the fish tacos, and we really loved the sangria.  I thought their guacamole was satisfactory... I prefer my guacamole with a lot of lime in it.  Otherwise, happy hour prices are decent and it's a good place to forget the day.
author: Vira P.

description:
This is a big freaking place. The bar a long is the size of many restaurants. A patio area,large main dining room. Lots of interesting design elements like the cliff diver wall.  We checked out the Fall harvest dinner event by Chef Jonathan Kaufman. We were gathered in the back room and sat communally with many other food enthusiasts. They started us off with a handful of appetizers and drinks. After chatting for a a while with other patrons, we sat down and had:

-Roasted pork flautas
-Razor clam scallop ceviche
-Oyster tartare
-Tableside guacamole
-Wild mushroom salad
-Grilled lobster and scallop tacos
-Lavender, black pepper, honey marinated duck, served two ways
-Churros with chocolate cajeta
-Pumpkin creme brulee
-Baby cupcake sukkah

Everything was very tasty and the communal company was quite entertaining. This was the typical experience of the restaurant but it should be. It's always fun to dine with others that are there who just love food. Guess Ill have to try it on a normal meal but so far the impression is good.
author: Kim N.

description: The churros and table-side guacamole are the big winners here, everything else was pretty okay but nothing special. The atmosphere is perfect for work lunches but not somewhere I'd go on my own :)
author: Jess L.

description:
Had lunch yesterday with a friend here. Wanted to see what the "hype" was all about. 

I order the enchiladas, which should be a staple of a Mexican restaurant. The sauce was weird, it didn't tasted like your typical, traditional enchilada sauce, so that was puzzling. I couldn't put my finger on the sauce, if it is some new wave enchilada sauce, I ain't buying it. The dish wasn't also very hot when it came out. The only saving grace was the rice and beans that came with it, loved the fact that they had brown rice (healthy!), not that cheesy, salty Mexican rice. The beans were refried black bean, which was also spot on. My friend got the Mexican pie, which he states alright, but definitely nothing to write home about...fyi to all. 

We also ordered the guacamole, which people have been raving about to me. I will say that it was darn good, but the chips that accompanied it could have been better. Seemed closer to store bought, or not that freshly made at the restaurant. They should step that up if I ever want to come back during HH for a hot minute and get that....lol. 

I also ordered a margarita. For $12, it was a joke. It was small and didn't taste any better than a $5 margarita in the Mission. Yeah, save your dolla bills and go get one in the Mission. 

In short, I wouldn't go back for a full lunch or dinner, not worth the price. If you want good a Mexican lunch or dinner, definitely save your dollars and feast up in the Mission. But I will end by saying, if I was in the FiDi for a meeting or something, I would definitely do the HH after, which goes until 7pm, and the food and drinks are way cheaper.
author: Sonia A.

description: All the 3 star reviews really upset me and do not provide an accurate depiction of Rosa Mexicano. This place is literally a flavor haven. Their extensive selection of tequila will dazzle. The salsa verde habanero is out of this world and is the thing dreams are made of.
author: Brittney H.

description:
10.31.14 (etc.) | bookmarked 11.27.12

My latest visit included two really strong and delicious margaritas at the bar (happy hour price, $6). Their nachos are also extremely delicious. Something about the texture of the freshly made chips does it for me.

I've been for lunches, dinners, and happy hour. Every occasion is a festive time. Glad to have this within walking distance from work.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Great place for after work Happy Hour (5-7pm).

Their guacamole is amazing! I could eat that all day.  In fact we almost did.  I think we went through 3 orders of that and I ate most of it. 

If you are in the financial or embarcadero district, highly recommend popping by for after work drinks if you get a chance to.
author: Maggie F.

description: Chile Relleno at this place rocked! A little pricey but so nice! Beans and rice are vegetarian friendly so a HUGE plus for me and any other fellow vegetarian Mexican cravers. Julio was the best server ever!!! I would come back just to have his company again. Highly recommend!
author: Jackie D.

description: Slow service, over priced tacos, super sweet drinks, and TVs that don't play sports. Well they play sports but leave it on the TV guide. There are other places around. Just don't.
author: Carlos S.

description:
Came here for last minute Happy Hour with a co-worker.  It was such a nice night in the city we were able to sit outside with out jackets.  Their HH goes until 7 and has a relatively decent priced HH menu.  ($6 small plates and $6-$7 HH drinks).  

Its new so everything is still shiny and clean, and will probably stay that way as it is drawing the higher end restaurant/bar/lounge crowd.  It feels quite spacious too. 

We ordered the Pork Belly Tacos (2 for $6) and the Quesa, with chorizo.  Both were really good, but we really got us were the drinks.  I had the HH 1800 Margarita, and it was strong and delicious.  My coworker got the white sangria, and it was honestly one of the best Sangria's I've had, probably the best thing on the HH menu. 

Since I work nearby, this will definitely be one of my new happy hour spots.
author: Veasna H.

description: i been here twice, I live at SoCal. Great food! great service! I wish there was a rosa Mexicano close to Laguna niguel.
author: Bella Y.

description:
This establishment gets a Wow! But for the dissapoinment that it was. I feel so strongly about it that I haven't posted a review on Yelp in more than a year but I had to warn possible new patrons. You are better of buying microwaveble meals at the grocery store which would prabobly run you about 15. 00 dollars for about 4 people. Our check was 100.00+ and it literally felt like the meals were taken out of a box and just microwaved. Half heated tortillas, dry carnitas, dence luke warm murky enchiladas, diluted pitcher of sangria and it only took them an eternity to prepare all this in what felt to me a microwave.
Have been to locations in LA and NY with an totally opposite experience. I would definitely go back to these other locations but not to the SF location.
I did express my dissapoinment to my server but there was no initiative to correct the situation. I was more blow off and brought check.
It had been  a long day so I just paid the check because I just wanted to go home and did not wanted to get into a big dissuasion about what I had just expirince with anyone else.

P.S 
If your guacamole is called "table side" I expected to be praparec by my table, if not you can just change the name.
author: Jonathan H.

description: Food was fresh and it was a delightful mix of flavors. The guacamole and the Tablon dish were to die for! I will definitely go back.
author: Beatriz F.

description: My experience at this location was just ok. The restaurant itself had great decor. We got sat at the bar area and waited about 10 minutes for someone to come over and help us and we ordered margaritas. The margaritas were about the worst I ever had. They did not taste like traditional Mexican margaritas so you might be disappointment if you like margaritas because they were basically awful. I only drank it because I had already paid about 12 dollars for it. And the margaritas came in small glasses like as I I had ordered a drink on the rocks. They should come in margarita glasses. I was hoping to get chips and salsa but never got any, not sure why because the table in front of us had chips and salsa which wasn't listed on the menu. So I was wondering why they had some and not my table. I ordered the beef tinga tacos which had different toppings from other tacos I have had. They had the beef, with cabbage and carrots in vinegar, and a green hot sauce, which I was not asked if I wanted on the side. It was kinda spicy for my taste. I received a side of corn with queso fresco and a chili powder which just overwhelmed the entire dish. Everything was just to spicy altogether to consume. I was exited to order dessert and ordered the churros. What a huge mistake that was. They were Honestly the Worst Churros I have ever had. They were delivered to me burned beyond recognition. I had to crack them open to see if there was any dough inside and there wasn't. I literally had to use my strength to break them, that is how overly fried they were. They were completely horrible. I had to ask the server to take them away. She asked if I wanted to have another order made and I passed on that. I wanted nothing to do with their churros. Worst churros ever. The bill came and was a little over 100 dollars for 2 people. What a waste of money that was for us. The only good thing about this place is the decor and the music they play and our server was friendly. That is all.
author: Dono L.

description:
The first thing on the menu is the house specialty Guacamole.  Lots of menu real estate is devoted to touting this classic, and they boldly pronounce that it is "made tableside".  After enjoying this experience in at Rosa in NYC, was happy when they opened here.  

One problem:

ITS...NOT...MADE...TABLESIDE!!!!!

At least for me, I am now 0 for 3 and won't go back for a fourth try.

First time, just kinda mildly disappointed but let it slide.

Second time, had to say something.  Was told, "It's against the law in SF to prepare food outside".  Sketchy, but plausible.  I was enjoying a sunny day on that rarest of San Francisco treats, as restaurant patio.  OK, lesson learned.

Third time, was told, "We do that in the dining room, not the lounge"

Lounge?  First, it was 11:45 on a Saturday morning and I was literally the first customer of the day.  I was not given the option of dining room versus lounge.  It had about 30 tables, so I had no idea this was considered the "lounge" and different than the dinning room.  

Second, why have the same menu for the dining room, patio, and lounge when half of the restaurant - unbeknownst to the diners sitting in these sections no less - cannot receive what you go through great lengths to promote?!?  And that you over charge for?!?  

One more thing: the tortilla chips were inedible anyways, the tortillas were made with an over abundance of pepper fried into the chips.  I love spicy (the spicy guac was not spicy at all BTW) but the overwhelming pepper taste was just weird.

OK - two more things - Don't know the definition of "Baja" but have always had "Baja" fried fish battered.  The Baja tacos here are breaded then fried.  Reminds me of Gorton's fish sticks.  Blah

Probably really a two star review, but when you charge when they charge it creates a higher standard
author: craig F.

description: My team had multiple lunches and happy hour here and had about the same experience all the time. It is quite a large space so expect to be seated right away even with a large group of folks. Allow good ten minutes for a food and drinks to come up but don't worry there will be enough food no matter what you order. We always get their signature guacamole in an authentic stone bowl that feels in food waiting time pretty good. Last time we ordered each entry from the menu and I can tell that salmon salad and tacos were the best!
author: Ilmia N.

description: Lovely Mexican restaurant with delicious food and drinks. I had the enchiladas with the chihuahua cheese and a Rosalita margarita. The drink with dinner was very mild but we clambered up to the bar to wait for our ride and enjoyed a much stronger set of drinks there! Only downside was that they had a difficult time making some of the drinks virgin for those of our party not drinking. For dessert, we split the churros - chocolate sauce was great but the strawberry sauce tasted odd. Might just be our bias for chocolate though. Our waiter was fabulous the entire night and overall we all had a fantastic experience!
author: Priya S.

description: I gave it 2 stars because of the ambiance and the pleasant wait staff. However, I had the worst chicken mole enchiladas ever, they were so bland, the sauce the worse, and the tortillas were dry. The guacamole wasn't prepared in front of us but was tasty but certainly not worth $15! A house margarita for $12 and it came in an on the rocks glass, it should have been twice the size. I won't be back. :(
author: Doodle D.

description:
The lunch and dinner is over-priced mexican food, nothing short of what you can get at Chevy's. 

I think everyone else comes here for HH, which is actually very decent given its 4-7pm. $6 dollar not so watered down drinks and $5 food. However...you get SSS. 

= Service Seriously Sucks. If you sit at the bar, you might be ok. You sit anywhere else, expect the waiter/waitress to come by every 20 minutes (maybe), your drinks will sit and the counter and melt until you assert yourself and get it yourself. The pros is that the service is so chop shopish that we usually get 1 or 2 things free simply because you order from whoevever walks by (if they ever do) and so they get the bills mixed up all the time. 

Again, I come here for the cheap HH. but I expect  sloppy service everytime but am willing to still go for the chance of them under-charging me cause they can't get their stuff together.
author: Phantom Of Yel P.

description: Wow this place is fantastic! For starters their Guacamole & chips with 2 salsas is a massive portion and could have been enough for my meal alone! It should definitely be shared amongst several people. I had the 3 tacos & my husband had the chicken enchiladas. The corn that came with the tacos was outrageously delish! The side of beans & rice were generous portions. We really like this place & will no doubt be back soon! Service was excellent.
author: Alison A.

description:
We have gone here several times. Our first time was the best: lunch outdoors on a nice sunny Saturday afternoon. Each subsequent visit, regrettably, continued to decline in customer service. Our last visit was the final straw. We should have known better when we walked in and the place was pretty empty on a Saturday night. 

After taking our drink and appetizer order, our server basically disappeared. She delivered our drinks and food, but only returned once to ask how we were. Before we could respond that we were ready to order dinner, she abruptly turned and left. We decided to wait to see if she would return or if someone else would check in on us. Never happened, so after 45 minutes, we got our check (from someone else since our initial server never returned) and left.  

This wasn't the first time we've had sporadic service. Each time after our initial visit, it always seemed we had to guess who actually was our server, and were always bemused by the randomness. I think the reason why we kept at it so long was based on our fond memories of the dining experience we had in New York where we first encountered the original Rosa Mexicano. Needless to say, we were quite excited when we discovered they had a restaurant in the Bay Area. However, that excitement has now been tempered by reality that this branch has serious flaws.

In a nutshell, we won't be going back.  We think it's telling when a restaurant located in a prime spot is empty on a Saturday night. The two stars are for the pomegranate margaritas and tableside guacamole. The food, while adequate, is not worth the aggravation of their lack of competent service.
author: Ramona H.

description:
Rosa Mexicano is essentially a fancy Chevy's.

We heard rave reviews about the Guacamole, which is prepared tableside and served with "two salsas" and fresh tortillas and chips.  For $14, it was no better than the much cheaper tableside prepared fresh guac of Chevy's; and even though we requested medium spicy, there was no spicy kick.  Plus, the "two salsas" might be better described as two soy sauce sized dishes of not chunky salsa.  I'd say hot sauce, but they weren't spicy at all, despite the warning that the red one was "spicier" than the green one.

I was also disappointed in my Mojoito de Coquito, which I thought would have some pineapple taste, but oddly had some coconut flavor, when it wasn't listed as one of the ingredients on the menu.

My entree, however, was a different story.  The Dungeness crab enchiladas were AH-mazingly delicious.  The creamy tomatillo sauce really brought out the sweet succulence of the plentiful Dungeness crab chunks.

As amazing as the crab enchiladas were, I'm on the fence as to whether it was worth the $45ish I paid, or if I should hike it over to Chevy's on 3rd & Mission . . . .
author: Christina L.

description:
After going to Explorium After Dark me and bf were STARVING.

We ordered the $32 per person dinner which included an appetizer - we chose vegetarian nachos which were super delicious (probably because of how hungry we were ) 
2 entrees (we took ours Togo due to time crunch and ate these next day reheated in oven) - pollo pubil was a little on the dry side but the veggies and rice/beans were very good
          -carnitas tacos - well executed carnitas and the roasted pineapple that came with it complimented the meat perfectly
Desert - 6 pc. Churros with 3 dipping sauces. - chocolate and raspberry(I think) were my fav
We also got a complimentary birthday desert that consisted of three scoops of ice cream - salted caramel, Mexican chocolate and vanilla with raspberry(I think) sauce on top and a candle lol
Service was okay but the music was annoying ambiance was modern romantic
author: Mindy D.

description:
I have been hesitant to write such a negative review, but I was somehow added to Rosa Mexicano's e-mailing list and it brought up a bad taste in my mouth of a stolen laptop...

I would lunch or happy hour  at Rosa often since I work down the street. They knew me very well there - the "MaitreD" Dexter always greeted me, and would annoyingly try to flirt with me every time... they knew me well. I have  very distinguishable hair.

I went to happy hour with my boss the day before NYE 2014. Mind you, this place is ridiculously dark inside at night. It was dead and we were the only ones at the bar.  I placed my backpack under the bar. Inside the backpack was a MAC laptop, a laptop case containing the laptop, the title to my car, and my birth certificate (DMV errands), and pair of leggings I was gifted.

After a few margs we left. Twenty minutes later I realized I left my backpack under the bar seat and called the restaurant to have someone look for it. A bartender put me on hold for a while, and said there was nothing. 
The second time I called that evening a gal went to look for the item, came back asking "What are you looking for again?" and after looking a second time, said "No we do not have that."

A week later Rosa contacted my parent's house in Tennessee saying they found my birth certificate and title to my car but nothing else. Weird because they were inside my laptop case to keep them from bending...

So... either a thief stole my backpack and kindly came back to the scene of the crime to return part of the contents to a hostess- OR it was a Rosa employee...

When I asked to see the videos the manager, Nathan, would not let me. He told me he checked over them and he couldn't see anything because it was too dark... 

What's the point of cameras if you can barely see the taco you're eating?
author: Nika C.

description: Good food/drinks, terrible service. Went for drinks on a Friday evening. Server was very slow to initially take our order. We then very specifically asked for no cilantro in our guacamole as one of us has an allergy. Both orders came with cilantro and when we pointed it out to the server he argued with us that we didn't say that. Furthermore, someone in the group left a bag there and promptly called to see if it was still there. The manager said they were too busy to check and he would have to call them back. Simply terrible service.
author: Beau D.

description: This is our new Happy Hour spot!!!  $6 mango margaritas and a variety of $5 appetizers!! Our hostess was excellent - Elisabeth!!! And the Manager, Hector, is very friendly and accommodating. Great service, great price, great food!!  Where else can you get a $6 mango margarita in the Financial District!!??? This is really an awesome place!!
author: Teri C.

description:
Meh. 

The most expensive carnitas tacos I've ever had. And, confusingly, they were served with al pastor pineapple and a tropical salsa. Their tortilla-making skills need work.

Guacamole and cocktails were good.

Service: +1 for steering me away from a cocktail that apparently doesn't taste good (in the process of being removed from the menu, I'm told). -1 for rushing me to pay the bill.

I'm all for high-end Mexican, but I expect it to be regionally accurate and very well executed.
author: Esther C.

description:
Had the guac and steak enchiladas.

Great location, friendly staff. No complaints about the service.

Food was mediocre.

The guacamole. We asked to have it spicy. Definitely was not. We were adding in some of the actually spicy salsa that came with the chips to make it spicy, but it's just not the same without those jalapenos! But good chunks of avocado and otherwise good mix of chopped veggies.

Enchilada. Not what I expected. It came out on a circular skillet plate with about 3 or 4 flour tortillas stacked on top, meats in the middle, sauce all over the top. Didn't care for the sauce. The meat and tortillas were tender, flavorful, and good, but I've had better.

Overall, there wasn't much that set this place apart from the other Mexican foods I have. Doesn't help that I've been spoiled with homemade and authentic Mexican food straight from a family friend!
author: Mina Y.

description:
If you like slow, inattentive service this is just the place for you! Then again, if 80% of your dining room tables are empty you let staff off and hope the "B" team can cover (note to GM: it can't)

From the moment of "can I get you a drink & what would you like to eat" I felt rushed, particularly when I did order a second Margarita ... the immediate response was to try and sweep the unfinished first one off the table. Servers have had the back of their hands stabbed by forks for lesser sins.

But we muddle through and along comes my order of tacos (I've been bitten twice by the tres enchiladas, first at RM NY and in SF, too ... but if you like 'em swimming in a sea of microwaved sauce, here's your joint.) If you don't, order the tacos and hope the tortillas arrive in the same work shift as your entree.

OK, enough. 3 at bats, RM SF, .000, grab some pine, carne.
author: Bill M.

description: This place can be pricey but it's so worth it. The food is some of the best Mexican food I've had in this city. The salsa........I have to steal their receipe. The service is on point and they have pretty cool decor. Want to impress a date, bring them here. I ordered the enchilada sampler (3 varieties). It was super yummy. The flavors just explode in your mouth. I kinda wanted to steal the plates. They were very cool looking but my friend's purse wasn't big enough. Lol. Totally kidding. Me don't steal. Anyway, if you're looking for a classy romantic Mexican joint with some damn good food check Rosa out. She won't disappoint you like Chipotle disappointed my stomach. Just saying.
author: Jermaine J.

description:
My review has a major caveat - I didn't pay for anything, nor look at the menu.  

Was here for a work related dinner, and I enjoyed my dinner there.  Had 2 solid margaritas, chips and tableside guac which was good, a spicy ceviche, beef empanadas and then some chicken, carne asada and some sort of white fish with tortillas.  Everything was solid, the service was attentive and friendly.
author: Arthur Y.

description: Pretty damn awful. I'm a huge fan of the NYC outlet, but this place was terrible. The enchilada suizas were made with gristley thigh meat and doused in a green cream sauce- not like any other enchilada suizas I've had before and just not good. I was part of a table of 8 and the consensus was unanimous- no one finished their meal. It was akin to bad plane food. Such a disservice to the brand. I give it one star because the guacamole was good (hard to screw up) and the bar keep was honest about the agua fresca- stating "they make it in the morning and it sits out all day. I won't touch it." Sad.
author: Bunny H.

description: Ate here back in January during the Dine About Town promo. I believe they call that promo a new name now. Anyway, I went with a few of my friends in a Friday night. They were busy especially the bar area but we had reservations for a table. Hostess was very nice and sat us immediately. The decor and ambiance was beautiful. We first ordered a pitcher of the white sangria. It was delicious and kind of a "creeper". It was a perfect blend of fruit and alcohol. The appetizers and entree was delicious! Perfect portions too. If I lived closer to the city or even if I worked nearby, I'd definitely be back.
author: Jade M.

description: I really enjoyed the colourful, kind of artsy and clean interior design and atmosphere. Food and drinks are quite pricey but really tasty - I loved the Ceviche de Camarones - so fresh and tasty. The presentation of the food and drinks is great too. The staff was really kind and polite.
author: Anne K.

description:
Overpriced Mexican cuisine. The portions were small, the food was ordinary, and the service was indifferent. I guess what you're paying for is a posh environment. Because we all know that a cascading waterfall really makes your food taste so much better, lol. 

Anyway, if you have taste buds and you don't like feeling robbed when eating a meal, stay away from this place.
author: J Y.

description:
Nice décor, horrible food.   Tried the shrimp plate, five medium shrimp over a cup of Mexican rice, $27   Are you kidding?  
Tiny portions on the other things ordered.   Save the money, go elsewhere.
author: Joe L.

description: Not your typical Mexican Food. Quac dip very good . However, food not authentic. Beef Enchiladas with rancheras sauce tasted like tomato soup ..
author: Denice V.

description: Made a reservation, was seated by he host and waited for 15 minutes. In that time we weren't served water nor greeted by any staff, and it wasn't even busy. Informed the host and all he could say was, "sorry". I'm sorry but we're never going back.
author: Tai K.

description: A fun spot for groups.  We ordered the guacamole which was prepared table-side and pretty good.  We also got the tres enchiladas and the carne asada/chicken skillet.  Overall the food is good, but not special.  Not your average divey Mexican taqueria, so you're paying for ambience and service.
author: Vivian W.

description:
Can you spell S...............L..................O..............W? 

Went here last night because it was a gorgeous warm evening out. Sat outside at a table. Let's just start the process here....so we ordered drinks.....that took abt 30 minutes to get.....then ordered guacamole after the drinks which came before the drinks. No napkins.....had to ask for those......then saw no one forever so ended up going inside and ordering drinks at the bar. What is going on here??? Can someone read these reviews and see you have some serious issues and no one is going to go anymore. I live in the neighborhood and this was my second time and probably my last time going. Super over priced for mexican food....and then you have to wait so long for everything- it's not worth it.
author: Ricquel N.

description: Tasty but pricey.  Decent find in the business district.  I really liked the vibe.
author: Chicora M.

description:
Alright so I had a GILT deal to check out Rosa Mexicano for their Brunch Menu. The deal included a tasting of a margarita, a pitcher of sangria, two entrees, two hot chocolates, as well as a churro. This was a great deal so I knew I had to check it out. Now I have been to this spot a few times for happy hours so I was curious to try their food to see how it was. So I make my way over there on a Saturday. We enter at around noon and it is still pretty empty so we are seated promptly. The servers were very prompt and attentive which I appreciated as I had read many yelp reviews knocking them on this point. 

Now I am going to keep this review brief. Overall the food was just okay. Nothing really wowed me which was hugely disappointing. The Guacamole and alcohol was pretty delicious though. Additionally the Churro was oh em gee really good. And I am not a dessert person so trust me when I say a dessert item is solid. It comes out in this bag where they shake it up to make sure the sugar is on the churro. They give you three dipping sauces and the caramel was my favorite by far. My real simple conclusion is that this place is really meant as a happy hour joint. Yes it can be crowded but the guacamole and the drinks were awesome and churros would be a nice ending to a happy hour night. Just wish the food was better but I still walked away that morning with the Churro making me happy although it could have been the adult beverages... shrug
author: Dan M.

description: I have been here for lunch several times, as I work nearby and I know I can get a tasty gluten-free meal here. I really appreciate that they took the extra step of drawing up a gluten-free menu, because there is nothing like finding out you can only eat one or two dishes from a menu of fifty items. With or without reservations, we have been seated promptly and always received good service. The one time I dined here with a group of about 12 people, there was a bit of a delay with the food -- one person's meal arrived a good 10 minutes after the second-to-last dish to arrive. I know the restaurant from their New York location near Lincoln Center, so my expectations were realistic -- tasty food at slightly expensive prices. I used to get the pollo pibil, which I had always found to be generous, but apparently the portions have changed.
author: Patricia D.

description: Guacamole was superb. Service was decent. Great experience and value for money, as unintentionally we were there during happy hours which kicks in from 4-7 pm. If one is around pier 39 and is craving for Mexican food, Rosa Mexicano is worth a try.
author: Vikram P.

description: Great food and great drinks. I was overcharged on multiple drinks and called to them and asked how much the drinks were and I was quoted $7. Then when I told the manager I was overcharged he then said the drinks were $11. I was still overcharged as they charged me $12 a drinks. I then asked how much the happy hour drinks were and he said $7 and we were charged $8. Also the service is super slow and they are not friendly at all. It is a good thing they have good drinks and food.
author: Caitlin M.

description:
We dined here last night during their soft opening and even though they were still in the process of training their staff and working the kinks out in their kitchen I felt it was one of the better dining experiences and food I've had in a while. 

They have an expansive drink menu with all the top shelf tequilas and mezcals you can think of and the drinks were all made with care. Their famous blended pomegranate margarita was tasty.

We were presented with a fixed menu last night and enjoyed most every dish.  To start, we had their famous guacamole that was prepped right in front of us at the table.  The avocados were fresh and delicious, as well as the only other few ingredients they added to make one of the best guacamole I've had in a while.  It was served with some freshly made tortillas and chips and their two house made salsas.  The Pasilla de Oaxaca salsa was a smoky salsa on crack...I could not stop eating it.

For starters, we had the ceviche sampler and the duck confit tacos.  I especially enjoyed the duck confit tacos.  The duck was not dry, very moist and the taco was not overdressed.  You could taste each of the ingredients and their freshness.

For our mains, we each picked a different dish and shared it all so we could taste everything.  We had the Enchiladas Suizas, a Crispy Pork Shank, the Sea Bass and the Beef Short Ribs (not on the fixed menu but they let us order this anyway). I particularly enjoyed the Enchiladas Suiza. I am a suiza fanatic and have eaten many renditions of this in my life but this suiza had a perfect balance and creaminess.  The Crispy Pork Shank was also a winner.  I filled up a couple tortillas with the pork shank, squeezed on some lime and layered in some of the Pasilla de Oaxaca salsa and I was in heaven.  The main portions was enormous and as if I wasn't full already they then brought us out dessert.

For dessert we had the tres leche cake and the churros. The churros came in a fun little paper bag that they shook up at our table and served hot. They were accompanied three dipping sauces and the chocolate sauce was my favorite.  Tasty, just like a hot chocolate!  They had some issues under cooking our churros but when we let them know, they immediately showed their staff the issue and had a new batch made for us. Even though the churros were slightly undercooked on the interior, the exterior was crispy and perfectly coated with cinnamon and sugar.

Overall a good dining experience even with it being their soft opening. I have no doubt that they will continue to improve. Check it out for yourself and see what you think!
author: Susan P.

description: Went in a big group. Food was cold and very average flavor. The only thing worth coming back here for is the guac
author: Andrew M.

description:
I have been to Rosa Mexicano on four different occasions in the hopes that my view of the restaurant would change. It hasn't.

While their quacamole is made fresh to order and is very tasty, I can't say much about the rest of their food. Lackluster overpriced meals with average service.
author: Dana W.

description:
High priced, average Mexican food. You can honestly get better Mexican food for a waaaaay cheaper price. Chicken Quesadilla for $14 is really pricey. 

I did love how they had fresh aguas frescas and prepped fresh guac right at your table. The lady literally cut open an avocado & mixed everything together as my friend and I were having a conversation! I had the cantaloupe aguas frescas which came in a cute, miniature pitcher. But I'd much prefer a huge cup of cantaloupe juice from Mi Pueblo... 

I think you pay more for the ambience of a high class Mexican restaurant. Personally, I'm more of a taqueria type of person. And for some reason, I was left craving one of my closest friend's mom's cooking. Faaar better than anything purchased in a restaurant.
author: Jo L.

description: Walking into the restaurant there's a great atmosphere and fantastic decor. The food is not good, the spices are conflicting. The waiter completely ignored my allergy so my dish was inedible. We waited 30 minutes for our check, with terrible service. Our appetizer of guacamole came out before the chips. Terrible experience -will never return. The only good thing was the TINY margarita.
author: Grace C.

description: Came for the women's march on Sat. and after driving around in bumper-to-bumper traffic for an hour, finally found a parking space. Rosa Mexicano happened to be the first restaurant we saw so stopped for a bite and it really made the long wait for parking worthwhile . The guacamole was terrific and the grilled portobello mushrooms tacos with black bean, roasted red and yellow peppers, grilled corn, cabbage was the perfect meal to share with my wife. Connie the server was fantastic with her service and helping answering questions about the parking. Would definitely come back and try other items on the menu!
author: Tom V.

description:
SLOWEST SERVICE IN THE WORLD. 

Had to ask for water - three times, had to ask for silverware, had to ask about every drink and course ordered - at least twice, had to ask for the bill, had to ask for the manager to complain later.

Just don't bother.
author: Bee D.

description:
Came here for lunch working in FiDi and I've gotta say it's a pretty nice ambience to have in this area. There's a nice patio and the inside is well-lit. It's a bit pricy, but what do you expect?

Food is great; the guacamole is handmade right before your eyes. I had medium and it was decently tasty with a nice, consistent texture. I went with the Ceviche de Camarones. It was a very tangy, tart lime flavor that really complemented the fresh shrimp. Service was decent; our waitress was cute, but they didn't bring out the chips at the same time as the guacamole (5 minute wait in between). The agua fresca was a bit lacking - this was disappointing to be honest - I had the melon flavor... and it didn't really have any taste? This was in a decently warm day around 70 degrees. Overall, I'd definitely be back, but not often since it's pricey.

Bonus: Ran into Joe Montana and his wife.
author: Davinci L.

description:
Rosa Mexicano is a hidden gem in SOMA area of SF. It's a cool vibe, great drinks, and solid food. I've always enjoyed eating there with friends. 

I highly suggest everyone to eat the guacamole dip and their fajita's
author: Shobeir S.

description:
I went here for the second time last Wednesday. The place has really nice ambiance and the service is decent. But the food lacks a little bit and for the price, you can find much better food somewhere else.

Both times I came here, I had the Chicken Tortilla Pie which is pretty good. But not $20 good. The first time I came here, I was hoping for an awesome Margarita since the price was awesome. I have had much better Margaritas at half the price.

I went with someone different each time. Both of the folks I went with had told me their food was good, but not worth the price.

Overall, ambiance is awesome, service is ok, food is overpriced. There are so many awesome restaurants in the area where you can do better for the money.

I say maybe try it once, but then move on.
author: Chris D.

description:
Was really excited to try this place, but had a choppy experience here.  

Made a 7:15 reservation and showed up ten minutes early for it, but wasn't seated until 7:45 because they were running behind.  The hostess was very gracious about it and warm, aside from being hungry, we weren't in any kind of rush - so it was a disappointing sign, but not the end of the world.

We got seated at a nice table in the end, and the overall decor and ambiance was great!  Everything from here on out was a very mixed bag.

Guacamole: OK
Fundido: Solid
Ceviche Sampler: The pescado one was great, the oyster and crab ones were pretty bland and seemed to have a lot of filler
Pistachio Fish, at the waiter's suggestion: Extremely bland
Cinnamon donuts: Outrageously good
Salted caramel ice cream: See above
