Because of the long and unexpected wait for the table, the hostess said they would take a discount off our final bill, which they did not do - not holding their word was a bit disappointing.

Overall, the restaurant had several ups and downs - there's promise here, so I might go give it another shot, but I did find the overall experience a bit disappointing and not quite worthy of the coin.
author: Kunal K.

description:
One word: expensive. The food would maybe have been worthwhile if it was priced at happy hour prices, but for dinner, no thanks I will not be coming back.

Ambiance is nice and the location is convenient if you're downtown. The service was slow and their guacamole was the most expensive I've seen in the city. Didn't realize avocados were such a hot commodity....
author: Victoria B.

description:
I don't get why this place only has 3*. The Happy Hour is hard to beat, especially when the drinks are relatively strong. Food is good as well (not the best but good). 

I sat in the bar and the service was excellent. This was from 6 to 7:30 pm, so not sure why people are complaining so much.
author: Rick K.

description: So first of all the smell was intoxicating, talk about yum, this is a very classy place and I definitely love sitting at the bar
author: June B.

description:
Place is good if your work or someone else is paying for it. WAY OVER PRICED. 

 I wouldn't come here on a normal basis to pay $14 for Guacamole. Talk about a rip-off. yes it's fresh but it's totally not worth the price. 

Would recommend making reservations if you're doing lunch. Though it might look empty if you get there by 11:45, it actually gets packed with people with reservations. 

I had the Panza Con Callos De Hacha / Pork Belly And Scallops. Three small tacos infused with one chunk of belly and scallops each. Decent, but I'd rather have tacos from a taco truck than this. I had to put the spicy orange-habanero salsa on the side because it was too overpowering for my taco. 

Service is decent. They probably need more wait staff (and should be able to afford it considering the prices they charge) but whatever. 

This is really just Mexican fusion. Go to the taco truck on Spear/Folsom for real Mexican food.
author: Phillip D.

description:
OK, well its in like every review. This place has good guac and the lady makes it at the table according to your preferred spice level. 

I liked my beef enchiladas. It came smothered in a bunch of rich, thick, very good dark mole sauce. That was so yummy mixed in with the beans I ordered. Someone  at my table ordered a cobb salad, and it looks like an interesting version of a cobb salad. I thought that was creative. 

Also, they have good aguas frescas. If you are not ordering alcohol, check out their juice. It's better for you anyway. 

Also, the service was good.  And the flamboyant  host has a lot of flair if you know what I mean ;)
author: Alanna R.

description:
Ok- I've been coming here for quite some time. Between the boozy lunches on Fridays, the early happy hours with coworkers and even the occasional date night- I have come to understand Rosas, the menu and staff. 

First things first, the only reason this place is 5 stars in my book is because of the maître d - Dexter. One night, I called ahead to make sure that for my (ahem, first and very blind date with a cute guy) reservation, I could be sat in the bar with a great view of the not so big tv to see the 49er game. I got a call back from the host an hour later saying it wasn't possible-- And that someone had been mistaken saying otherwise. I kindly explained my situation (girl to girl, 49er fan to 49er fan, CMON) and she said she would ask the boss before she left on her shift. 

WELL. Not knowing what i was in store for, and a little bummed and nervous, I am walking over when I get a text message from the maître d himself. Dexter explained there was a table reserved in the bar and to let someone know when i arrived. 

We had the best seat in the house, a nice appetizer waiting for us when we sat down, and great service the whole night. In fact, whenever I head in now I give him a heads up and he always takes care of us.  

Dexter makes this place feel welcoming and on point regardless of how slow the device can be (at times, in the bar or outside, pretty slow-- I usually have to ask for more chips or another rounds during peak hours). He makes sure we know we are appreciated and treats us like top notch guests-- all in all making us want more $12 shots of top shelf tequila, a $24 dollar of heaping freshly made guacamole and 3 more rounds for that matter. We stay longer, drink and eat more and come back because of Dexter.

The food is also pretty great- try the fish tacos or the mole. Awesome tequila selection although pricey and perfect guac. 

Thanks Dexter for your service and attention to detail, it doesn't go unnoticed and you pick up the slack during busy wait times with such timeless class!
author: Jamie C.

description: Best guacamole I have ever had.  I had the trio of enchiladas, they were really good!  Also liked the pomegranate iced tea.
author: amy j.

description: I went there for a podcast on Monday night, and as someone who grew up in Southern California as has lived in the Bay Area since June of 2001, I know Mexican Food. The guacamole was amazing, and I had the Tres Enchiladas and they were delicable. Finally, we went to dessert and I am huge fan of Ice Cream. I had the Mexican Chocolate Ice Cream and it was amazing. Very close to the Embaracdero BART and Muni Station. I will definitely be going there again.
author: Jeremy K.

description: Fun, trendy spot for happy hour! Food was good and drinks were great. Would recommend checking this place out if you're in the area.
author: Yukti G.

description:
I had a raincloud of bad service when I came here with a group of 12 people from the office:
- They require you to place a card as a deposit in order to sit on the bar if you're a group of 6 or more. What upscale restaurant is this?
- They don't automatically place chips and salsa on the table unless you order guac ($$$). Uh... excuse me? What mexican restaurant is this?
- Margaritas were super expensive and really underwhelming
- General rude service from waitress

For an upscale restaurant in the Financial District, this will not fly. No sir. 

As for the food, here are the highlights:
- Rolled Crispy Chicken Tacos: Nothing special at all. Does not deserve to be called crispy because it lacks that satisfying crunch. It was closer to soggy, actually.
- Guacamole: Nice chunk of fresh avocado. This is good and most definitely overpriced
- Enchiladas De Pollo: Soggy, small portions, but the flavor is there

I didn't feel like the restaurant was worth what it charged. Will not come here again.

Added one star because the manager visited our table personally and tried to improve our experience. He was genuine and professional, and that was very much appreciated. I hope they learn from these mistakes and make some serious changes ASAP.
author: Nick A.

description:
Good location, nice place but too expensive for Mexican food...I mean it's Mexican food...no reason to have $30+ entrees.
They have a good happy hour where you can get drinks and appetizers for a decent price, but other than it's just not worth it.
author: George M.

description: Excellent guac.  Excellent carnitas. Service was lacking.  Our waiter was not attentive and kept forgetting our various requests for water, peppers, and the check.  Five stars for the food.  Minus one for the poor and slow service.
author: Peter M.

description: While in San Francisco, my friends spotted a Rosa Mexicano and stated we need to go in and have lunch. I had never heard of this chain, but I was pleasantly surprised. The nachos and the two salsas were very good and the guacamole is as good as everyone is stating in their reviews below. The chicken tortilla soup is outstanding with bid chucks of white meat chicken and an exceptional broth. You get a lot of food for lunch; so much so that we had to take almost half of it back with us for later. The desserts were exceptional also, but I found the margaritas quite small for the high price. Overall, a great find and I will look for this chain in other cities I visit.
author: Greg L.

description: I get that it's Super Bowl week. The whole world knows it's Super Bowl week. Why, when you're two blocks from Super Bowl City stop taking restaurant reservations, forcing people into the lounge. That should have been the first clue. We ordered the deluxe guacamole, which was good! Then 45 minutes later the server brought our bill when he clocked out. We moved to a bigger table, the biggest in the lounge, then had to wait 30 minutes to order, 30 for the food, and 45 to flag down our server for another round. The manager conceded that he had dropped the ball and told us to go.
author: Christina M.

description:
Was here yesterday and enjoyed the attentive service we received.  We first ordered the chips, salsa and guacamole along with cheese and chicken quesadillas.it was good especially the salsa they provided for us. I had the chicken fajitas as the main entree and enjoyed it very much. 

Our table ordered several drinks and two were pitchers of sangria - white and red.  Red happens to be my favorited; however, the red sangria we had, I did not like.  So, I opt the sangria and ordered margarita on the rocks.  It was perfecto.  However, I ordered another margarita on the rocks and it was not the same - total bummer..

We ordered churros for dessert and liked the chocolate and caramel side - yum!!!  

I like the area this place is at.  Near my SF office for work, near the embarcadero and just around the corner from Market St.  

I will come back here again and hope my drinks are better the next time.
author: Lyn N.

description: Went there for lunch with co-workers today.  We started off with guacamole and chips and all of a sudden another bowl of guacamole appeared at our table.  We dipped in and then the server comes over and said that he had made a mistake and that this was not meant for our table.  We said we already dipped into it and he said okay, go ahead and that was a nice mistake that we didn't get charged for.  However, the majority of us got shrimp dishes, but none of the dishes actually had any shrimp in them, but chicken instead.  When I asked the waitress about this, she insisted that it was the shrimp dishes  that we had ordered.  I had quesadillas, but my co-workers had the house special shrimp dishes and if shrimp comes shredded, that's a new one for me.  Anyhow, the food was okay, but the service was slow.  Oh, and this is the only Mexican restaurant that I know that serves salsa in a serving dishes no bigger than a large tablespoon!  Serious cheapskates.
author: olga d.

description:
Had a good meal here at lunch sitting out on the sidewalk. 

Food is good, and the drinks, decor give this place an edge over your average hole-in-the-wall taco join. The service was also excellent.
author: John H.

description: We went for happy hour and had a good time.  We initially sat outside and had chips and guacamole and drinks.  Everything was great, but it got cold and we moved inside.  They had no problem with moving us in and where very kind and accommodating.  I had absolutely no idea how massive the inside is.  It's HUGE!  I also like the interior design - it feels fresh and modern.  I didn't get a chance to sample a lot of food, so this review is really for the drinks, service, ambiance, and general experience.  The staff were attentive and friendly and everything was great.  I can't wait to go back and try everything!
author: Shaun W.

description:
I don't know why this place averages only three starts on Yelp. The place is spacious, located in a good area, and I've never had a bad meal here. I will acknowledge that the service is a bit slow, and once you get your food, the servers hardly ever check in on you. 

But this is not a place to be wined and dined. If you're looking for a good lunch, happy hour, or dinner, then this place is worth checking out. 

The portions are a bit small for the price I think, but everything I've had here has always been so flavorful that I think it makes up for it.
author: Lan D.

description:
I wound up coming back here recently for another lunch, and the service situation was greatly improved. They were slammed, but did a much better job of staying on top of things. Perhaps I just caught them on a bad day the first time around. The food was once again excellent.
I'd also like to note that I received a follow-up to my review from their manager. That's always a nice and much appreciated gesture.
author: Pat M.

description:
I just realized that I had given poor Rosa such a bad review.  I've not been Yelping much and only seem to do so when an establishment has done me wrong.

I'm going to rectify that there.  Especially since I eat here so often!  Bad Yelp manners.

Rosa is quite good and very consistent.  I usually get the same things (guacamole spicy, chicken flautas with green sauce only, chicken enchiladas suizas, sometimes a salad) but their food is consistently good if not always great.  I love coming here.  So sorry, Rosa, for dissing you so badly.
author: Bridget M.

description:
In a nutshell: tasteless and overpriced Mexican food disguised as a fancy restaurant.

I came here with some coworkers for a lunch one day, and were seated immediately as the place was pretty empty. We ordered a large guacamole and some entrees.

- Large guacamole: $26 for bland guacamole. I'm not being malicious when I say Chipotle guacamole tastes better (I am a big fan of Chipotle's guacamole). But with a double digit price tag, I expect decent guac at least.
- I ordered the Pollo/Grilled Chicken Breast "Skillet Style": I ordered chicken, assuming it was impossible to mess up chicken. I was wrong.The chicken was extremely dry and difficult to eat. While I am relieved I didn't have to eat any more than I did, the entree was exceptionally small for the price point ($16). I usually leave Mexican restaurants stuffed (I don't eat very much either, I'm a small person), but this place left me barely content. 
- My coworker ordered the fish tacos, which they said was good. Another coworker also ordered salad, which she regretted.

While the food was not very good, the service was very attentive. I had requested no cheese on my chicken, which the kitchen messed up. I shrugged off the mistake and just picked off the cheese, but my waiter was careful enough (even without my bringing it up, very impressive!) to notice. As a result, he was extremely apologetic and even the manager came over to personally apologize and to offer my meal free of charge. I appreciated that very much, considering a lot of restaurants wouldn't even have noticed in the first place -- or even offer to comp my lunch.
author: Mina K.

description:
Much better than the slick non-personal look would have you believe. Went here for lunch w. two kids (5 & 7), had the table side guacamole - great, we all loved it!

The MahiMahi Tacos were some of the best Mexican food I have ever had, honestly. But the winner: The kids ate from the kids menu and it was fresh, proper and with vegetables! Not preprocessed, but made with care. That is not every day stuff in the world of kids menus - a good sign of quality. 

It is pricey, especially for Mexican. Paid over 100$ incl. tips for four persons.
author: Jens H.

description:
The difference between eating at Rosa Mexicana and eating a strip club is that the drinks at the strip club will be cheaper, and your food will come with a lap dance. 

Seriously, this place was the most disappointing restaurant I've eaten at in San Francisco. In a city full of absolutely excellent taquerias, you are doing yourself a disservice by eating at mexican restaurant that charges $18 for an 8oz margarita. Granted, the decor is very nice, and the four sips of margarita weren't terrible, but the ambiance and mediocre drinks are not worth enduring the terrible and terribly overpriced food. 

We started with the guacamole, which was $26 for the table. An unexperienced 18-year-old bus-boy makes it right in front of you, who produces a flavorless, unseasoned, and extremely chunky version of guacamole.

Next, I tried the appetizer mini yellowtail ceviche tacos, which sounded delicious, but were literally served up as 3 bites. Though I would have been thrilled to eat 3 delicious bites, the mini tacos were slathered in some sort of thick mayonnaise-like sauce, and tasted nothing like the greens, fresh yellowtail, or bacon that went into them.

Last, I had the chicken enchiladas, which were recommended by our server, and didn't eat more than a 1/4 of my plate. The enchiladas were stuffed with some very dry and bland slow-roasted chicken, the tortillas were hardly cooked, and there was no cheese visibly present. We literally might as well have ordered some "chicken wrapped in a tortilla". I don't exaggerate when I say that my college dining hall had better enchiladas. 

Please, just go to the mission for mexican food. You will be much happier, I promise.
author: Zameer A.

description: I was skeptical to try this place based on the yelp rating. But I am SO GLAD I did. My whole family came here on Fleet Week Saturday for lunch and each of our dishes was just phenomenal. We started with guacamole and chips. Our server was SO great and very patient with us (we have two young children.) I can't wait to come back here. I had the Mahi mani tacos (fried) and mom had the grilled ones. Both are so great. The only thing I can't recommend was the Chile Tecate beer drink that's kind of like a bloody mary. It was WAAAY too spicy for me (and I have a very high tolerance for spicy) but our server remade them for us and toned down the spice. So happy we came here, it was such a pleasant surprise!
author: Vanessa T.

description: The guac is to DIE for!  Oh and the aqua fresca... yum yum
author: Nicole M.

description: Went for HH yesterday so I can't really rate the food but the guacamole spicy level was superb. The raspberry mojito was good hit I ordered with no sugar and it was still sweet but refreshing. The margaritas were better since they were tart and perfectly blended. Tasty. The best thing was the quest fundido. Spicy ooey gooey cheese. Not good for the waistline but def tasty. Would like to come back for a full meal, either lunch or an early dinner.
author: Jen C.

description:
Ugh. Really poor service- i.e. :
- Not cleaning dishes and left overs from previous people on the bar until we had to ask minutes later. 
- No water served. 
- Had to hunt down the bartender for happy hour deal. 
- Pricing shows as $6 for a large pitcher of sangria and when the bill comes, it is $17.95 and they cant explain the confusion on the menu vs. bill and did not even offer to honor the price we saw on the happy hour menu.
- Food ok.
- Bad service.
i will not be back here again.
author: C A.

description:
Came here for a work party - an after busy season party. 

1) The food is not bad, but it was hard to get food at the party. They just didnt have enough food, but that's like normal. 

2) The margaritas were good. Strong and just how everyone likes it, especially after a stressed out couple of months, right?

3) They weren't so good at making the frozen margaritas, but that's okay. I didn't get to try it, but they seemed like they were good and everyone at work loved them.

Overall I had a great time there, but it might have been the company rather than the actual food or the drinks.
author: Nina Y.

description:
So, so disappointing. 

Boyfriend and I were visiting some people in San Fran and were expecting to go out to a decently nice meal, maybe spend a little more money than we normally do. 

This place is apparently fairly new to the neighborhood and none of us had been there before. I love Mexican food, so I figured we couldn't go wrong here. Man was I wrong. The one way to ruin Mexican food is to charge too much for it. Especially in California, even the dirt cheap Mexican food is delicious, so overcharging for completely mediocre is unacceptable to me. Period.

The interior and decor was nice enough. Water fixtures on the walls, dim lighting, etc. That was probably the only thing I really enjoyed about my experience here.

I opted for just water, but all of the drinks that everyone ordered were - big surprise here - overpriced. Having my water refilled was a challenge throughout the meal, which is never a good sign. 

The don't start you off with chips and salsa, which I thought was strange because it's a pretty standard, across-the-board complimentary starter at almost all Mexican restaurants. Instead, we ordered the guacamole, which is supposed to be their signature thing. It was made table-side, but the person making it had absolutely no interaction with us whatsoever. My boyfriend didn't even know he was behind him. Prices for the guacamole were absolutely ridiculous - $14 for a small serving (1-2 people) and $26 for a 3-4 people serving. RIDICULOUS. The guacamole was okay, but honestly, the stuff I make at home is better. Nothing can justify that price tag, especially in California where the produce used to make guacamole is plentiful. 

The chicken enchiladas were absolutely nothing special, and incredibly overpriced. 

Overall, the thing that bothered me most about this place was the price for the quality and quantity. If you're serving small portions at a high price...it needs to be justified. This was not in any way. That, combined with the poor service is a big miss for me. Just a huge disappointment overall.
author: Kaity J.

description: Strongest margaritas you will ever have with the best guacamole you'll ever have makes for a great happy hour. Guacamole is a little pricy otherwise I love going to this place.
author: Nathan N.

description:
Had lunch here yesterday and really enjoyed the food and ambiance. This place is more of an Americanized Mexican restaurant but not lacking on flavors. If you want taqueria or Authentic Mexican food you will be totally disappointed so don't go here. The establishment is modern and chic - full of vibrant colors. Very cool water fall wall! Yes the whole wall!

I requested pork enchiladas (they only have cheese) which isn't on the menu but they gladly made it. It was different but good enough. Meat is great quality and the sauce had a smokey flavor.

The guacamole is fresh and made literally in front of you! That was absolutely delicious! They also have freshly made non alcoholic fruit drinks which were soo good as well. I had the green one.
author: R H.

description:
Horrible service
Extremely overpriced
Horrible food
Took my card at the start of the meal. 
Manager was condescending when I confronted him. 
No tip. Myself and my dining partner will not be coming back or recommending to friends.
author: Robbie T.

description:
Just finished my meal, still sitting at the table. This place deserves more stars. They made fresh guacamole at our table, it was delicious! The quest fundido was out of this world.

I ordered the Matisa, which I ended up not being a big fan of. Our waitress, who was already phenomenal, took it off our bill. Totally unnecessary.

If you are in the Financial District and have a hankering for Mexican, head to Rosa Mexicano. And if you enjoy it, leave a review so they get the stars they deserve.
author: Joe F.

description:
I really wanted to like this place. It's SO convenient and the decor is nice. The staff is pretty friendly (hit or miss) but they have absolutely no idea what they're doing and the food is too expensive for the mediocre quality.

Coworkers and I have been there a few times. Gave them the benefit of the doubt since they were new and we hoped they'd get better but it just doesn't seem to be happening. There are SO MANY things wrong with this place, it's almost comical and hard to know where to begin. Here are a few:

No wifi for customers (in the FinDist, this is unacceptable)
Tables at the bar are too close together so that, when full, you can barely squeeze in
Tons of wait staff but very slow and terrible service:
 - Servers mess up our orders regularly
 - Servers forget items
 - Servers walk past without noticing you're trying to get their attention or that you have empty glasses, chip bowls, etc.
 - Servers an hour to get you your check then take another hour to bring back your card
 - No one clears your table when you're finished eating
 - Food is mediocre but pricey for what you get
 - You cannot order off the menu at all (they actually looked thoroughly confused when we asked for two different tacos; one meat and one fish. Can't be done.
 - In two hours, we had four different servers. No one seems to know which section they have and they swap out regularly

It's a bizarre place. I think it only gets business because of the location and the reputation in other cities (where it's actually a descent restaurant).

Still hoping they get it together but it doesn't look likely. They need a complete makeover.
author: Isabel R.

description:
Not bad, but not great either. Rosa Mexicano is a stone's throw from my office so it was a natural choice for a lunch date. Three of us ordered the short rib Lunch Crunch option while the 4th ordered the pork belly nachos. 

Our lunch crunch came with a cup of tortilla soup (bland, but came with chunks of chicken and avocado), an open face taco (good hot sauce, lots of meat), a mound of guacamole with chips (guac was the highlight of the meal), and the vanilla espresso flan (not a fan of the soggy cinnamon-y crust on the bottom). At $14, I thought this was fairly priced for the quantity of food but the quality was just ok. I sampled the pork belly nachos and it was okay. Not wonderful but not horrible either. Service was pleasant and outdoor seating hits the spot when the weather cooperates.

Would I return? Maybe.
author: Bella L.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE!

Not only do they have a great happy hour, but their sit-down service is awesome.  The servers are very attentive no matter how busy they are.  Always glad to help you with a smiling face.  Even though some of the servers I've spoken to speak English as a second language, they always do the best they can to help me.

Now about their food... their guacamole is DELICIOUS!  You can't go there and not have their guacamole, it's blasphemy!  It is made to order and the avocados are so fresh, there is nothing like it.  Their pork belly tacos are my favorite, and their sangria is so refreshing.
author: Chrissa U.

description: Love love love this place! Margaritas are delcous and Chips and guacamole I cannot get enough off
author: Shymala H.

description:
The food is bad, service is bad. I ordered enchiladas and it was literally 2 corn mission brand tortillas stuffed with under cooked chicken in a bowl covered in canned sauce. No rice, no beans and swimming in sauce. The tortillas were folded in half like a taco. no garnish, nothing. looked like tomato soup and was 15$.

I wanted to leave. if i wasn't at a work lunch i would have complained, sent it back and requested $$..........and i NEVERdo that. It was just that bad

negative 5 stars
author: Noelle A.

description:
Their website (& menu) looks amazing. Their restaurant looks great. Very new, very modern, very SF.

I got there, had to wait a little for my friend to arrive, so told the server that I would enjoy some water until my friend got there. Every 2 minutes he'd check on me to see if I could finally order some drinks/food. So I ended up ordering a margarita.

The place kept getting busier and busier and I kept seeing my server less and less.

My friend arrived. As soon as our server got to our table (which took some time), we immediately ordered guacamole & a margarita. 

The so called "table-prepped guacamole" came in a bowl, already prepped rather fast. (they might have decided to prep the guacamole in the back as it was crowded, but they should have mentioned that). Anyway. 
My friend's drink (or water glass) didn't arrive until I had already finished my margarita. We decided to just order another round as it looked like they were completely understaffed so we assumed that by the time we'd get those she would already be thirsty again. We also ordered our food. 

Our drinks came, a good 20 minutes later. 50 minutes later the table next to us got their food. That table came in when we ordered our food. We knew something was wrong. We were still starving. We asked our server about our food, he said "yea you ordered this and this right" we said "no, we ordered something else" and then he said "oops" without any emotions (our server did not care that he completely had forgotten to put in our order). He was already on his way to go to the back of the bar, before we could even tell him we didn't want our food anymore and just wanted to pay. 

We got the bill, the "table-prepped guacamole" was $14!!!!!!! Are you serious? For $14 you could have made guacamole to feed an entire army. Our server didn't apologize about our food, didn't comp anything, nothing. 
We payed, tipped (yep, we're still industry folks) and left and will never return. 

Understaffed to the point that servers/bartenders don't care about customer service as they too know that it already sucks with the wait for everything.
author: Helen D.

description:
Terrible food and even worse service.

The wait staff was rude and disorganized.
They tried to serve us different bottles of wine in the same glass!
After having spent $100/person on food and wine, regretted ever hearing about this place.

Will be telling everyone I know to avoid this place like the plague with STDs.

After they realized that they forgot the dessert portion of our Prix Fixe dinners, they didn't even try to reconcile the situation and insisted that we still pay for the dessert.

Course 1:  Lobster ceviche
Over marinated lobster that was tough and tasteless.

Course 2:  Carne Asada Rib Eye
Tasteless piece of nasty meat and definitely not worth the $38 price tag.  Maybe worth 38 pesos.

Course 3:  Creme brûlée 
The waiter forgot to bring it and we didn't have time to wait for them to fix it.
If the rest of the meal was any sign, it would probably have been worse than something from Safeway anyways.
author: Chris M.

description:
GOOD: Supposedly their guacamole is the best in the city.  They have an onhand chef there to mix it up for you.

There was a live band when I was there playing mexican music. 

Indoor long table, seating at the bar, and regular seating, as well as outdoor patio seating.

Prices are reasonable for happy hour.

BAD: Where is the service?  Supposedly they are suppose to come to you unless it is a fast food type place.  I didn't order anything.  

Closes early. 8p.m.
author: K G.

description:
I went to Rosa Mexicano today to try the Dine About Town menu. The restaurant is close to home for me, a short walk. I had a reservation through OpenTable, and was quickly seated.

I really like the interior of this restaurant. It has a fun color scheme, with lots of eye candy - artistic lighting fixtures, earthy colors, and the divers leaping off the waterfall is certainly creative (see pictures). Music is a mix of modern latin flavor & downtempo, I liked it a lot. Sadly I didn't hear Vamos A La Playa, not even once. (I'm joking.)

On the Dine About Town menu, they list the table-side guacamole. Unfortunately, you can't get that unless you're a party of two, using your mutual two first course options to get the guacamole. Or, you can pay $7 more to get it as a single eater. It normally costs $14, so I guess I can understand that, considering the whole DAT lunch is $18.95. The way they word this on the menu is not the best, and I can see how it would disappoint some people. Generally when I get guacamole prepared at a table, the waiter brings over avocados, salsa, lime, other fixins & the container to crush everything in in a small hand held tray or basket, makes it, takes the tray or basket & leaves. At Rosa Mexicano, they have a cart they wheel to your table, a little retro, but everything on the cart looks tasty. They prepare your guacamole with some of the biggest avocados I've ever seen (I watched as another table got theirs); I believe Bruce Willis shot down the errant asteroid in Armageddon with one of those. I'm sure it was delicious, I love fresh guac.

The chips came with two salsas, a red salsa that got a smoky flavor from some of the chiles used, and a green salsa that was milder. That said, have a glass of water or drink ready to go. The sauces are delicious, so you eat a lot of them, but the spicy heat will sneak up on you & all of a sudden you realize you need water.

My first course was flautas de pollo, which are rolled crispy chicken tacos (think taquitos), covered in red & green salsas, Mexican cheese & sour cream. These were delicious, with so many different flavors, spices, and heat & cooling levels (physical & spice level).

Second course was enchiladas rancheras, cheese enchiladas in a roasted tomato sauce. From my photo you would not think these were different than what you're used to, but they are. Once again, there are a variety of subtle flavors & spices that hit you. The cheese doesn't entirely melt, and both the cheese & corn tortilla give texture to the dish. This is served with a healthy bowl of refried black beans, which seemed very fresh, unlike some Mexican restaurants where refried beans can taste dried out & generally old. They also include a bowl of brown rice. Now normally, brown rice tastes flavorless & sad, like you're on a diet you hate. This rice was full of flavor, from the cilantro, mint, and chile it was prepared with. Once again, many subtle flavors playing on your palette.

Third course, I got their pastel de queso, a cheesecake. Their cheesecake is light compared to what you're probably used to, and had a razor-thin slice of baked apple which gave a nice flavor. The cheesecake & plate had a drizzle of something that had a flavor & consistency somewhere between applesauce & caramel, hard to describe, but wonderful, and walnuts.

They're currently running "The Art of Mexican Mixology," a special cocktail menu from Jun 5-30. I believe they do different events like this throughout the year. I tried their tequila sunrise, made with Herradura silver tequila, house-made pomegranate grenadine, and fresh orange juice. Two cherries on top of the glass... The staff assured me they were nothing special, but they tasted infused with an alcohol, or something... Not sure what. EVERYTHING at this restaurant tastes a little different, better than normal. They even had a recipe for it printed on a card attached to the bill, a nice touch.

Waitstaff was attentive & friendly, and either knew the answer to my questions about what chile or spice I was sensing, or was willing to go find out. Water was always topped off; one of the guys was joking with me, that since he started eating there he drinks a lot more water. I believe it!

I love Mexican food, and I really love fancy Mexican food when the chef plays with different chiles that all have different heat levels & spice flavors. This is a fantastic restaurant, and I'm lucky they're close to me. I throughly enjoyed every single thing I ate, and I will be back for more. It was literally difficult to wipe the smile from my face at the end of this feast, I felt so completely sated. Thank you for a wonderful meal.

- Adam
author: Adam M.

description: I came here on a Thursday night and it was pretty busy but my group of 6 were able to find a table in the back by the bar. The other reviews about Rosa Mexicano were pretty spot on. I would have much rather paid less for the food so going during their happy hour seems like a better deal. We ordered 2 of their table side guacamole which most of us thought was bland with a little spice. I saw they had ceviche and I was pretty excited to try it but when I finally did I was really disappointed. Ceviche is one of my favorite Mexican dishes and they fell short with this dish due once again to the lack of flavor. My table had to pour the green salsa they offer with their chips to even finish it. Not everything was bland. There were dishes we found great like the fondido, so good! Also they make great margaritas, pretty strong. I would come back but it would definitely need to be for their happy hour.
author: Angelina R.

description: So old. So cold. So lame. Who made those tortillas? Obviously frozen twenty years ago. Gross food!
author: Aditya S.

description: This place is amazing with excellent happy hour! All of their enchilada plates are great! Their service is even more exceptional! Their guac paired with their margaritas is a perfect duo! Definitely going back!
author: Ashley N.

description: After reading reviews saying this was "the best guacamole in San Francisco" I had to go try it for myself. My first impression was positive it had a good environment with friendly staff, unfortunately things didn't go so well.. first of all this place is EXPENSIVE holy crap, a three Taco plate was anywhere from $15-20, and mainly they're guac, is $15. I'm willing however to pay $15 for the best guacamole, and this place doesn't have it. One of the people I was with argued that chipotles guacamole was even better than theirs.. I wouldn't go this far but what I will say is that the guacamole is good, but not special. It's fresh and has good spice, they make it in front of you, it's good. Not great at all.. could use some lime or something special. Also I got tacos, the meat was cooked well but besides that nothing special. The rice was actually bad and the beans were average.. overall this is an average Mexican food restaurant that has an outrageous price tag.
author: Logan L.

description:
Went here for a happy hour, its a cool location and the bar is fairly large but it does get crowded quick. 

Their queso fundido is good - but when is fried cheese not good? Their pork belly and scallops were also really good (available on a Weds.)

I didn't care at all for their shrimp tacos, they tasted super fishy and almost hit my gag reflexes. Also their happy hour is good if you like margaritas or cheap beer, but I don't so the prices are a little steep.

That's not to say I'll never go back.
author: Analisa S.

description: I was a pretty big fan of the made at your table guacamole cart, but the rest of the meal was extremely forgettable.
author: Michael E.

description:
This review is for the happy hour and bar.

Good drinks for reasonable prices, can't complain! the bartender helped me pick a margarita to my liking and it was delish!

Will def come back for happy hour and try other drinks
author: Alnadi P.

description: The guacamole made table side was great. We also ordered drinks la suprema and the chile mango. They were very generous with alcohol poured in. Food was ok and right on point. We loved the ambience and the water wall in the dining room had us change our seats from the lounge. Overall it's a good time for Mexican food but even better for the stronger cocktails.
author: Anthony P.

description:
This place is okay. The Guac is super good but don't let the bowl deceive you. It looks like a bottomless pit but its really only like an inch and a half deep. 

Since its fairly new ( a few months old), the service still needs some help. We had to ask for things a few more times. I asked for no peppers in my did and it came with peppers. I fished them out instead of going the the whole process of asking over and over again and the possibility of getting disappointed again. 

I heard they have a good HH. Maybe it will get better. 

On the upside, I ordered the pork belly nachos and it was actually a good size dish as an appetizer. I looked around the table and people ordered entrees and got half as much as I did.
author: Genevieve J.

description:
I can't believe this ONE place destroyed my good memories of the one I went to in DC. The service is terribly slow and the food was horrendous.
The one in DC was awesome. Our guacamole guy was informative, nice, and let us customize our order. This guy took forever to come to our table and then just added some things into the bowl and put it on our table.

I ordered the chicken and although parts of the chicken was moist and juicy, the rest was dry and gross.UGH, I so wanted to like this place and make it my weekly spot.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
5 stars for the food, minus three for the service.

Opening night coincided with game 1 of the World Series.  We didn't know it was opening night.  We showed up at 4:45 hoping to watch the game, especially as we saw the game was on and people were watching.  We weren't allowed in until they officially opened at 5:30.  Not even to just watch the game until they opened.  No problem, we just took our business elsewhere.

One friend went by Rosa at 5:15 and was told they weren't open.  He didn't know we went to another bar.  He found us, and we decided to go back before 5:30 and watch it there.

At 5:28, we got back and the bar was already packed.

Get your act together.
author: Steve W.

description:
Their guacamole is hands down the best I've ever had, which is what they are known for so good to know they did not did not over-promise and under-deliver.

Other than the guacamole, everything else is what you would expect from the average upscale place. You pay a lot but you will not be embarrassed by the service nor leave without a satisfied stomach.

The place is only a month old and the novelty has not quite worn off so during lunch and dinner times, expect the restaurant to be full. There is a bar area and a seating area near the bar that is just open to whoever jumps the quickest but don't expect too many openings, at least in the short term.
author: Jason C.

description:
Place is nice. Come early because it gets packed quick. 

The guac is awesome! It comes in this big giant stone bowl. It's $18
Everything else off the hh menu was only ok. Wasn't impressed so I don't need to name what I ordered.
author: Karen H.

description:
Full disclosure: My boss was offered a complimentary lunch for his team here as part of a "test run" lunch ahead of the "official" opening -- so I ate for free. 

First of all, the decor, atmosphere, and service were all top-notch, which I appreciated because despite having amazing Mexican food in SF, we have a dearth of "nicer," sit-down Mexican places. The presentation of all the dishes was also lovely -- in particular, I liked the tableside guacamole preparation (and the guac was fabulous!). 

I had both flavors of agua fresca to drink (pineapple and cantaloupe, although they change regularly), and it may have been the best agua fresca I've ever had. The appetizers on the test-run menu all had meat in them, so I had to go without, while my dining companions enjoyed some ceviche and chicken flautas. 

For my entree, I had the roasted vegetable enchiladas with suiza sauce. The flavor was complex, tangy, with just the right amount of spiciness. The vegetables were well-prepared and not mushy (my biggest complaint about roast veggies). They also complemented the sauce well. I chose the only vegetarian entree on the menu (even the alternate enchilada sauce choice, mole, was made with chicken stock). The manager asked for our feedback and he seemed to take seriously my point that they needed a lot more veg choices if they want to be successful in SF -- he said he'd heard that from several people. So I look forward to coming back and trying some different options!

One final note is that the dining room is huge, and could definitely accomodate larger groups, which is always a plus in SF!
author: Gaelen X.

description:
3.75 stars...Yummy guacamole with a price that will make you say holy moly! ($14). 

Guac was indeed fresh with chunks of avocado and perfect consistency (chunky). It came in a cute pig bowl & 2 other salsas... the green one was delish and different from the ones you get at your hole in the wall taco/burrito joint. But despite it being amazing, it was still too expensive!

Fish tacos: 3.5 stars- small but good. I suggest asking for the tartar sauce on the side so you can control how much goes in. Dish includes 3 small tacos & sauces for you to add- beans, corn, and some pickled onions.

Ambiance was very nice, modern and probably the nicest Mexican restaurant I've been to. Service was friendly and on point (but we also came at 2:30p on a weekday). I was however a bit put off by some dead flies I noticed next to me on the windowsill as I was looking for a place to put my purse (Wipe that down daily please!). 

Overall, if you want some nicely presented Mexican food with chic decor that will cost you some $$, I'd recommend coming here. If you're looking for just good Mexican food and don't care about presentation/ambiance, then I suggest going somewhere else.
author: Emily C.

description: I threw a baby shower here for a friend.  Brie set it up, made it so easy for me!  When the date came, the cake and cookies had been delivered there.  It was all set up when I got there - didn't even have to ask!  The food was excellent, the service was fantastic and I came in under budget.  I can't wait to have another party there!  So great!!!
author: sue r.

description:
I always want Rosa Mexicano to be delicious... but it never really is.

The service was excellent though at this location during prime lunch time. So I give you 2 stars and this tip: Less salt, there are other ways to flavor things.
author: Lauren B.

description:
Went to Rosa Mexicano for the first time since they opened their San Francisco location three weeks ago. Had a group of seven, which they were quick to accomodate. The decor is hip and very warm feeling. It's very different from what you typically expect from a large Mexican restaurant. 

Overall, the service was very good, and we were well taken care of throughout the meal, which did include appetizers, entrees, and desserts. They make the guacamole at your table, and it was absolutely amazing...there's nothing better than fresh guacamole. We also had the chorizo-blue cheese stuffed figs. They were good, but they were served cold. My preference would be to have them served warm. I had the skillet chicken served with peppers, onions, and cheese. It was very good, and the corn it's served with is AMAZING! Many of our guests had the short ribs, and they all commented about how wonderful they were. Finally, the desserts. Every one of them was beautifully prepared and absolutely delicious. You MUST get the churros...so good! I know I'll be going back often, as this is one of my boyfriend's favorite restaurants in NYC, but I'm happy to go back and keep trying new things.
author: Amanda R.

description:
Came here for DAT with two friends - verdict:  Not a horrible experience but for the price, you're better off going to the numerous other restaurants in the area for a better overall experience.  

Of all the DAT options there, I agree with fellow yelper Julie F. that the best two items there were the table-side made Guacamole and the cheesecake.  The rest of the dishes were also trying to be fancy but didn't have the taste profile or textures that warrant the pricing.  Unfortunately, I've had better "fancy mexican" food in the low teens.  

I can't really recommend people to come here for more than drinks and the guac.  The service was somewhat spotty, although not horrible.  Competition is stiff in the culinary industry here in SF.  If Rosa Mexicano is not in business within the next 6 months, I wouldn't be surprised.
author: Leo C.

description:
As many have said, the guacamole is fantastic. 

Beef enchiladas were ok. Mole sauce was cool when my plate arrived. Tortilla was tough and thick. 

They sat me immediately but it was 15 minutes before I saw my waiter. However, once he showed up he was friendly and attentive.
author: David W.

description: I'm from LA so I know good Mexican food.  This place is not that great for the price you pay.  I know the table side guacamole is a novelty, but I've had better at Chipotle.  I ordered the enchiladas and they were on the bland side.  We had a reservation and they made us wait almost 15 minutes to get seated.  They were waiting for another party to clear out and they kept apologizing for the long wait.  The food here is super pricey too even though I know this is suppose to be a more upscale restaurant.  The food pales in comparison to places like the Pink Taco or La Sirena Grill in LA.  The service was also very slow, which didn't help with our hungry kiddos.
author: Angie W.

description:
On a beautiful Friday after work, my buddies and I dropped by for HH and sat outside.

- Drink service took forever even though it wasn't too crowded (minus 1 star)

- The guacamole was delicious, BUT it would have been great if they refilled our chips the first time instead of the 4th time...literally 20 minutes later (minus 1 star)
author: Alfonzo J.

description:
We had a rather poor experience here. I gave an extra star, since the management really did try to reach out to us and offer to personally comp us on a different occasion. However, I doubt we'll be back. 

We walked in around 9 pm and opted to try the bar area. Although it wasn't very busy, the place was a mess. Dishes and glasses on every table. I didn't see one bus boy anywhere cleaning anything. Unless they called in sick that night, there's really no excuse for this at a high-end restaurant. We sat down on a table littered with glasses and had to ask to have it cleared. They came and cleared it, and wiped it off in front of us. Got a couple drinks, and chips & salsa. They were acceptable, but nothing special. Tried to order an entree, the server came back to say they were out of that. Ok, no problem. Tried to order something else. Out of that too. Not happy. 

It's worth mentioning that the place is pretty expensive. At this point, our experience was sour, and I didn't want to waste another dime here. We pulled the eject handle. For this price, my expectations are high (as they should be). Thankfully, the GM came to appologize, and comped us the drinks. He was very appologetic, and said they were overwhelmed by an earlier rush. Fair enough.
author: Brian C.

description: Spectacular, the guac is a must. Guac is made table side, fresh and made to order. The entire meal was fantastic. sangria was a two picture must. The atmosphere is beautiful, wish we could take it home with us, staff was very attentive and my wife hugged the waiter.
author: Steve L.

description: My new favorite place for happy hour.  Their red sangria is awesome, makes you much happier than their white Sangria.  I love the $7 pitcher size order. The happy hour food menu is awesome too. The layered duck tortilla and the gigantic bowl of guacamole and chips are highly recommended.
author: Shell J.

description:
Where to make last minute reservations for NYE dinner before heading to the Embarcadero for the fireworks show? Used my trusty Opentable app and found this restaurant with an inviting price fix menu that was reasonably priced. Being our first time at this restaurant we each opted for different items so we could sample different things:

Guacamole - love that it was made right at your table & the two salsas were delish. But the menu said we would get tortillas & chips - we only got chips which were sadly on the stale side. This may have been because they left the chips out for too long under the cart they were using to make the guacamole table side. 

Appetizers:

Hamachi Tacos - 3 small tacos (seriously could eat in two bites) but were filled with hamachi. I am curious to know how many tacos you get if you ordered from the regular menu though.

Queso Fundido w/ mushrooms, jalapenos, truffle oil - this is usually one of my faves and I liked it but definitely could have been spicier but if you like mild spice this will be perfect.

Lobster ceviche - good amount of lobster but why is this served with saltine crackers? That was a surprise and a serious disappointment. Lobster & saltines should not be served together!

Chile rellano w/ vegetables - the mole sauce and vegetables were good.

Red snapper pan seared - didn't try this but was told the fish tasted great
 
Shrimp & scallops over brown rice & pico de gallo - good amount of seafood & the rice tasted great!

Dessert:

Pumpkin crème brulee - this was fantastic

Churros with three dipping sauces - of the three dipping sauces the chocolate one was the best & the freshly made churros were YUMM!! But it looked like it was only one churro that they sliced up into four small pieces.

Banana chocolate chip cake w/ ice cream - I love chocolate but after a few bites definitely had chocolate overload in my system...but would order again for sure :)

The drinks we ordered were great - could definitely taste that tequila! But it definitely took a long time to get our drinks.

Service was fine, I liked that we weren't rushed thru our meal even though the place was very busy. I think they were short on staff since our server did seem all over the place trying to get to different tables.

They did make a mistake with our bill in the end and gave us another table's bill (which actually was a lot lower than ours!!). But going into a new year didn't want to start it off wrong and being honest abes we let them know :)

A disappointment was that we asked that the churros be wrapped up so we could enjoy during the fireworks (had to ask more than once). We were hoping they could add another churro in there (how about a friendly gesture for not short changing the bill) but found out that they only made one order at a time (they make one churro at a time??) 

Considering we had spent over $100/person this was a little weird but will give Rosa Mexicano another chance this time from the regular menu.
author: Jessica S.

description:
I just recently went here with one of my best friends and had a very good experience. Although we didn't order any main entrees, we ordered appetizers, drinks, and dessert and it was really good. Being that it was raining the night we went, this wasn't a bad place to go because of it being so close to the Embarcadero BART. 

But the chicken flautas hit the spot and I love their table side guacamole! I'm pregnant right now so I didn't have the chance to enjoy any of their mixed drinks, BUT I did get to indulge in their aguas frescos and it was so refreshing! Especially the cucumber lime aguas frescos. For dessert we both shared the coffee-infused flan and their version of tres leches. IT WAS SOOOO YUMMY!!!

I'm definitely going to go back to try their entrees this time. I'm sure I won't be disappointed. And after the baby's here and I'm done with breast feeding, I'm TOTALLY going to try their drinks. From reading the descriptions on their menu, their drinks sound awesome.

ALSO, the staff was amazing. They were all so friendly and super accommodating!
author: Clarissa M.

description:
Good Experience.

The service was friendly and solid.  The decor is hip.  Made at your table guacamole was delicious.  The churro dessert was scrumptious.  The price was reasonable.  My reason for not giving 4 or 5 stars is because everyone's main courses were mediocre - they were lacking the spices or flavor that great Mexican food has.  This seems like a good spot to come after work, pre theatre or with a large group.

Bottom line - I would go again, but would not go out of my way to eat here.
author: Jonathan G.

description:
Incredibly expensive, but delicious food. The serving staff consistently left my water glass empty, for at least a half hour, even though I had no other drink.

I forgot that I am NOT a fan of their ceviche. It comes with saltines and one of them is served on a bed of watermelon. It's just a little too rich for my palate...perhaps?

The chef was redeemed by the main entrees - salmon, cod, pork were all cooked to perfection. The best value is by far the chamorro which came out looking like the size of a dinosaur leg. It was the talk of the table. If I ever come back here with DH I am making sure he orders that!

I loved the creativity of the ice cream menu. We had the churros stuffed with ice cream  - which was incredibly decadent with the mexican chocolate sauce spooned over it. The sauce could have been served a little warmer so it spread better. But it tasted so good I didn't really mind. 

We should have skipped the ice cream "guacamole" - we had eaten so many avocados already and were stuffed from dinner. Lesson learned.  

Advice to owner: Start serving pitchers of margarita, por favor!
author: Katelyn M.

description: We were so excited to see Rosa Mexicano had finally come to San Francisco due to the tons of times we enjoyed eating there in DC, that we made reservations for 5. Carnitas came all dry if not toasted, carbonized... Guacamole was awful, chunks of avocado mixed with cilantro Serrano and tomatoes, the chef was refusing to do something simple for our 8yo because the entire menu included spicy peppers. But at the end they brought him a huge and expensive quesadilla. The sauce for my Alambre de camarones was spicy with no taste, rice was dry, I couldn't eat it. The worst part was the terrible service, the waiter completely forgot about us, he just served us a first round of drinks and even though he asked if we would like another round and said yes, they never came. We asked other waiters to bring us glasses of water, we ended up being completely  ignored. Terrible service and terrible food. So glad we have reposado in Palo Alto. I'm pretty sure that for happy hour for beers and expensive tasteless guacamole this place is good. Otherwise find another Mexican restaurant.
author: Vanessa V.

description: I am a glutton for punishment so I guess that's why I've been here so many times.
author: Justin A.

description: Previously tried the location at National Harbor in Washington DC. Loved that restaurant, so when we found out there was one in SF, we gave it a try. Only after we sat down did I see the Yelp reviews for this place, and honestly I don't get it. This is definitely better than a three-star place. I've experienced far worse Mexican restaurants that were rated higher on Yelp. This restaurant had very friendly and attentive (but not overbearing) service, the entrees were good (I had the chicken enchiladas suizas with rice and beans), and the guacamole was fantastic. The guacamole, which is prepared at the table, was in the top three best guacamole I've ever had. Great dining experience.
author: Richard K.

description: I always love me some good mexican food and was excited to try out this place since there aren't too many upscale mexican dining places in the city. Checked in to this place twice with a bunch of friends and both the times, we didn't really leave happy.   While the ambience, service, location and the vibe of this place is just super, the food was a bit downer for us. With the ambience that good, I feel this place is just a perfect spot for the happy hour!
author: Shweta M.

description:
I really really wanted to like this place.  I love Mexican food and this is right near my office.

I came last week for lunch and it so happened to be DAT. Excellent! As most have said the decor is nice and modern. The restaurant is very spacious and plenty of seating for large parties. 

Based on other reviews we knew we had to get their guacamole. And holy cow! A single serving (serves 1-2 people) costs $14! whoa!  A serving that serves 2-3 or was it  3-4 people costs $26! Holy cow!!! Granted it is expensive, it is prepared table side just the way you like it. And boy did we like it! 

Anyways, we ordered off the DAT - tried the guac and flautas for appetizers (both yummy). Tried the shrimp over rice dish and the chicken salad. Both main dishes were a disappointment. My shrimp was overcooked while my dining companion said his shrimp was undercooked. The salad was just okay, not bad but not super good either. 

We were brought our desserts - espresso flan and an apple cheesecake. Group consensus was the flan was not good (we each took only ONE bite) and we killed the cheesecake dish. 

Other than that service was okay.  Not sure if I'd come back - the guacamole and dessert were the highlights. Pretty sad - was hoping this place would be my new go to.
author: Julie F.

description: Probably not real Mexican but seriously delicious. 3 different meals all really good. Big tequila selection too
author: Carrie S.

description:
Not bad but not exciting. Decor is nice. Guacamole is freshly
made at the table. Bowl looks deceivingly large. Expensive. Higher end Mexican cuisine.
author: Sylvia C.

description: I've been to both the New York City location and the San Francisco one and I must say both are delicious.  I do think the NYC one is slightly better but anyway, I've been to the SF a few times now and it's always been good.  Service is decent, ambiance is nice and the food is always tasty and fresh.  Most definitely not authentic Mexican, very Americanized but still quite good.  I would recommend them if ur looking for a tasty meal with a slightly upscale trendy feel.  Their mango margaritas are particularly good.
author: Jared P.

description:
Been here twice. Once for brunch, once for new years eve dinner.

Got the tableside guac both times and it's consistently good. I like the salsas that come on the side as well. 

Brunch was better than dinner for shizzle.

The waiter seemed really intent on pushing us into the prix fixe dinner and open bar, but weren't looking for that kind of experience so it was rather annoying. This place runs on the expensive side but it's not insane or anything. 

Decent place that I would come back to on occasion, nothing spectacular or anything, but decent nonetheless.
author: David B.

description: My daughter was in town and we were running around and just had time for a quick bite. Had my favorite guacamole ever, and shared some nachos. Though it wasn't a large check, our server Armando treated us like we were spending $1,000. Smooth, professional, attentive, and just really nice. The food was great -- but Armando was the best part.
author: Cydney B.

description:
Same Rating....3.75

Had a burger with sweet potato fries this time. Really good and the Guacamole is still good. Service a bit slow. Really liked the sweet potato fries (Perfectly cooked).  Love that the company pays these SOMA prices.
author: Krissy A.

description:
This was our first time here and unlike other reviews, we think this place was great.  Guac was fresh made, not all mushed up like store bought stuff.  The pork tacos and quesedilla portions were huge, served with beans and rice but not like Taco Bell. If that's want you want, do not come here.  The churros came with three different sauces and we freshly made.  We'll be repeat customers for sure. 

For the folks that thought the prices were over-priced, I disagree.  Fresh ingredients, made to order, huge portions in one of the expensive cities in the country?  You get what you pay for here!
author: Mary A.

description: I use to be a regular for their happy hour, but no longer.  I went here last Wed to meet two friends for happy hour.  One of my friends ordered a nacho and asked that everything but the cheese and beans be put on the side.  The restaurant brought the dish out with everything on it and refused to make it the way she had requested because they claimed that what she ordered was not nachos. They continued to argue with us and said the chef refused to make it her way because it would be more work.  How does putting on less ingredients equal more work?  Go figure....  We have never experienced anything so ridiculous before.
author: Christine P.

description:
I've been to dinner twice now over the past week.  Once on a Thursday and once on a Friday.  Thursday the place was about 3/4 full and Friday it was entirely full so reservations are a good idea.  We had them both times and were seated immediately.  Ambiance is new/trendy and comfortable.  Decent space between tables and the bar area is entirely separate from the dining room so you're not bothered with people standing or walking by your table continuously.

Service was good both nights, but I will say the level of knowledge, attentiveness, and enthusiasm between servers seems big.  Our server was great, knew the menu, suggested options (including alcohol pairings), and was totally on it.  I didn't see this mirrored with everyone else though.

Food was good.  Both times we had the guacamole (made at your table) and enjoyed it.  First time I had the chicken enchiladas.  They were OK, but I wouldn't order them again.  Second time around I had the skillet style carne asada which was really good. Finished it off with two flan and one of the cakes for dessert and both were great.

It's a little on the expensive side for Mexican food even by SF standards.  Patrons were dressed either business casual or looked like they were making a night of it.  No hoodies or overly casual crap like that.  A number of folks gave some pretty bad reviews, but look at what they complained about and give it a shot.  I hope the places growing pains all work out.
author: Jeff M.

description:
Back in the late 1980's I dined at the 1st Street location in New York when Josefina Howard was behind the menu and the restaurant.  I count it as one of the most memorable dining experiences.  After so many years, I still have not forgotten the meal.  It was epic.

Move forward to 2012, Rosa Mexicano is a different restaurant.  The table-side preparation of guacamole is not anything new, but it certainly is nice to have it prepared fresh and it is delicious.  This is one of the few holderovers I recognize on the menu from Josefina Howard's days.  That and the pomegranate margaritas, also not new but still delicious.

The seasonal salsa was delicious.  They need to bring larger serving of it, the little soup spoon of it is a taste and not enough for a party of three or more.  They will bring more on request and the habanaro was really good, if a tad on the sweet side.  

I indulged in the lunch special and was not disapointed.  The fish taco was top notch, the soup was delicious and the desert of flan on top of a brownie was surely not strict cuisine of Mexico if you are talking street food.  It is more the modern Mexican cuisine and I liked it very much.  People make complain about authenticity, but chances are if you order food at a resto in the D.F. it's going to be more like this than 20th and Mission, S.F.  Many of the items on the menu look delicious and I am looking forward to a return visit.  The seasonal options look intriguing and I will bet by summer, the color and palates will be popping from the fresh flavor.

Like so many new dining spots, the lack of carpeting makes for a noisier experience (Slanted Door) as the dining room fills up.  Intimate this won't be.  Plenty of room between tables and the decor was nice and sleek.

The service was attentive and not bothersome.
author: Donna H.

description: This is our go-to happy hour spot. Great guacamole on the spot. The margaritas are okay, but worth the price. Yummy quesadillas and nachos. The other night we ordered the carnitas with pineapple as tacos and they were amazing! The steak taco option was delicious too with melted cheese on the bottom. Yummmm!
author: La Tache T.

description:
I liked my lunch here a lot. The fresh guacamole is worth getting as long as you are wiling to ask for extra chips or use the tortillas brought over.

Filling a very big space, with plenty of seats at tables and in the bar area, isn't easy even if the decor is modern. Looked to me like a small patio was outside too. My guess is their reputation precedes them, and is assisted by a convenient location. The menu has no bargains.

Vegetarian tacos have a more complex flavor than I would have guessed, and are worth ordering again. My friend ordered the duck and loved it. There are plenty of alcohol options, but we had to work.
author: Mike H.

description:
Great food, sharp margaritas.  Happy hour deal is insane.  Best tortilla soup.  

yum!
author: Renee B.

description:
Stopped in for drinks during happy hour. House margs were average but at a reasonable $6.00 a pop. At 7:00, prices went back to normal: $11.50 each! Way overpriced. I expect a much better drink at this price, not something I can get at a lower price from anywhere in the Mission. 

We ordered the fish tacos. Very disappointing. They were a basically a fat fish stick in a soft tortilla with a little sauce. Skip those. 

This I a happy hour place only. I see no reason to bother with a meal here.
author: Eric M.

description:
Walked in with really high hopes as the atmosphere was really nice.  But was quickly faced with horrible service, just okay food and overly priced.  The drinks weren't even that great.  If it wasn't for the great company I was sitting with I would have walked out.  

Who knows, maybe the bar / happy hour is good, but I will definitely not return to the restaurant.
author: Viki K.

description:
First time here and actually totally dug it.  Major pros were the guac (made right at your table), tortilla soup (very nice presentation and fresh) and the churros (ridonkulous).  I also liked the atmosphere, mostly professional-types, due to its location and the fact that we went on a Wed night.  
Next time I go (yes there will be a next time) I likely won't get the Mole Enchiladas.  Good but not great.
Only major con (which to some is a pro) is there are SO many ppl tending to your table that you feel like theres someone checking in, picking up, dropping off something every 3 minutes. #couldbeworseisuppose
author: Gohar J.

description: Great restaurant! The guacamole was fantastic and freshly made at the table. I ordered the chicken tacos, which were presented as more of a fajita dish, but still really good. This place is perfect for lunch and happy hour! They also have an outdoor seating area that would be perfect on a warm, sunny day :)
author: Michelle J.

description: I enjoyed my lunch experience yesterday at Rosa Mexicana much more than the consensus of the Yelp community, apparently.  I was in-and-out very quickly- dining on a much better than average chicken enchilada plate, with a very flavorful tomatillo cream sauce.  I ate it so quickly I couldn't take a photo- it was accompanied by generous portions of what I think were brown rice and refried black beans. This was my only visit, and I've never ordered anything else from their menu.  However I was seeking a fast (but sit-down) decent quality meal in the Rincon Center area, and they delivered perfectly.  I will be back for sure, and look forward to trying other items.
author: Andy S.

description:
First visit. This was recommended by the hotel concierge as a "Tex-Mex" place. Well, it's way more Mex than Tex. 

Guacamole was made table side and was very good. Ordered Suzua Chicken Enchiladas. Very mild and flavorful. Also had fis tacos--excellent. 

Great place for an upscale semi-Mexican meal. Restaurant is really loud so don't plan on any intimate conversations.
author: Rob G.

description:
I had dinner here dressed as "Sweep the leg" Johnny with my girlfriend, dressed as She-ra and we had great dinner.

The drinks menu is a bit pricey but very tasty and extensive. I recommend their Rosa margarita as it combines the perfect blend of sweet and sour. The chamorro and tablones are a faithful to their Mexican counterparts and left me feeling nostalgic for Mexico City. 

Top Dine Top Tip: The guacamole is good, but lacking in spice power. For those wishing to spice it up, an order of habanero peppers can nicely compliment the guacamole
author: Carlos V.

description:
Food -- five stars.
Service -- three stars.

I went on Saturday for dinner.  

Food:  Pomegranate margaritas, guacamole, chamorro, churros.  These were the stars.  The chamorro was outrageously good.  We also had the crab enchiladas.  They were good but not nearly as good as the other items.

Service:  I was disappointed.  Everyone was very friendly, but the operation did not seem to work smoothly.  Next time I go, I will stay at the bar.  

This is a good place for a casual dinner.  I think the service will improve over time as the restaurant finds its groove.  I recommend trying it.
author: Michael B.

description: Fun place! Get the guac, it's made table side. Mexican street corn is another yummy side from here. Atmosphere is nice and service was great!
author: Alanna V.

description:
My girlfriend and I visited SF last week and enjoyed touring the city's variety of food experiences, but being from Southern California we had to try the Mexican cuisine!  While walking around The Embarcadero we came across Rosa Mexicano and decided to go in and check out the menu.  To my surprise, the hostess was super friendly and happy to answer all our questions.  We weren't sure if we wanted to eat there but she convinced us when she told me non-meat options.  I'm a vegetarian, and I hate being limited to the same small selection of items everywhere I go.  She suggested I try the veggie tacos and guacamole which were incredible--flavorful and high quality ingredients that didn't make me feel like I was eating something less exciting than my girlfriend.  Our server was also really nice and made the table side guacamole experience that much more fun.

For the price, Case Mexicano is definitely worth a try--especially all the veg heads visiting SF!
author: Tyler M.

description: Awesome find in the financial district. As a former New Yorker, I had visited both locations in Manhattan many times. This outpost certainly lives up to the legacy. Great location, bright airy atmosphere, and friendly service. It's great for a business lunch, but I have a soft spot for their happy hour. The carnitas tacos (2 for $6) and chicken flautas are my go to faves (not including margaritas of course). Its true that it can be hectic at times, but its great for a fiesta after work. For a full meal option, I recommend the chicken mole enchiladas. The sauce is delicious. You may need a siesta after the fiesta, tho.
author: J D.

description:
This is a chain, but has decent food.  You must try the table-side made guacamole.  I had the fish tacos, which was small but tasty.  

The happy hour vibe is good, with lots of young professionals from the area.

Overall not a place to die for, but good for large groups and entertaining guests/clients.  Not really for foodies.
author: Joey G.

description: I am the least picky person on Earth when it comes to food. This place is not good and not worth the money at all. We paid $60 for bland, greasy food with gross meat. What a disappointment! The two close-by taquerias (rincon/bistro) are exponentially better in terms of food quality and flavor.
author: Ritika P.

description:
They ruined Cinco de Mayo.  Understaffed and overwhelmed on one of the busiest days of the year for a place with "Mexico" in the name.  Based on how bad things went, I wouldn't go back on a slow day either.

$50 pitchers of margaritas that you had to fight your server/wait in line for, mostly ice, and at some point they stopped even trying to pull the off-brand labels off the sour mix.  Ended up tasting like watery lemon-lime kool aid with a splash of well tequila.

The guac was made from fresh ingredients, which was nice, but because of the rush they barely mashed it at all.  Came out more like an avocado salad.  Salsas are nice and spicy, and the one thing they were actually nailing was steady chip production.  We envisioned a black belt Chip Master in the back that decided to put the whole team on his back and make it happen for the pride of chip makers everywhere.

On Cinco de Mayo, they went with a $35 fixed menu.  Can't blame them in hindsight given all the confusion, but I think they might have been better off just closing the kitchen down to only appetizers or tacos.  We literally could not order a quesadilla, they simply wouldn't let us.

To add insult to injury, at one point the manager came out and started grilling us on whether we were going to the bar to buy drinks or if we were ordering everything through our waiter, because "he wanted to make sure his waiters were taken care of."  The irony of course is that nobody seemed to want to make sure *we* were taken care of.  

Long story short, this place might make decent food on a slow night, but if you want to come here on Cinco de Mayo, I would recommend the Chipotle down the street.  The beers are cheaper, the service is faster, and you might actually get what you paid for.
author: Matt M.

description: Have been here twice on recent Saturdays for happy hour. The margs are strong and the food is good for a chain restaurant. The one thing that spoiled both evenings was the pompous, do-nothing manager that sucked the life out of his wait staff. Chastising staff in front of customers is the epitome of poor management skills. I can find a hundred great SOMA Mexican joints without the trumped up strife. Won't be back.
author: RICHARD C.

description:
I have mixed feels on this one. I think the good is pretty good, but certainly a tad overpriced. Better options can certainly be found

With that being said, it depends on what your looking for. The ambiance is nice, certainly more upscale then a normal Mexican restaurant. The other thing - we are in San Francisco, prices are pretty in line with what you would except to pay at similar type venues in the financial district.
author: Tara T.

description: Good location, being in the financial district.  I came here to meet my friend and  her husband for their happy hour.  It's a different twist for Mexican food.  I guess it's gourmet style.  The food can get pricey so the happy hour is good to check out first to see if it's a fit for your taste.
author: Liz D.

description: This is a go-to place for Happy Hour. The Margaritas are great and the guacamole is amazing!
author: Rae D.

description: Good food. Great guacamole. Lousy, inattentive service. 10 minutes to get water. 20 minutes to get guacamole. 25 more minutes to get entrees, several of which were prepared incorrectly. Wanted to like it, but not worth the time or money.
author: Jacob R.

description:
Went for lunch today with a friend.  I have been on a diet and have not been eating very much and no carbs.  So, I was going to cheat and have some cheese enchiladas.  
My order was at my table within 5 mins.  I was pleased I got it so fast.  Oh but wait, the cheese was cold!  It was not even melted.  The sauce had no flavor and no heat what so ever.  Tasted like it was poured from a jar onto cold cheese wrapped in corn tortillas.  I only ate two bites.  The waiter never asked how my food was or if there was a problem.

Also, asked for chips and salsa as the waiter went on and on about how great they are.   But guess what?  Never got them.

The restaurant is beautiful but the food is horrible and over priced.
author: John B.

description: Attempted to go for happy hour. Sat at the bar for 15 minutes and no one even acknowledged me...I walked out. I have had their fresh guac on past visits which is good, but they need to work on service even when it's busy..
author: John J.
