description: Two visits here and both times, the chicken was very undercooked and some of it was rubbery too. I can see that happening once, but twice? The second visit was a year after the first. Waiters are nice but slow.
author: Ichor B.

description: They guacamole is freshly made right in front of you; for me that is the main attraction.  During lunch hour the food can take a very long time.  Last time I went I took a VIP customer and it took over an hour which made things a bit uncomfortable.  Other than that, I like the food, the location and the prices are not terrible.  Solid three stars for me.
author: Mateo D.

description: I always love this place and they have always made a point of making room for our large party. The table side guacamole is so delicious and I love their margaritas. Everything we've tried on the menu has been great and the service awesome.
author: jason m.

description:
I had an exceptional experience here. I decided to take my husband out for a special Valentine's Day lunch, and the whole thing was fantastic. My only previous exposure to Rosa Mexicano were the meals they made for Freshdirect in NYC. (Those are okay). 

We started out with the guacamole, and initially I was a little scared off by the price, but it was totally worth it. We each got "a glass of sangria" which was actually a small pitcher that was two glasses. I would have been really happy if the guac and sangria was my whole meal, but we got entrees too. I got this tuna, mango, salad thing and it wasn't anything like I expected but I wound up eating all of it. My husband got the quesadilla and enjoyed it. (Admittedly, have you ever had a bad quesadilla? It's hard to screw up). 

The servers were fantastic - even though it was PACKED and we didn't have a reservation the hostess managed to seat us within ten minutes in a nice, somewhat quiet spot by the window. The atmosphere was perfect, the staff were really sweet, and the food was amazing. The only downside was the price, but I think it was worth it. I won't make it a regular spot but I'd happily return for special occasions.
author: Christy S.

description: I went for the lunch special.  The pulled chicken taco was delicious.  The soup had so much salt in it I could not finish it.  The chips and guacamole were great and the flan was passable.  But what bothered me was the fact that the waiter suggested that I have a margarita.  I thought why not?  it was a celebration of the CNY and meeting a close friend.  Never once did he let on that the drink cost $14, the same price as my entire lunch.  The drink was way too strong and I guess it should be for that price.  I blame myself for not asking for the price.  No margarita at a lunch place should ever cost that much.
author: James S.

description:
On Saturday, March 8th, around 1 pm our family thought it would be nice to go to this restaurant for a drink and appetizers.  When we arrived we were seated and then the long wait began.  The waiter was absolutely lousy and did not even set our table with napkins and silverware.  He did not get our drinks for over 40 minutes as we sat outside enjoying a warm day in San Francisco.

The food came and I had to get it myself because the waiter was a complete moron who stopped serving us altogether and gave the responsibility to another slow waiter.  

This place is overpriced, has poor service and I do not recommend you waste your Saturday afternoon going there because they are very disorganized.
author: Jerry H.

description: We frequent Rosa for many business lunches, but will have to set aside this venue for some time.  During a recent appearance my colleagues and I were ignored by a server who failed to make any of us feel welcome.  Because of this, we decided that drinks were the extent of our visit.  Upon our deparure, my colleague noticed that his sunglasses were missing as we exited the restaurant.  Within a couple minutes we were back at our table and requested that his sunglasses be returned.  The table was completely cleared, none of the servers responded, but thankfully the manager told us he would look into this issue and follow up the next day.  I do not want to make any false accusations, and am hoping that the sunglasses were simply misplaced.
author: Daniel G.

description: Rosa was very good, great service and a super clean restaurant.  Most of the financial district seems covered in a thin film of sticky-something, but they've managed to do away with it.  The menu was a little on the expensive side, but what do you expect in this area? The table-side guacamole was good, but oddly it was not prepared table side... I had fish tacos which came with corn, sounds weird but the cheesy cream sauce on the corn was really good.  I'll be back
author: Spenser T.

description: Definitely a 3 star place. The service was lacking as we needed a gluten free menu. It took over 10 mins to get one. In the mean time while waiting for the menu, we got to try the guacamole and that was good. Yet, when we finally got to order we got the empanadas as a starter (DO NOT GET THEM. NOT GOOD AND VERY SMALL). We then got the chicken enchiladas and gluten free tacos and there was absolutely NO TASTE. Nice ambiance, yet the food is no bueno. Not recommended.
author: Chris Y.

description:
The positive: Definitely some of the best guacamole I've ever had.  Had a bit of kick to it.  Nice.  I like!  I'm a fan.  Lovely décor.  Great ambience.

The negative: They put tartar sauce on my fish tacos.  I wasn't into that AT ALL (borderline OFFENDED). This is the first place I've ever been to that's done this.  Perhaps it's more common than I think, though? Strikes me as an American concession.

Put the two together, and it's evens out to a moderate 3 stars.  I'd definitely go back for the guacamole.  I'd skip the fish tacos.  Definitely worth another visit...
author: Eric H.

description:
2 days after opening and our meal was a smooth success - impressive. Food, service, and cocktails were on point.

Highlight was theTable side Guacamole. The recipe is simple and they make it right in front of you so why should this taste so much better than other guac around the city? Our server explained how they smash some of the ingredients into a paste which distributes the flavor throughout the serving. The consistency is just the right amount of chunky avocado/tomato. It comes with chips and tortillas to make into little guac tacos.  No question, order this.

Also really enjoyed their signature margarita...delish.
author: Amanda R.

description: Absolutely phenomenal!  I've been here about 5 times already and have never been disappointed. The manager, Roger, goes above and beyond to cater to everyone's preferred tastes! Some of my favorite dishes are the short rib enchiladas,  the ceviche,  and the guacamole they make right in front of you. Great for both large groups and couples dates. We'll be going again very soon!
author: Marwa A.

description: I've been to the restaurant four times and the food is delicious!  They also have really good Sangria.  Today's visit was a late lunch at around 1:45.  They were not busy but no one seemed too interested in seating us.  We waited a few minutes until one of the waiters acknowledged we were there and seated us.  We ordered the Guacamole that is fixed table side only they didn't fix it at the table so that was disappointing.  Many of the entrees are enough for two people so my son and I shared the carnitas.  Delicious!  Based on today's disappointing service I will only give them a three.
author: Kathy S.

description: When you are a loyal OpenTable customer,  you get rewarded with gift checks which are processed by the restaurant just like a travelers check.  I just spent 30 minutes sitting in the restaurant after my meal, while management tried to figure out how to accept this gift check.  It should be noted that printed on the front of the gift check it says " dear open table restaurant  please process as a travelers check."   After 30 minutes, and management not being able to figure it out, I ended up paying for my meal with my American Express card, and leaving truly disgusted with the ignorance level.  What would the manager have done if someone handed them an American Express travelers check? This is a very common thing, and travelers checks are treated just like cash.   I am a very loyal customer to this restaurant, but will never step foot inside there again until they make things right.
author: Robert D.

description:
First of all I am Mexican so I have a higher standard of review.

I went for the dine about town menu and I would highly recommend it.  

Guacamole - okay.  Not bad, but nothing memorable.  They need to add something..not sure what, but they can definitely improve.

Pomegranate Margarita - DELICIOUS!  Order it!  Also they have a heavy pour with that thing so be careful because it is so delicious.

I order the Camarones Veracruzana/Shrimp Brochette Shrimp dish and WOW.  I am REALLY picky about my shrimp and I am often disappointed at restaurants with their shrimp dishes, but this was delicious.  Great flavor and a generous portion.

My boyfriend ordered the Enchiladas.  I am not sure which Enchiladas he ordered, but it was delicious.  I am not a fan of enchiladas (I know what you are thinking - what kind of Mexican am I), but I just don't, but these enchiladas were great.

It is great for small groups and large groups.  They have a great outdoor patio area that is great for after work drinks or brunch.  Although if you are looking to be in the sun (which I LOVE to be in the sun), make sure you got before 12pm because then the building block the sunlight. 

I think the prices are a little bit pricey for what the dishes are, but it is not unreasonable.  

Ambiance is great.  They take great care of their restaurant. I would definitely go back again.  

After brunch it would be nice to stroll around the Embarcadero area and take in the views of the water and the bridge.
author: Vagabond V.

description:
I was SO excited when they opened Rosa's in SF because I love the NY restaurant.  However, during my first trip the gauc was not prepared well and it was super chunky, extra large chunks of avocado.  Some may like it this way, but I thought it was lazy preparation.

I had an inexperienced server and he didn't know many items on the menu or its ingredient.  I ordered the fish taco whcih was good.  I also liked the churro with trio sauce.
author: Yun C.

description:
*** My wife and l tired and
hungry from traveling found this equite 
establishment, decided to try it. I had a 
taste for burritos, from the name of the 
place I thought it would be on the menu, but 
Nick manager was quick to let us know that 
we can walk a couple of blocks down and 
find it elsewhere. I would give it a 4 star for 
an attentive service, although Nick the 
manager was so quick to suggest other 
places instead of welcoming business. 

Nick this a msg personally to you, Don't 
speak unless the customers request for 
suggestion.
author: Fred B.

description: Great spot for Mexican food & margaritas in the financial district . The ambiance is nice & the guacamole is to die for ! Forget about work for an hour & have a margarita :)
author: Marie M.

description: Average tasting food. The gaucamole prepared tableside didnt have full flavor. I had to add more lime and even then it was still lacking in flavor. I actually think it's better to prepare earlier and allow some time for the flavors to develop and meld together. I ordered the ceviche sampler,  nothing spectacular and definitely not meant to be a meal. Good thing I had the chips from the gauc to eat with it. My friend had the fish tacos. He didn't make any comments about it so I assume it was fine. I'll most likely be getting my Mexican food fix elsewhere though.
author: Rachel L.

description: I wanted to revise my review that I made after my Valentine's Day experience. The owner of the restaurant sent me a message after I left the review apologizing and asked me to come back and give them another chance. Well, I took the restaurant up on the offer...about 9 months later :) The manager Nicholas was great! He constantly checked on us and made sure my girlfriend and I had an amazing experience. The food was delicious and the service was top notch. To top it off, they comped everything including our drinks. Wow, way to win back a customer! Highly recommended!
author: Richard C.

description: Amazing margaritas and tequila options. It's good to get guacamole and then just share a meal between 2 people because it's a decent amount of food. Servers are very attentive as well. It's a fun time!
author: Ana J.

description:
I tried this restaurant for the first time this past weekend with friends who have been here before.

I didn't want to miss the 49er game, so it was nice to be able to sit by their bar and watch the game on their TV.

The restaurant has a nice atmosphere and good service.

Their guacamole was very good compared to most places, it's a must have.
Based on my friends recommendation, we tried their fish taco and it was very good. I like that they had fried the fish in batter so it was very nice and crispy. The tartar sauce was very tasty. If you are a fish fan, give the tacos a try.

We also had their famous Churros and it was by far, the best Churros I've had. Very well prepared and delicious. Melts in your mouth.

I would definitely give this place a try again if I'm in the neighborhood.

BTW, the 49ers won which made the experience that much better =D
author: Hamid A.

description: I came here for my bf's company holiday dinner and besides the guacamole (pretty cool how they prepare it table-side), the rest of the food was not memorable and very overpriced. Their margaritas were pretty good though and service was not bad, but I don't think I would ever come here if I had to pay- their prices are just too expensive for what it is. I think I'd be more satisfied with a cheaper place in the Mission.
author: Stephanie G.

description: A-OK our server was very good, the host at the door was a cute boy and drinks were abundant nothing wrong with that, we are from Boston so the prices were just perfect for the restaurant, this is not a watering hole, beautiful restaurant...
author: Wally C.

description: The food was delicious, seasonal, and incredibly fresh tasting. We had the table side guac, the veggie tacos with grilled asparagus, roasted butternut squash & Brussel sprouts and literally the best chile rellano I've ever had. Our counter server Alfredo was very helpful, attentive, and so friendly!
author: Suzie P.

description:
This is a decent, if pricey, place for upscale Mexican food.  Started with the tableside guacamole.  The tableside preparation is a nice touch, though the taste of the guac itself is decent but nothing special.  I then had the tres enchiladas.  They were tasty but a bit bland, though I admit it may be my fault as I asked them to not add any additional peppers to the dish.

The staff is very friendly and professional, and I would come here again.
author: Josh Q.

description: This restaurant is not only overpriced but cannot even serve reasonably fresh & tasty standard Mexican food. My shrimps were foul and mole sauce was mushy. I am never setting my foot here again.
author: Zhenya M.

description: Great ambiance and the menu has lots of interesting options.   My co-workers and I couldn't decide what to order.  We got the tableside guac which was $14!  Yummy, but probably not worth $14. I ordered the nachos whic were amazing.  Can't wait to go back at night and try the Sangria.
author: Renee J.

description: Their guacamole (2 avocados worth) is $26. Highway robbery. We sat outside in the cold in order to be allowed to order off the HH menu (not allowed to take advantage of HH at a table indoors) and ordered skinny Margs assuming they were part of the HH menu only to find out they were $14/piece. Ridiculous.
author: Megan F.

description: The pomegranite margs are good, but real killers; crab enchiladas excellent and any of the ice creams for dessert!!! (Except the avocado!!!)  Overall, the meals were great, service great, ambiance nice.  I kind of expected more though...four stars is the best I can give it!
author: R J.

description: Sucks ass. I went with my friends here during New years eve, the server was pissed at us when we tried to inquire about the menu choice. Even I was being so graceful.. I told him that we need 5 mins to make up our mind on the menu. He didn't come to our table at all. We told the manager on the situation, and still our server ignored us after he had a glimpse at our table. As our patience were tested after 20mins, we abruptly left the establishment. What a rude server!! You think the food would automagically ordered itself? Rosa mexicano?? More like Balls mexicano
author: Shazwina Z.

description:
I come here every six months or so to remind myself that I don't like it. As a happy hour spot, it's workable when not filled with the badged conference-goers who so often get shunted into this corner of SOMA. I've had pleasant evenings on the patio with chips, guacamole, and margaritas.

As a restaurant, the service is consistently lackluster, with every step of the process moving at a glacial place. Yesterday's lunch took 1.5 hours, despite the place being half-empty when we entered and our orders being straightforward. 

The food is usually pretty good here, but not good enough to justify the price. The prices would be appalling if I were not so jaded after a year and a half of working in this area. Instead, they are just mildly depressing.
author: John O.

description: I work in the bld and have to say the food is not good at all.  You can't even begin to call it mexican.  We went for lunch and to start the food took forever to arrive,  luckily we had 1.5hrs to spare.  Since it took soooo long youd expect the food to be at least half descent.  Well, it wasnt even close.  The tacos were not good at all and the portions are so small and sad it cost me $16.  I suppose I was paying to breathe the air in that place.  Hate to say it but although the decor is nice the food just sucks!
author: Seasbass A.

description: I'm addicted to the guacamole.  Best I've ever had. I dream about it.  But it's damn expensive.  Poor me has to settle for Costco guacamole.  Their lunch special is around $14 and comes with soup, 1 taco, 1 dessert, and a tiny portion of guacamole.  Good variety for a lunch special.  Their drinks are pretty decent too.  But other than that, food-wise, you don't get much for what you're paying.
author: A N.

description: So far my favorite Mexican restaurant in the city!   Rosa has the best happy hour.  I can't get enough of the Flautas. I did notice the last time I was here I only got two Flautas instead of three like usual. The service can be slow if you sit in the bar but that's expected.  I would give it a 5 but they always play their music too loud and I am not a fan of the type of music they play. Definitely recommend this to anyone looking for good quality and cheaper happy hour in the financial district!
author: Samantha S.

description: Regular @RosaNYC. was worried based on the reviews, but have to say our experience here was great. Definitely on par with our great experiences in NYC.
author: Maureen M.

description:
Super over priced but the food's good. We got kinda tricked into ordered the guac which was like $14 or something ridiculous. We ordered it medium but it had no spice at all so definitely order it hot! Also they said it was "table side" guac but they brought it to our table already made which was super lame.
We ordered bloody marys and the waiter came back and said "what kind of tequila do you want?" We informed him there's no tequila in a bloody mary. 2 minutes later he comes back and asks what kind of bloody mary we wanted. Confused by the question, we asked him to elaborate. He said there's Smokey, Habanero or Green. I asked what Smokey and Green were and he said Smokey was like a traditional one and Green was "made with more greens" I asked what that meant and he started to ramble and then just stopped talked and stared at us. How hard is it to go back to the bar and ask them what the choices mean so he can explain them to us properly. I know he was a new waiter but jesus.
I had the Mexican scramble with chorizo which was very good. BF's Steak torta was ridiculously greasy and disgusting to hold but the flavor was good minus the grease.
Brunch for 4 people came to $150 which is ridiculous but we were starving so what can you do?
author: Kajal G.

description: I'm from the Midwest. This is the classiest Mexican restaurant I've been too. Baja tacos were delicious. The jalapeño corn  Tatar sauce was interesting and sooo good. Wish we has some place like this around me. Glad we found this little gem. No free chips and salsa which I'm used to in my state. Only downside.
author: Tiffany M.

description: I've been there twice and ordered the same thing each time...guacamole and chips (which is freaking amazing) and the fish tacos (also, very delicious.)   The tres leche cake is quite nice!    They have a nice selection of tequila, also.    I think the prices are okay, given the other restaurants I frequent.    The servers have been very nice each time I've been there and the wait hasn't been too bad (went once during busy day for lunch, and once when a friend was in town).     I recommend this place highly.  I plan to go back and check out their other menu items if I can only slow my roll on being such a creature of habit.
author: Wayne S.

description:
I'd give this 3.5 stars - It falls somewhere between A-Okay and I'm a fan - I have to admit, there were things on this menu I have never eaten before, so that moves it closer to the 4 star range - but I think you have to be a fan of those speciality items or you may be a little disappointed if you came here for a high end Taco Bell experience, expecting the items you see on that menu.  The four star experience starts with the hand made at your table Guacamole - this is worth showing up for - just to eat this - and I was with a group event, so I didn't see the prices of this stuff, but I gotta think it don't come easy with that type of hand crafted experience.  I could have eaten that entire bowl myself.
Appetizers - we had Ceviche de Camarones (That be Shrimp for those looking for the Wiki translation) - These were really good - marinated in a light citrus/avocado blend and the Queso Fundido - Fundido indeed - grab a couple of freshly made tortillas and slop some of this on and you're good to go.
Main course - we had one of everything I think - Carnitas Tacos - pork and potatoes - reminded me a little bit of pork skins - but it was just the way the meat was fried, made good mini tacos - Their salsa is HOT - so a little goes a long ways with that stuff.  We also had the Pollo/Grilled Chicken Skillet Style - sweetly marinated chicken great - also great for a mini taco - hot out of the skillet.  Salmon Poblano - my least favorite - seemed a little undercooked for my taste and I'm not a fan of Kale, but if you are - it was the Tuscan Variety, which to me always screams Mexican prepared - last but not least, was my personal favorite of the entrees,  the Tablones - braised beef short ribs marinated in guajillo and pasilla chile with smokey mestiza sauce and rajas - That would be my order next time - gigantic pieces of beef and loved loved loved that sauce - I didn't even have to write down the rest of what was in it, as for our group, they did a hand made menu for us letting us know all the great things we were eating.  I saw someone whining on her about not having pitchers of margaritas - that is all we had all night - two versions - one standard and one spicy.  They looked like they kept a big urn of both of these to draw from all night in the middle of the restaurant, so maybe the other person just missed that part.
Dessert - Tres Leches de Zarzamora, Churrs en una Bolsa & Flan - all were terrific, but order the Churros and they come with a variety of dipping sauces, that was the best part of those - the sauces were delicious.  I'd take guests here, guess some of the snooty SF crowd is expecting Mama Rosita's here - it's high end Mexican - so just go with the flow - you'll find something you like on the menu.
author: Steve A.

description: One of my favorite mexican restaurants. Love the freshly made guacamole. The pan roasted cod was very good. Flavor wasn't too strong and was well balanced.
author: Ashutosh T.

description: Went for dinner last night as a party of six. There  was no wait, even on a Saturday night, which should have told me the place was not good. Service was terrible, drinks were way over priced and the enchilada dinner with a weird sauce was in no way authentic nor ws it very good. We had to wait at least 15 minutes just to get a waiter to give us the bill only to find it included  an 18% tip, even though we only had six people in our party. No way I ever go back there
author: Neil W.

description:
Actually 1.5*

Rosa Mexicano sounds like a fabulous novela produced by Televisa, starring Thalia as Rosa, and William Levy, a Cuban national living as a Mexicano and their tumultuous love affair in Mexico. Well, that's just as much fabulousness as you'll get, because my dining experience was a total #foodifail. You see, being Mexican myself, I expect to be astounded by the flavors, and concoctions restaurants try to create and pass it off as Mexican.

Don't get me wrong, the decoration is refined, and not full of tchotchkes like Chevy's, but with a beautiful wall full of "clavadistas" that I am sure was inspired by La Quebrada in Acapulco. BUT unlike Chevy's the guac at RM did not have queso fresco sprinkled on top. Unlike Chevy's, the chips at RM were not warm and toasty. 

The Food was forgettable. 
My better half and I had the following:

Apps:
two layered corn tortillas, in the center was some shreds of duck, inundated with some creamy chipotle/habanero sauce. I think they called it Zarape de Pato. BTW the server raved about it and it was nothing to rave about, to add insult, it arrived at room temperature, not hot, and far from warm. Because the other half likes to stay under the radar, I was instructed to not behave like Mariah Carey, I obliged. 

In addition, we had the Ceviche sampler... or shall is say, 3 bite-size (LITERALLY!!) portions of ceviches. One which was over watermelon, YUCK. The other two were pretty tasty, too bad one was a one inch taco filled with ceviche, YES, one inch. Call me a size queen if you must, but I wanted more than one inch ceviche taco!!! 

...and of course the "table side guacamole" needing some salt, and some lime, and like previously mentioned, some queso fresco to fisnish it off. 

Entrees:
Alhambres Mexicanos: Steak and Chorizo over rice, and two salsas directly poured on the sides of the rice. Now, why would they pour generous amounts of salsa directly on the plate? What if the salsas were too spicy, or nasty!? Overall, it was OK. But I did not appreciate the overzealous salsas drowning my rice. 

Slow Braised Short Ribs: Very fatty.... bland tasting. Overall not okay. Could have done better with the "Tequila/Beer" marinade. As in, actually marinate it next time!There was actually no flavor whatsoever on the frickin fatty meat. Oh Rosa, how can these cooks be so cruel to you!? You went from Maria Felix to a cheap cabaretera, and not THE Aventurera. 

Drinks... A glass of sangria for $16 bucks, and some other forgettable drinks. 

BTW: 
Unlike other reviewers have said, the busser was very attentive.
author: Dre X.

description:
The guacamole was absolutely amazing, but the small portion for 3 people was barely enough...expected more for the price. Oh and it wasn't made table side?
The tortilla soup was flavorless and oily, the chicken was cubed (not shredded) and was ultimately returned.
I would have ordered the tacos, but noticed they were $20 for three very small tacos (no sides) and couldn't justify the cost for my hunger level!
I ended up with the cheese enchiladas which would have been decent if they weren't covered in a sauce that tasted like it should have been on a pizza! 
Overall disappointed with the experience,but the service was great and the ambiance was fun :)
author: Nikki G.

description: Ew. Everything we ordered was nasty. I'd rather eat at Chevys. The $14 guacamole was horrible. Fish tacos- horrible. Chicken enchiladas- horrible. Nick was best thing about the restaurant. Oh- and the margaritas- those were decent. Never again!
author: Lisa H.

description:
disaster.

-don't give me a huge laminated menu when i walk in. it says to me, "you're eating the exact same food in the winter that you'll eat in the summer, and the exact same food in san francisco that you'll eat in northern california." at these prices, and being located in northern california, at least change your menu up a little bit.

-dine about town menu differed from the one online in that there was a $7 surcharge if you got a single serving of guac. it's deceptive to not post that on the dine about town menu site, not to mention the point of dine about town is to try fancy restaurants at a lower price level. and they refused to do a half portion.

-service was terrible - always had to ask for my water being refilled.

-no chips and salsa to start? this is not some american invention, any mexican restaurant, tex-mex, authentic, upscale, gives you this.

-stale chips. and why are you giving me tortillas for my queso. tortillas are meant for wrapping, not dipping (tortillas were very good).

-queso was fine, nothing special. not a whole lot, given the price.

-tiny portion of steak. was medium rare on the inside, but burnt on the outside. not a fun taste. ok.

-dessert was actually very good. 


the sad part about this restaurant is that it's the only restaurant in the financial district serving upscale mexican food, so it will do just fine financially.
author: Mark A.

description: I love this place!! Their table side guacamole, nachos and baja tacos are AMAZING. great service too. Its a really good place for a business lunch or dinner, but don't forget to make a reservation as they get packed.
author: Galina R.

description: I came here tonight with 5 of my friends.  For some completely unknown reason, they would not serve an alcoholic drink to me - the only person out of our table of 6.  I was not drunk, I did not have too many drinks before arriving, and in fact, had drank way less than any of my friends before we arrived (me and my friends maybe had 2 drinks total before we came) and they would not serve me a drink.  I refused any service or food after that.  They were very rude to my entire party and we did not do one thing to draw attention to ourselves.  We are a group of 6 moms - all with at least 2 kids at home.  It was astonishing.  When I talked to the so-called 21 year old manager - he had no explanation, nor would he do anything about the misunderstanding.  Absolutely not worth your time.  If you have any money San Fransisco, do not waste your time or money here.
author: Jill W.

description: Tried this place 3 times.    Bad service, slow service, and unfriendly staff.   Don't waste your time or money!!!!
author: Matthew W.

description: Service was good. Food wasn't. Not sure what qualifies this as Mexican cuisine. The guacamole is super bland, I wouldn't get it again.
author: Andrew A.

description: Been there three times since they opened and they are getting better. The food is great, a little expensive compared to local alternatives. Service is much better if you sit inside.
author: Trevor R.

description:
went here for brunch and there were maybe about 10 tables with people in the whole giant place. The food was OK, more like 3 stars and the service was absolutely terrible it took us 3 hours to eat brunch, 1 hour for them to take our order and we waited an hour for our check. Way over priced, better of going anywhere else.

Food: 3 stars
Service: 0 stars
Price: 1 star
author: Chris W.

description:
I came here for happy hour - 

$6 Margaritas, strong. 
$14 for a double serving of guacamole (good for about 4-6 people). - Good. 
$6 for a plate of Queso Fundido (vegetarian version has mushrooms instead of chorizo). - Good. 
Veggie Tacos - Mediocre. A litle bland.

Overall, mediocre food and a little overpriced.
author: Geetanjali J.

description:
I try not to write negative reviews, but I can't help it.  This place is awful.

The main terrible thing is the prices.  On their lunch menu it's $14 for a quesadilla with chicken.  In San Francisco?  Are you kidding me.  No, they are not kidding.  $12 for a margarita that tastes like it comes from a bottle (because it did, as you'll find out in a moment).   Maybe it's a $5 margarita, if you aren't too picky.  Everything on their menu is priced like that, about twice as expensive as it should be.

The other thing about this place is that the waiter I had was pretty pushy, trying to get me to buy more stuff.  For example, the $12 margarita (which says it has fresh lime juice in it):  after I order he says, oh you should get one of the more expensive ones because the one I ordered doesn't have fresh lime juice.  It's from a bottle.  I say, "but it says fresh lime juice right here" and he says, "yes, fresh from the bottle."  So it felt like the menu was lying and the server was up-selling.  He didn't take no for an answer and asked again.  Then he comes back and asks if I want table-side guacamole service.  Which is pretty hilarious, since it costs another $14.  

The only plus was that the quesadilla was tasty.   The tortilla was crispy and the cheese was melted pretty well.  A bit soggy on the bottom, but all in all pretty good.  

There's so much great Mexican food in SF.  Don't bother with this place unless you are on an expense account.
author: Peter G.

description:
My boyfriend and I had dinner at Rosa Mexicano last Friday since it was one of the places listed for Dine About Town. We noticed that this restaurant had a lot of mixed reviews on Yelp, but we were craving Mexican and this was one of the few places listed. 

The service at Rosa Mexicano is great - from the hosts to the bussers to the servers. Decor here is also great - I really enjoyed physically being in the restaurant for my dinner. However, I am giving 2 stars because the food, along with the price, is just so not worth it.

We ended up ordering a la carte (vs. the Dine About Town prix fixe menue) since my bf didn't really like the entree options on the special menu. We ordered the following: Guacamole, Pork Belly and Scallops tacos, Chicken Enchiladas, and Sangria. The Guacamole was pretty good and very fresh - they do make it at your table and you can adjust the taste on the spot if you like. My biggest gripe about this place is that the entrees are priced between $18-$30. I don't mind high prices, but for those prices, the food better be good. The dishes here look pretty but taste like nothing. My Pork Belly and Scallops tacos were dry, boring, and very bland. The sound of "Pork Belly and Scallops" screams tasty and delicious to me, but the dish was the complete opposite. My boyfriend had the Chicken Enchiladas and after one enchilada, he was done with it and did not enjoy it at all. The Sangria here is just okay - tastes better when I toss ingredients together at home and make it in a few minutes.

Basically we paid for bland, tasteless dishes at $18 - that's a big no no. Along with that, Mexican food is supposed to be tasty, delicious, and very hearty - the dishes here were light and bland. 

I definitely won't be returning - hopefully they change things up - not sure how long this place can last. If you want Mexican food with a nice setting, make a visit to Tropisueno - they do it just right - hearty, delicious Mexican cuisine in a nice setting at a very reasonable price.

$85 down the drain... should have went to a Taqueria!
author: Tiffany K.

description:
My friends and I were stoked when this spot opened.  We live a few blocks away and were getting tired of hitting up Palominos.  So we went on a Monday night. The décor was very nice, the space was large, ample outdoor and indoor seating, TV's in the bar area. So far so good.  The happy hour menu also looked promising, with its selection of cheap bites and drinks. Again, so far so good.  We ordered a few food items and drinks.  Then the food came out, and this is when things got a little weird.   The Hamachi tacos were tiny. I mean "Honey I Shrunk the Kids" tiny.  They were more fit to be fed to a gnome than a human.  Although, it was pretty tasty and the truffle oil complimented the Hamachi very well.  I just could have used about 30 of these gnome tacos.  We also ordered the happy hour tacos, or should I say taco, because just one came out when I swore our waitress told us they came in orders of three.  Anyway, the menu said it was a lamb taco, but it definitely was pork.  The pork tasted fine, except it came on some sort of buckwheat pita. A simple corn or flour tortilla would have been cool. We also ordered the chicken flautas, which was probably the best item since it was human size and it came in an order of three.  Not feeling satisfied, we then ordered the ceviche, or at least we thought it was ceviche.  It came as a trio sampler.  One was extremely salty, the other consisted of raw oyster soaked in hot sauce and not sure what the third one was.  And they served it with saltine crackers. Not sure salty crackers are the best item to serve with already salty ceviche.  I'm pretty sure I exceeded my salt intake for the day with those few bites.   At this point I was ready to give  Rosa two stars.  But then the waitress asked us how our meal was and we gave our honest feedback.  A minute later a mysterious man in a suit appears and apologizes and even offered to take the ceviche off our bill. Unfortunately we already paid.  He was really cool and explained that they are new and still experimenting with their menu. Totally understandable.  He even offered to bring us a desert on the casa.  I asked for flan and he said they made an excellent flan and that he would bring it out.  At this point I was ready to bump them to three stars because the mystery man was really cool about it. But then the flan came out.  Flan is one of my favorite deserts and I consider myself somewhat of a flan connoisseur, and what came out definitely was not flan.  It was a chocolate mousse/ mud pie thing.  It tasted decent, but it just wasn't flan.  So I ordered another beer to drink away my disappointment, but it took over 10 minutes to come. So I had to bump them back down to two stars.  

Overall, this place is like an overpriced Chevy's.  We didn't try the other entrée items, but most were in the $20 to $30 range.  I really hope they can fix the menu because this spot definitely has potential.  In the meantime, we'll be back at Palominos. FML.
author: Grant L.

description:
I've been here a couple of times now due to the convenience of the location, and I can't say I was that impressed.

Happy hour - Happy hour here is a solid 3-4 stars.  It's good.  I'm a pretty big fan of the margaritas.  They also have a nice selection of happy hour bites.  The downside is tables at the bar fill up super fast (especially on Fridays) and it gets quite noisy.  

Dinner -   Dinner was a 2 star experience.  Food isn't great and definitely overpriced.  My boyfriend's beef enchiladas were good, but I was bored of my cheese enchiladas after two bites.  My friend couldn't finish her chicken ones.  We ordered the guacamole "spicy" but there was no spice to be found.  The wait staff was decent but the host was rude.  Also, the restaurant does not let you order drinks from the happy hour menu if you are sitting in the restaurant section, which I find annoying.  

Bottom line - I'll probably come back for happy hour.  But for a meal, I'll pass.  The food really isn't that great, especially for $15 - $30 a plate.
author: Amelia B.

description: I thought this place has great food when I went here the other day with the family. I had a wonderful Crab enchilada, with a very tastey cream sauce on top. They serve up super fresh guacamole that they bring to your table. Way cool decorations on the wall. Super clean restrooms. Yes, I must admit that it's a little pricey for Mexican food, but very high quality. Highly reccomend this place.
author: Peter J.

description:
Yum!

Really cool ambiance inside of the restaurant. Love the melon drink offered. Guac was delicious and made tableside. I ordered the fish and really enjoyed it.

I will be back!
author: Bella C.

description: My girlfriends bosses invited us here for dinner. I spent the majority of the night trying not to embarrass myself and more importantly her I couldn't enjoy the meal.  One thing that stood out though was the steak. Tender and to die for. My girlfriend doesn't hate me and she still has her job. I think I did OK.
author: Ben Z.

description: This place is huge!  I like the décor and it gets pretty busy for lunch.  If you can get a table outside, that's great because it's nice to hang out and people watch.  I have come here twice and had the salmon and kale salad both times - that salad is SO good but it's expensive!  I have also tried the table-side guac, which is pretty good.  I think their service can be uneven but overall, a good option for a more casual and fun business lunch than some of the more formal places in the Financial District.  Their tacos and enchiladas look good but I haven't tried either yet.
author: P M.

description: Sigh. Was hoping for a decent Mexican place within walking distance of work, but this place is yet-another SF clip joint. Very high BS coefficient with a trendy menu complete with all the required buzzwords, and they push their guac like Colombian coke dealers. I got the "quick lunch' that had some stupid,catchy name. An ice cream scoop of  their flipping guac, a cup of decent soup, a taco-truck sized fish taco and above-average espresso flan, served on a plastic tray that made me think of First Class service on Aero Mexico. $12. I gave it a low rating because it's really the answer to a question nobody asked. Phooey...
author: John H.

description:
Possibly 4 stars for food but hardly 1 for service. I went there yesterday (Monday Nov 5) with clients at noon after a meeting. There were 6 of us and I hadn't made reservations so we ended up sitting at a bar table. That was absolutely fine - made a business lunch a little lighter and more fun! But...10 minutes of us just hanging out and talking, noone had come by to take our drink/appetizer order. I finally got up and went to the bar to ask if someone will be servicing our table. About 5 mins later a waiter comes up to ask for drinks and we tell him we're also going to order to save time. The menu has a "Time Crunch" option for lunch. Since we'd already burned 15 minutes and everyone had to be back in the office no later than 1, we assumed this would be a good dining option. My dad told me never to assume....

Flash forward 20 minutes and we haven't received anything that was ordered. We didn't even get a complementary bowl of chips that seemed to go on everyone's table as soon as they sat down. I asked our waiter to check on the status of our meal. He came back saying it would be done soon. 10 minutes later one of my guests asked and the waiter said it would be ready soon. Now it's almost 1 and we all have to run. I asked for the meals to be boxed up and a few of the gang decided they'd stay to get their food. The boxes didn't come until about 1:05 and I was told that the rest of the food didn't come until almost 1:30! I don't even know fine dining restaurants with this horrible of service. What a waste of time! There are too many good restaurants too close by to have to budget 3 hours for a simple Mexican lunch.
author: Danielle T.

description:
Disgusting.  Worst mexican food ever.  Service and management awful  Complained about it and the manager acted like he was Pancho Villa himself.

Id rather eat a 7 layer from taco bell.
author: rob a.

description: Good service, interesting margs and cocktails (negra modelo + sangria?), huge bowls of guac, not too noisy, good layout and table space.
author: Sonya Z.

description: I went to this restaurant for a company lunch and it was a great place to go with your coworkers. Really good drinks, and even better food. The staff was oddly pushy and really wanted us to order more and more, even though we had already ordered appetizers, drinks, and main courses, but with that said, it was still a solid place to go for a company lunch. Would definitely recommend the tres enchiladas, as well as the lemon margaritas!
author: Layne B.

description: First night open and the two salsa options are tasty. The service was very attentive. Try the skinny margarita, it's still very strong! :)
author: Laura F.

description: Unlike some other Yelpers who gave this place few stars, I actually enjoyed my dinner here because of the food.  I don't expect a place like this with these prices to be 100% authentic, but I do expect it to serve dishes that are inspired by the Mexican cuisine and kicked up a notch to match up with the Bay Area food scene and Rosa Mexicano does that.  We had the handmade guacamole, which was truly made to order without judgment (no onions or cilantro, thank you very much), mixed grill, and the crab enchilada.  The meat was cooked perfectly, and the enchilada was really flavorful because of the sauce they used.  The wait staff were really attentive and made sure that we always had what we needed.  I'm really looking forward to dining there again.
author: Julie P.

description: This was so bad that I am writing on my way home-- immediately after leaving. Not only were the host and severs very rude and pretentious, but I had the worst fish tacos. The fish was fried an in a fish stick form. Nasty and not worth a $50. Only redeeming thing about this place is the location.
author: Ashley T.

description: I have waited years for an SF location.This absolutely one of the best restaurants in the city. The food and decor is spectacular along with the service. I had the Crab enchiladas with a suiza tomatillo cream sauce which was wonderful. I also enjoyed the figs stuffed with chorizo and blue cheese. They also have seasonal salsas, my favorite being the tomatillo cranberry salsa. A must is the Churros with dipping sauces. I can't wait to go back and try the Pork Belly and Scallop tacos.
author: Benjamin K.

description: Omg!!! Worse Service ever!!! Place is too busy for 2 bartenders;( who did the best they could!!! Looks like no managers around and few servers who just past by  not even looking at you!!! It took as 40 min for 2 drinks and yes we left hungry.... Not going back any time soon!!!! If you running happy hour then have more staff!!! FYI gentleman next to us left pist too, to bad he didn't leave tip to bartender as is not they fault that managers don't give....
author: L N.

description:
The Rail Museum was closed for lunch and we were tired of walking around so we stumbled upon Rosa Mexicano at just the right time. It was nice and cool inside, it wasn't very crowded so we got a table immediately and they had a big menu of margaritas, what's not to love? The restaurant is absolutely gorgeous inside. There is a huge wall of cascading water with diver figures descending with the water behind them. The walls are vibrant colors in orange, pink, and purple. It was really pretty. 

Unfortunately the service wasn't quite as good as the venue and the prices were a little inflated. Our server inquired if we were "just there for water" while we were looking at the menu which felt rude, but she got better as she realized that we were actually ordering. She also was very concerned about my request for a mojito made with rum instead of tequila (as they are normally made), but she managed to agree to it and it was delicious. Drinks took 15 minutes before any of the bartenders even started making them. I'm not sure where they were because no one was behind the bar. It was not overly busy, but there were at leave 30-40 people in the restaurant...it felt like a bar with that many people there should have some bartenders. Once we got our drinks they were delicious. Four of us shared a double guacamole ($24) and it was absolutely delicious. Despite the price and the bizarre service, I might have to go back just for that guac!
author: Kari G.

description:
I had a business lunch at Rosa Mexicano on April 28, 2014 and was excited to try the food. Having worked in the Financial District for more years than I care to admit, the food can get a bit boring so I was interested in seeing what Rosa Mexicano had to offer.

The decor is tasteful and not your usual "hipster trying too hard" decor. The staff was fabulous (I believe Maurice seated us). Our party was for seven people and the chef actually came out and introduced himself. He was charming and gave us several menu suggestions that we jumped on. 

The guacamole is made at your table and looked gorgeous (and I hate guacamole!). It was gone in minutes. Then came our appetizers and they were also devoured with two people debating on who would have the last hamachi taco. The ahi tuna with melon was also a big hit.

I am a picky eater and not only did the waiter listen to what I said...he took it one step further and made sure there were absolutely no vegetables in my dish (I know, I know, who doesn't eat vegetables...ME!). 

All of our dishes were plated beautifully and everyone shared a taste. I had the mole enchilada and it was ridiculously delicious. I have to say it was the best mole sauce I have ever had. The flavors blended perfectly and there was a bit of heat to it. The food was amazing and I was pleasantly surprised to find it was not your typical high-maintenance or bland and unimaginative Mexican food. 

The prices are also reasonable!

I have several business events coming up and am definitely going to consider Rosa Mexicano as a venue. It would also be a great place to stop at before a Giants game!
author: Juli M.

description:
Over-priced Mexican food - pretending to be upscale (meaning they overcharge and give you skimpy portions).  And a rip-off to boot: I ordered a standard happy hour margarita.  The staff immediately asked me to give them my credit card and refused to run a tab.  This is a business district, not a dive!  Then, it turns out, the waitress gave me a higher priced brand margarita than what I had ordered - and when I contested it, she said that she was trying to be helpful by giving me a higher priced drink (as it was standard for Rosa Mexicana to place the order for the Cuervo 1800 when ordering a standard margarita).  Then I heard her take an order from another customer, and she did the exact same thing.  RIP OFF!!  

A lawyer would have a field day with way this business is run.  

Finally, it's a yucky chain restaurant masquerading as fine dining with sticker price shock.
author: CynCyn Z.

description: Baja Tacos were not what I expected, first bite reminded me of a Fishamajig which you'll be familiar with if you spent any time in Massachusetts. Still not sure if that was a good thing or not!  Interesting for sure!
author: D. W. S.

description: After waiting 15 min inside seated on a table , with close to 4 servers and a couple bussers  passing by us , none of them greet us nor they gave us a menu , it was the first time I walk out of a restaurant , really bad service , and I work in the industry as well , what a shame
author: Miguel G.

description:
went here to watch the niners game recently and loved it! the ambiance is great for groups. we ordered the pomegranate margarita.  i LOVE pomegranates and any drink that incorporates them but there was something about this one that just missed the mark.  for an appetizer we ordered the guac and WOW it was so good that as soon as it was finished we ordered another one.  even if you don't like avocados and guac you have to try it, it's probably the best guac i've ever had.  i was with a group and everyone ordered the fish tacos (which are the restaurant's speciality) and i ordered the crab enchiladas. both dishes were extremely flavorful and delicious.  i'll definitely be back to try everything else.

on a sweeter note... we ordered the churros for desert and the literally melted in your mouth  i wish i had a picture to share but since i don't i'll just leave it as you have to try it when you're there.  the dips are tasty as well but the churro alone is enough.

whether or not you're in the area give this place a shot, it won't disappoint.
author: Sarah A.

description: Stylish, pricey, and a packed bar.  I had some apps at the bar, I'm sure they were good.  Feels like a business/tourist hangout.
author: Vincent M.

description: Very solid happy hour option in this part of town. Normally if I were craving delicious margaritas after work I'd head over to Tropisueno but I found myself closer to the water on Friday before a three-day weekend. The margaritas during non-happy hours  are around $12, so I was relieved to get them at half price. The bartender was very friendly and able to accommodate my special requests. Not the best margaritas in town but I'll definitely be back for happy hour again.
author: Chris W.

description:
I have been here many times.  I love Mexican food and have eaten at virtually every Mexican restaurant in the City in the last 50 or so years I have been dining here.  Sorry but I have to come to the defense of this very good -- no, outstanding --Mexican restaurant in Downtown SF.  The composition of the sauces and variety of exciting dishes served, along with the use of organic ingredients, puts this restaurant at the top in my view.  Add to that a beautiful decor. The high ceilings allow for good acoustics so you can carry on a good business conversation.  Yes, the guacamole prep at the table side is a great start, but the enchiladas are to die for.  All of the food is pure Mexican heaven and every time I have attended, the service has been excellent. The prices are high compared to the Tex-Mex slop houses that some of the YELP critiques like, but this is no slop house. It is a first class restaurant for those who have a discerning taste for good food, and not the faire served about a mile down the road at the sadly normal Tex-Mex joints that proliferate in the City providing mostly low quality so-called food at rock bottom prices. 
Please try this fine Mexican restaurant and enjoy.
author: Bill L.

description: I had the chicken tamale pie and my date the fish tacos. The ambience has a lot going on visually and is pretty noisy. Not bad, but just not a place to go to relax or have a more intimate conversation. The food is very bland and my dish had a minuscule amount of chicken that seemed to be more of the frozen/pressed variety than fresh. The food is extremely pricey which would be fine if it was truly gourmet in nature, but what we received didn't come close to that category unless you consider fish stick tacos and frozen chicken diced into a tortilla with cheese fancy eats.
author: Jonathan N.

description:
I have been here 3 times already and its just eh.  1st time I dismissed them as just too new.  2nd time, bad luck ordering the wrong items (lunch special) and this third time I am convinced, the place lacks attention.  

Their soup is a thick enchilada sauce.  Ceviche trio was hard to identify or eat. Tortas are dry.  $14 tableside  Guacamole is for just 2 people.  

Pros: Carnitas nachos and their drinks, though it will set you back $22-25 for just one drink with nachos.
author: Ange M.

description: For Mexican it's pretty upscale. Service was good and it's more of a club scene atmosphere during the busy times so I do not recommend for families after 8.  Visited during non busy season so it was full attention all the time. Pricey  for the booze drinks but very well done.
author: CaptainA M.

description: Dinner on a Saturday night. The margaritas, guacamole and tacos were excellent! We were so full that we never made it to the main course. The scallop/pork belly and hamachi tacos were scrumptious. The only reason I didn't give five stars is because the service needs some tweaking; the server spilled the margarita on the table and we waited awhile before being served. I would definitely return for another meal or margaritas at the bar.
author: Maria C.

description: A great friend took me there for my birthday today.  It was as wonderful as my memory of the dinner I had at their flagship location in NY. Amazing service all the way thru - fab guac, chips and salsa - our main entrees were to die for.  Ah, they also gave us the most delicious amuse-bouche of hamachi tacos - completely on the house.  They were to die for. Post lunch, on their own with no encouragement from my friend, they surprised us with one of their famous flans as a complimentary dessert for my Birthday.  We will totally go back.  While I am hole in the wall kind of mexican food girl normally - mexican is my favorite food! -  I love a fancy mexican food experience every now and then.  Rosa Mexicano is my new SF favorite!
author: marci h.

description: The only good thing about the place is the spot and the guacamole, sorry the food is not that great plus its expensive. We went here as a group and thank god I didn't have to pay for it because I swear i didn't even ate my lunch because it was not good at all.
author: Joiera C.

description: Loved the happy hour here.  It was bustling but we didn't have to fight for a drink or a barstool.  We selected a few of the appetizers.  Highly recommend the Layered Duck Tortilla Pie...amazing.  Also enjoyed the Partida Paloma cocktail.  Can't wait to come back.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Nice ambiance! Food is great! Music is vibing. Drinks were satisfying. I read all these comments about how expensive this place is lol. For the experience it was worth it. As an everyday spot...I think so. Perhaps happy hours but not to dine.
author: D A.

description: Love this place worked in sf for years and this is the best Mexican food in town me and my business partners come here about twice a week one of their hostess is very sweet and always so cheerful I believe her name is Nicole try to only go on nights she is there sadly other hostess aren't so friendly.
author: Joe M.

description:
"Mostly Great Food, Service Tune-up Needed"
We went to this restaurant for the first time with great expectations after having been to the sister location various times during the past ten years at Lincoln Center in NYC. While the atmosphere at the SF location is more relaxed many of the attributes were the same. We expected terrific food and beverage and got it with the La Clásica margarita (best mag we've ever had), Pescado Pibil grilled white fish and Chamorro crispy pork shank as entrees, and the Tres Leches de Zarzamoras dessert.
But the signature Guacamole en Molcajete as an appetizer was a real disappointment. We asked for medium spicy but our guacamole came very bland, like it needed more salt and lime as well as jalapeño. We resorted to adding the side dish of green salsa verde into the bowl to help the flavor. Likely the waitress didn't really have experience making this dish. In NYC Rosa uses specialists to prepare the guacamole at table side, whereas here in SF it appeared that every waiter and even the restaurant host were making the dish. Better to stick to specialists I think.
Service could also use some improvement. Our waitress was perhaps new to the trade and always seemed off on timing and not meeting our needs. Thirty seconds after plopping down the large drink menu and dinner menu she asked if we wanted a drink and we said "just a moment". We picked our drinks within 5 min and entrees within 10 min but she never came back to take the order other than to quickly set the guacamole on the table and leave. We ate some chips but then sat with arms crossed for a while, absent drinks, before she finally asked if everything was OK. So after 25 min at the table and the appetizer half gone we finally got our drinks! Then she waited more time before taking our food order. The bottom line is that the twosome at the table next to us were seated after us and almost finished their meal before we got our entrees. Additionally, she wanted to clear away my margarita when it was still partially full, and bring me a second one. Finally, the cappuccino we ordered was only  lukewarm and had to be replaced. Through all of this the waitress exhibited a somewhat forced pleasantness but haughtiness as if we were the problem, not her service.
So there it is - we'd give the restaurant 4/5 stars and will come back but hope the waiter staff is better trained and more professional the next time.
author: Michael B.

description: Okay food, a little pricey for the quality.  If you like guacamole, this is a place to try maybe for drinks and apps.
author: Paige D.

description: great seafood, delicious guacamole mix to start...very good service...nice atmosphere...would go back.
author: Ara L.

description: This place is a joke.......bad service, shabby food, not a well run operation.  I'm not impressed by Mexican food any way and these guys worked hard to disappoint completely.  I WOULD NOT RETURN NOR WOULD I RECOMMEND.......and I'm one of those people who hates giving bad reviews but these guys earned it, unfortunately!
author: Lorenzo O.

description: The management and service staff here makes for a good customer service experience, but the prices are too d*mn high. That said, we had an amazing tacos-and-tequila flight earlier this year on a Friday night when the restaurant was busy but not packed -- usually you can get a table without a reservation. Bonus: it's always a plus when the manager gives you his business card and says to come back anytime for a drink on the house due to a dining-room mix-up with the order preferences. Bottom line, good food (though a little formal for Mexican), even if the $ is a little above average.
author: Casey S.

description: Very slow service and food took much longer than normal to arrive. The happy hour is good and priced ok. The normal menu and entrees are way over priced. Nice outdoor seating.
author: mike t.

description: Nice, upscale Mexican restaurant with interesting menu, good food and nice service. Recommend the signature drink.
author: Michael B.

description: Amazing team at Rosa Mexicano! The attention they give their customers is over the top! See you soon Rosa Mexicano SF and hopefully NY in December!
author: Lupita P.

description:
It's a chain restaurant.  That's exactly what it is.  The service isn't good, nor is the food or margaritas.  The restaurant is big and is in a good location, but that's about all.  

I'd skip it - you won't miss anything.
author: Shanna Q.

description: The food was excellent; perfect/choice cuts of meat artfully marinated/seasoned. The portions are smaller than what you get at chains, which is for me a GOOD thing.  The menu selections have a variety of dishes you rarely see in Mexican restaurants (fondu with huitlacoche is an example).  Unfortunately, the service can be slow/off during a busy night, but that shouldn't deter anyone from experiencing first class Mexican food.
author: Hanuman R.

description: It's fun to take clients to cocktails here but I'm often a little underwhelmed for the price.   Highly recommend the spicy margarita.  I ask for mine less sweet and it's quite yummy.  Also always enjoy the tableside guac.
author: nicole h.

description: Went for happy hour. Surprised as I always drove or walked passed and never noticed the place. Definitely will recommend for others who want to go out to happy hour at nice place with good (happy hour good) food. Margaritas, guacamole, chicken taco (little bland, but adding salsa made it perfect) and another chicken dish that I can't remember the name.
author: Lulu d.

description: I drove 1 hour too try their guacamole, and their especial Margarita, and i have to say it was worth it, my sister and i sat at the bar and got great service by a bartender named Jorge, i will definitely come back to this place, and i will tell all my friends about it. make sure to order the churros for desert, they are delicious
author: Ulises M.

description: Went here for a co-worker's going away party and generally loved the food and the drinks.  The only negative was that they couldn't put us all at one table (even though there were only 8 of us), so the party was divided.  If they had found a way to keep us together, I would have given this place 4 or even 5 stars, but it ruined the event.
author: Ryan S.

description: I've been here a bunch of times and it's always good. Cannot beat their table-side prepped guacamole, its so fresh and you can make it as spicy as you like it. Their pomegranate frozen margaritas are delicious as well. I usually don't like frozen margaritas but i can't pass up on these when i'm there. And the fish tacos are also really good.
author: Carly G.

description: I had been to the Rosa in NYC a few times and loved it. When I read in the SF Chronicle's Sunday Food section that one had been opened here last week, I just had to go. I had 3 gal friends visiting from all parts of the globe. One from Canada, one from Turks & Caicos and one from Marin county (ok, not so far away) but she was via Sydney, Singapore, and NYC). We LOVED the food and drinks. The service was very attentive. The host even escorted us out and hailed our cab! The guacamole made table side was so delicious. We tried 6 different dishes and shared everything. Really flavorful. The pomagranite margaritas were perfect.  I can't wait to go back for Happy Hour. This one vs NYC: much more local veggies, fresh fish. It is a really big space, so is perfect for large dining parties of 8-10 or more.
author: b z.

description:
This is based on happy hour - 

I went with a larger group of friends and they didn't have a problem that a couple of us were standing next to the table since it only seated four. We ordered a few pitchers of sangria and a few appetizers. The appetizers were tasty! The sangria, however, was too sweet (even for sangria) and even though we got there during happy hour, they gave us the larger pitchers that were not on the happy hour menu (and therefore $10 MORE than the happy hour price were were expecting). Not a huge deal but our bill was more than what we were expecting.
author: Bianca E.

description:
Highly recommend this restaurant for overall great service and delicious food.  Hosted a surprise BD party last night - service was spectacular thanks to Gio,
Catering Manager and Dexter, Maitre D!  Started with guac that was freshly made as the guests arrived, then flautas that were lightly drizzled with mole (yuuuuummmmmy), followed by a green salad with a tangy but light vinagrette, ending with chicken enchiladas in mole and filet mignon and mushrooms (OMG finger licking good).
author: Elena A.

description: Happy hour is til 7 at the bar - still no heat lamps. :(
author: rosanna c.

description: This place was so close to being 1 star. Service started out horrible. Had to get my own menus, waitress didn't come, period. Had to complain twice to front desk before manager, Dexter, came out and hooked it up. Fired our food right away, got us complimentary drinks and double the guac. Food was awesome. I am sooooo stuffed. Dexter deserves a raise. No clue what's wrong with rest of staff. Margarita supreme and marg pomegranete are the bomb! Thanks Dexter! Not sure if it was an off day or what... But I am going to need a better experience to up the stars here. Food wise... Very good though.
author: Jacob L.

description: I had the quick lunch and it was delicious!  It had the yummy guac and a duck taco on a corn tortilla and soup and flan.  The place is fun and the waiter was terrific.  It's not cheap but I'll be back.
author: Martha N.

description: Very nice, modern take on Mexican - I like it! The hamachi tacos are UN-friggin believable - I could eat a dozen at a time, but luckily they are tiny & come 3 to a plate. The margs here....of which  I am a connoisseur of & somewhat of a snob about...are really good. Hand made, good kick, spendy but worth it. The happy hour at this place has both of these items ~ 1/2 price from 4-7pm, so if you want to give this place a try, do it after work with some friends & see what you think. I will be back for dinner, as the food I had at lunch was high quality & the service was excellent.
author: Jen S.

description:
Rosa Mexicano is amazing!!!!!!!!!! We had lunch there today. I had the veggie tacos which were by far the best I have ever had. They had at least 6 types of veggies, and nectarines on them as well. Their corn salsa was to die for!!!!!!!! My hubby had the pork belly nachos and he LOVED them. The salsas were fresh and sooo flavorful. 

The service was impeccable!!!!!!!!!! Our server Elizabeth was so attentive, observant, and friendly. Our salsas, chips and beverages were refilled without delay. The host Dexter was fabulous!!!!!! He checked on us multiple times to make sure we were happy and was quick to get us anything we asked for.

The bathrooms were spotless and modern.

We will definitely put Rosa Mexicano on our favorite list.
author: Alix D.

description: Had an outstanding lunch - the ceviche was tasty, the guacamole was great, the fish tacos were very good (though I would agree, less tartar sauce would be better). Service was exceptional, attentive, informative and checked up on us. Will go back again absolutely to try more things.
author: Sherrick M.

description: Great Guacomale, Good drinks and good food. On the pricier side. And it gets crazy crowded (the Bar area) on evenings. Been there 4-5 times now and definitely worth a visit
author: ani n.

description: Nice place beautifully ambiance horrible service specially by the bar tender Jorge who is the rudest person I ever met
author: Carlos A.

description: Table side guac is delicious!  I've been a fan of Rosa since I lived in LA (LA Live and Sunset Strip) and this location does not disappoint.  They tend to be busy at lunch so consider going early/late or making reservations.  Everything I've ever had has been tasty. It's Mexican food with a twist.  I really liked the chicken tortilla pie, and the enchiladas are good too. The chicken quesadilla, however, was VERY blah.  I seriously think I've had better at Taco Bell!  If you're in a hurry at lunch, they have a quick lunch special for $14 that comes with guac and a few chips, soup, a taco, and flan.  It was tasty, though we definitely needed more chips (which, for some reason, weren't provided on this visit?)
author: Amy J.

description: I had dinner there last night. Excellent service, really nice and relaxing atmosphere and tasty food. I would give it 4 stars BUT the cost. Holy Schmoly it's expensive. To give you an idea, Wild Jumbo Shrimp Brochette over house rice is $26.50. I think the cheapest Margarita (non-happy hour becasue we weren't seated in the bar) was $11, I think. The food quality is definitely there but be prepared to spend some money, UNLESS you got the bar during Happy Hour. BAM!
author: Rob F.

description: Absolutely love the food at this restaurant !  I've been twice and want to go back as often as possible.  Delicious spins on traditional Mexican/ Southwestern fair. Excellent margaritas, staff and you can talk to your party When the restaurant is full .  I recommend a comfortable and spacious booth.
author: Bill B.

description: Worst meal I've had in a LONG time. Shrimp ceviche was fishy and unappetizing; spinach and mushroom creamy side was a confusing texture-- do I eat it with chips (that aren't provided)? With a spoon? Is it a soup? Did not stand on it's own.
author: Laura B.

description:
If I could give this restaurant a zero, I would! 

First, I am not one to get on yelp and complain about my dining experience. I would much rather save my energy and just never go back. But this time, I could not let it slide. I had to let the rest of the Yelp world know what a waste of time this place is. 

Desperate to find a happy hour on a late Saturday afternoon, and with no other place having one, my family and I take a chance on Rosa. As soon as we walked in, we could tell they were prepping for the anticipated cinco de mayo crowd. And as such, the reggaton mash up was blaring, and made it a little difficult to speak. Thankfully my sister-in-law asked for them to turn down the music, and the d.j. gracefully complied. 

Ok, so we sit down, decide to order a few margaritas, and few nibbles to accompany the libations. Since there were 7 of us, the server suggests we order a guacamole for 6 to accompany our fundido order. Sure, a guacamole for six...that sounds reasonable. Eh, wrong! It wasnt until we receive the bill that we are alerted to the fact that a guacamole, which was bland and lacking flavor, was $26.00!!! Thats right, folks! $26 dollars for a bland, but FRESH, guacamole. Seriously??!! You can get avocados from the farmers market for $1.00 each right now. You only put 2 to 3 whole avocados in there. Are you seriously about to charge me $26.00 for guacamole that was sub par?! And our poor mother paid the bill!!! UGH. 

After being blindsided by the bill, any positive experience, interaction, etc... was forgotten. It was shady that the server suggested a menu item (we were never provided menus either. Just the happy hour menu that was on the table) that was $26.00 and didnt tell us ahead of time. I use to serve, and I would have never thought of doing something so underhanded. 

Thats just one of many things that happened during our brief dining time at Rosa Mexicano. I could go on about the wrong drink orders and such, but im exhausted just thinking about this abominable place

Needless to say, you couldnt pay me to dine there! They give a bad name to the beautiful food scene SF has to offer. And it was a stark reminder of why I stay the hell away from the financial district during the weekend. Its another predatory, overpriced tourist trap! 

Save your money and go else where!
author: Jade L.

description: Yes, the guacamole lives up to everything you have heard! Made to order while you watch mesmerized by the mortar and pestle. If we go back, I will split the main course as it wasn't as memorable. I had the pork tacos which were on the crispy side and came with at least 6 shells and enough meat to feed two.
author: Caroline L.

description: I had a boozy lunch there. Get the Pomegranate Margarita. The wait staff tries to up sell you on everything! No, I just want my boozy lunch and with a quesadilla, lady! Not looking for a used car here.
author: Aaron H.

description: After a long construction period, I was really looking forward to the opening.  I've been a few times and like it but don't love it.  It's not bad, but not quite the food quality I was hoping for (maybe because of all the suspense and my very high expectations).   Good atmosphere.  I'm glad it's open and look forward to going every now and again.
author: Dorian F.

description: Loved the happy hour but recommend you get there early for a table in the bar then sit back with a nice drink and people watch...or start up a conversation. Loved the table side made guacamole and the duck tacos. Every night is a different taco so I must go back. Not quite a big fan of the coconut mojito.
author: Gordon H.

description:
***

You have to try their Signature drink!!  OH MY OH MY..........I'm dyeing now. 

Its a SORBET (like ice cream but tottally drinkable)..made with alcohol. 
and...its quite strong too... an alcoholic sorbet? love it. 

My gf and I are VERY happy to have a Mexican restaurant next to Americano (our fav happy hour place)...

Its cold but I can see this place being wonderful with the outdoor seating during hot days. 
Super chic! and beautiful décor.

FOOD
Food was on the pricey side (hence the bad reviews)..
I don't think is bad AT All...but for the price...and proportions, yes. 

I think the food is delicious but I was not FULL and did not want to order more..$$$...
so I think they either Lower their price to fit what they offer or
increase the flavor to a TOP notch maximum to fit the high-end flavors they seek. 

I don't think people would dislike the food if it was price a bit lower to match what they get AND/OR
gave bigger proportions of food (like Mamacita) since the flavor although delicious its not breathtaking incredible. 

STAFF--Wow....just super accommodating and just incredible, what a great experience. 




OVERALL...

We thought we found the perfect place to EAT after drinks at AMERICANO...or happy hour BUT its pricey and you don't get full!...
the guacamole was only enough for 2 people...... and just a normal taste (which is still delish..)
Colibri has the same style of guacamole ..

SO overall ....don't think we'll be dining and dining here over and over as expected...but we will come perhaps for a final drink and food once in a while.
author: Geena T.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and noticed this place had popped up a few months ago and decided to check it out.

The food is okay but at the end of the day what you have is extremely over priced Mexican food.  If you don't mind paying 2-3x what you should pay to get the ambiance, the service and all the bells and whistles of an expensive restaurant, by all means check this place out.

However, if you're expecting great food for these prices, don't hold your breath.  Food is just so-so so the value you're getting here is pretty horrible.

$12.50 for a house Margarita and $26 for a bowl of guacamole...  Both were above average, but nothing I couldn't make on my own as a Mexican food aficionado.  I had the fish tacos which were really just 3 small corn tortillas with a fish stick inside and small amount of homemade "slaw".  That was $17 or $19, I can't recall.

A few other people in the party go the "skillet style" plates, which were the entrees and costed about $26.  Portions were small, but the feedback was the food was "okay".

Bottom line - if you don't mind paying extra for things like ambiance and service, give it a try, but if you think you're going to get some great Mexican food for these prices, I'd go elsewhere.

I enjoy good value when I go to restaurants where I feel like I get what I pay for and this is not one of those establishments.  You pay through the nose and the food is so-so.
author: Kyle M.

description: Great made-to-order guacamole. Attentive staff and pomegranate frozen margaritas are great!
author: Em F.

description: I'm confused by the mediocre ratings here. I met with a friend here as the location was convenient, before seeing the yelp reviews.  We both thought our food was outstanding, the margaritas were excellent and the service prompt and friendly.  Atmosphere was fun and lively - similar to Cascal in Mountain View. Loved it.
author: Mtnview M.

description: The guacamole at this place is the most fantastic guacamole I have ever had.  The service from our female bartender on Sunday night was the the worst service I have ever had.  No smile, no hospitality, no offer of plates and napkins, no offer to refill our drinks, almost no exchange of words at all.  She had a real sour puss on the whole time.  Re-train your staff Rosa Mexicano or hire people that don't suck!
author: Denise H.
