description: Initially our office group went there for lunch in July.  There were 5 of us.  Two of us ordered the Chili Releno and it just wasn't very good.  When I wrote a review about it on Open Table, Executive Chef David Suarez contacted me and invited us back with an offer of two free meals.  The 5 of us just went back and not only did we get two free meals, they made us all a complimentary appetizer, and brought us a complimentary desert.  The General Manager Elias Mandilaras, visited our table several times as did David Suarez to make sure that all was good with the food and service.  All of the food and service was beyond excellent.  I just think that they must have been having an off day or something back in July.  We were very impressed this time and will definitely be back.
author: Diana W.

description: this place would fail in the Mission but I see this as the place to go for a more gourmet experience in Mexican. yea, so it'll take away from the authenticity that comes from what's kinda considered street food but after getting a bunch of zits from eating in the mission-the-real-deal-mexican-joints, i realize better ingredients are better for my (sadly) aging abused body. Rosa M uses Mary's chilled chicken and high quality beef, as well as nice fresh servings of guac. If you sit there, it's a table-side show when you order the guac. Price aside, i think it's a nice option near FiDi and while it's not cheap, the ingredients here aren't either. It's def not as oily, though I think some things are a bit saltier than i prefer. These days I can't get to the Mission even if I wanted an El Pastor for $4 so this place is great. Drinks are strong and they also have Shock Top beer. bathrooms are clean and spacious too. Not sure it's kid-friendly but it is nice for a date night on weekends.
author: Emm C.

description: So i went her for a work function and thank god i did not have to pay.  The place itself is really nice, maybe good to go for drinks...but for Mexican food....i think NOT!  Mexican food is fantastic and there is no need to improve on it.  I think they were trying to do like a mexican fusion.....but it wasn't working.  It was weird.  I had the enchilada and it was an uncooked tortilla, with chicken that looked like it was stewed in a red sauce made for something else, then they poured a green sauce over it.  But not chile verde, it was something else.  It just looked like it didn't go together and they just threw it together on the plate.  I'm all for some type of fusion, but it needs to be done right and this was not.  Then i had some quesadilla.....now seriously folks....how you can you get that wrong....well they did!  they put sweet potatoe and some other kind of veggie in there...uuuuum NO!  it just didn't taste right.  Then i was talking to one of my coworkers about the food and he said it was a very well known mexican chain from New York and then i said....OH, now it makes sense.  Mexican food from New York....got it!  See....we have what is called the "Mission"  and in the "Mission" you can get authentic Mexican food, well made and scrup-dilly-umptious for under $12 and that includes everything.  So i forsee this restaurant not doing so well and possibly closing in the near future.
author: LuLu M.

description: Great guacamole, nice set-up with area for lounge and drinks separate from dining area. Friendly and attentive service. Good, not great, food, with average portion size. Expensive, but if on the company dime, then a great choice for a casual-leaning business lunch.
author: Adeeb S.

description: Holy cow! How is this place in business...it should be ashamed of itself...especially in a town with great Mexican food. Service was pretty slow and lackluster...but the worst part about this resto was the food. The guac was pretty tasty but served with horrible, stale, hard chips. I even said the first batch of chips was stale, and they replaced it with a worse batch. The rice that we ordered on the side was undercooked - hard and crunchy. The entrees were so so. The hamachi ceviche app for $14 probably amounted to two teaspoons of fish and was totally overpowered by strong truffle oil. All in all, it was a pretty horrible meal - completely overpriced and underwhelming. Did like the cocktail - La Sandia - but at $12 a glass I expected more than a drop of tequila. Will not ever come back...
author: Sf s.

description: was really disappointed... drinks took 1/2 hour to arrive, dinner took an hour and a half and then 3 of the entrees were cold.  The manager finally arrived to apologize after almost two hours and by then the seven of us were so over the experience.  They brought us shots of tequila to try to appease us... would not go back ever!
author: Catherine W.

description: Best service ive had in  san francisco! Food was delicious and the service does not compare to any other place! They treat the customers as family and cater to your every need. The food is to die for. I would eat here every day lf the week
author: Mercedes J.

description: Was really hoping to enjoy a holiday lunch with colleagues at Rosa Mexicano today. Had a reservation for 8 people at 1:30pm. I called a week ahead of time and spoke with the manager and the hostess confirming that we would be a party of 9 and not 8. They did not take note of this conversation obviously. The table they had for us pretty much fit 6 maybe 7 people so even if we were a party of just 8 and not 9 people.... it wouldn't work! There was an identical table right in front of us with 6 ladies and that was pretty much all that this size table would fit. We were told it would be at least 20 minutes for another table to potentially open up as a few groups were on their entrees. No offer of drinks or food to compensate us... we pretty much had to ask for a round of drinks while we were to wait. We decided to pass on Rosa Mexicano and head over to Boulevard for our Holiday lunch. Boulevard was happy to accommodate us and it was a fabulous lunch. Was really hoping for some Mexican today but based on the service and first impression.... I would pass on Rosa Mexicano. Really unimpressed!
author: Kimberly M.

description: Guac made at  your table.  And it is yummy!  And all of their dishes I've had have been fresh and delicious.  If you are looking for your typical Mexican taco truck food, you will not be happy.  I find their dishes innovative and refreshing.  Yes, it's a bit pricey but it is well worth it.
author: bill l.

description: Nice ambiance, financial district swanky.  Very expensive for what you get, but I get it. It's the location.   Good drinks...but $14 for a margarita?  I got the wrong dish.  They offered to replace it, but I kept it.  Thought they would have offered to comp something like a drink or dessert....but no.   A big corporate place like that is too bottom line oriented.  I'd go again only if I were expensing it.  Better food for less is found in the Mission.
author: Peter J.

description:
I was so excited to try this place but instead left disappointed and underwhelmed.  The drinks were delicious! But the food was terrible!! And since we are being honest here, if I'm going to be drinking then I also need to be snacking.  We started out with the hamachi fish tacos but they were the tiniest tacos I have ever seen in my life. While they were good, they definitely were not worth it.  I'd get the queso fundido again.  Next was the guacamole. You'd expect it to be good, right? HA! WRONG!  It was the worst guacamole I have ever had in my entire life.  I was so surprised because I kept reading how it's the best guacamole ever.  But there was absolutely no flavor to it.  There was no citrus in it, so we asked the server for some and ended up getting a couple wedges from the bar and used the limes in our drinks. And when we asked for more, they said the bar wouldn't give us anymore. o__O? The tortilla soup was also pretty terrifying.  It was black, thick, and chunky.  Definitely not what one would expect when ordering tortilla soup.  The enchiladas were ok but also not memorable.  

If I were to think about going back, I'll be taking my own guacamole.  But I'd rather make the trek to Nopalito.
author: Mary B.

description: Not sure when this place opened but I felt like got a little piece of NYC when I saw it on the corner of Spear and Mission. Unfortunately I didn't get to try a drink here but the decor is pretty similar to NYC. It's hard to pay upscale for Mexican when the Mission is right around the corner. Probably a good place to take clients as it is more on the pricier end.
author: Jeanne C.

description: The best place here in San FRAncisco!! I went to the other one at The Staples Center while on vacation and have been craving it since then. I'm so glad to have one 45 min away verses 5 hours away. I will be going back real soon!!
author: Dora H.

description: What a joke for dinner!  I ordered the "caesar salad" which was 7 stalks of romaine basically drizzled in mayo and nothing else.  The "huge bowl" of guacamole barely gave each person in our party of 3 a dollop and we all looked at each other saying "was that really a true serving each?".  The ceviche sampler  as my entree was approximately 2 tablespoons of ceviche served on a piece of watermelon and a taco shell the size of my thumb for $17.  Don't waste your money; hit your local taco joint or better yet, go to Taco Bell.  What a rip off and can you tell I'm pissed that I came home hungry after a $200 bill??
author: Bev T.

description: Rip off!  $23 (not including tip) for 2 shots of well whiskey?  That's crap, especially in a bar/restaurant that has arrogant waiters, cheesy decor, and a name that's culturally ignorant and liguistically incorrect.  Good luck, Rosa MexicanO.  You'll need it to compete with the more affordable and more enjoyable places in your area.
author: Scott S.

description: it was good.  great table-side guacamole, and food was good, but nowhere near as good as colibri.  20 minutes late to be seated for reservation, but fantastic service once we were seated
author: nick g.

description: Not impressed with this Rosa Mexicano.  I am crazy about the Rosa Mexicanos in New York City and Washington, DC, but the LA and San Francisco restaurants have truly let me down.  I don't know what it is, but so much of the magic of the place has been lost on the west coast.  The vibe is very different and the decor is too dark inside as well, which made it feel sleepy.  There were very few people there on a Saturday night which is never a good sign and the guacamole for four cost $26.  I have never seen or heard of guacamole that expensive.  The materials cost cannot be more than a couple of dollars, so it is outrageous and truly detracts from the experience, sadly.  I am not a vegetarian, but there was only one vegetarian option on the menu (cheese enchiladas) so the menu seemed to lack some creativity in my opinion.  There were no salads and nothing that felt bright or fresh on the menu.  I wouldn't go back and am very disappointed.
author: Alison S.

description: Lunch date with the Hubby!  Was excited to check out this restaurant just down the block from me.  Restaurant was nicely decorated, trendy with a flair or Mexico (but just a flair!  Husband wanted to try their aguas frescas (strawberry drink) and was looking forward to this refreshing treat!  It came in its own cute little pitcher but there was truly nothing special about it.  Hit up a local Mexican restaurant and you'll know what I'm talking about!  We HAD to order the tableside guacamole just because.  I'm not super big on guac but I have to admit, this was delish!  We asked for spicy and that we got and we were not disappointed.  The flavors were nicely balanced and even though its quite pricey (Single serves 2/3 for $14), we both agreed that it was worth the munch! Next on the order was the Nachos de Panza/Pork Belly Nachos. This was nice and actually had a kalua pig flavor and we were pleasantly surprised by this dish.  We also ordered the Ceviche Sampler (ceviche is marinated raw seafood).  Our sampler came with the Ahi Tuna:Chile de árbol, orange supremes and watermelon; Hamachi/Mini Hard Shell Hamachi Tacos:Diced yellowtail, serrano chile, bacon, arugula and truffle oil and Pescado/Local White Fish: Scallop emulsion, creamy avocado, crispy serrano ham and yucca frita. We are a raw fish family and we always love ourselves some rawness...but this dish was okay.  Disappointed and common and just not what you would hope for when you are paying close to $20 for bite sized morsels.  Last on the list was the Panza con Callos de Hacha/Pork Belly and Scallops: Diver scallops, pork belly, spicy orange-habanero salsa. Although the presentation was nice, it stopped there.  They had a generous slab of pork belly which we felt should have been chopped into pieces to allow our corn tortilla to roll around it but the flavor was lacking. It came with three different type of accompaniments (roasted corn in a creamy sauce, escabeche (marinated cauliflowers, carrots, onions and beans), and a chipotle kidney bean salsa), none of which really did much to the flavor.  Lunch was fine...highlight was a lunch date with my husband which is rare but we both decided that if we should ever come back, its for the guac and pork belly nachos. Those two alone would do a belly good.
author: T C.

description: Expensive but ridiculously good and strong margaritas! Can't go wrong with the table side guac either.
author: Edward A.

description: The food is good enough, but I can't spend 2 hours for lunch.  We waited well over 45 minutes for them to bring dessert and then they messed up the order.  Until they work out their service issues, I'm not going back.
author: Swissmister M.

description: Friday night.. Hungry.. fav place is too busy.. so we opt for Rosa Mexicana... Walked in through the revolving door and what welcomes you is this guy with a "stank" face... you know like when you smell poo...  you make that face... yeah that was his face.. We go up and he doesn't even look at us.. instead.. he says.. do you have a reservation... Hmmm. No we don't.. but thanks for asking..  Anyways.. your place is not that busy.. why have a reservation? Moving on... well if it's too busy here.. we can walk over to Perry's which I would have enjoyed WAYYYYY better.  Ok.. thank you host.. with the stank face.. we will try you next time... WAIT!  he looks at us finally.. and says he has something.. still attitudy!  He sits us at a table in the middle of the room. The waiter was nice and friendly enough but the host really bugged me.. we ordered the nachos, enchiladas, and something else that I forget.... the food was not the greatest mexican either.. The place was super expensive.  Also.. if your going to make something spicy.. note that its spicy.. the nachos we unedible. It was all kinda BLAH! Don't waste your time or money on this place. One Market should have kept Quiznos there!
author: Bobby T.

description: Found out the server's name is Aaron S.  Be sure to ask to sit at his station---you won't be disappointed.
author: Ray S.

description: The Food and Service and Overall experience were good. Very pricey for not alot of food. $7 mexican beers - just wrong in California. But late at night, in this area, it does the trick.
author: Ben G.

description: The service here is absolutely terrible. The wait staff must hate their lives or something because they are not attentive, not friendly and gives you awful looks. Food is ok but overpriced. I will not be coming back unless I'm totally desperate.
author: A W.

description: Fresh and beautifully presented, upscale Mexican fare.  We have been to their DC and NYC locations.  Had delicious table side guac, phenomenal fish and they made an amazing Vegan entree for us.  Service was outstanding!  A+ Rosa!!  Bonus:  Walk to see the Bay Bridge Lights.
author: TRACEY L.

description:
Went for brunch this weekend and let me say I will not return nor recommend this place to a friend. 
First of all the tableside guacomole was the most bland I have ever tasted (oh and it was not made tableside?) We ordered the medium and there was nothing to it. I would suggest that managmenet have a taste.  When the guacomole arrived at our table we had no cutllery, napkins, or plates. Only until I asked did it arrive. 
I aksed our server what entree she would recommend/likes best and she said she hadn't tried any but that a couple of the dishses are quite popular. Ok...server, you need to have tried the food!
We ordered the breakfast tamale and the carnitas hash. The hash was extremely greasy and flavorless and the presentation of the tamale was horrible (it looked like someone had vomited into the skillet). 
We also ordered a pitcher of white sangria which was very weak and ok at best.
Admittingly the best part of the meal was the churros and the mexican hot chocolate, however, I had already checked out based on the rest of the meal and the poor service.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Had lunch here for the first time and it was only OK.  Had the lunch special which came with chips and guac, a fish taco, soup, and flan.  Pretty good guacamole, the fish taco was only ok.  Soup was a traditional tortilla soup that wasn't anything special and the chocolate flan was very regular as well.  I'd probably try it again because the prices were reasonable and it adds variety to the food selection around the FIDI.
author: Peter S.

description: What a difference between lunch and dinner. Lunch for two was very nice; dinner for eight was disaster. Our waiter did the hard sell on the guacamole, extra drinks, way more food than we needed. The food seemed steam tabled and not freshly made. Very disappointed. A check for over $300 for Mexican food?!? We're locals and we won't be going back or recommending to friends. What a rip off.
author: Beth D.

description: Just happen to see this restaurant that looked beautiful from the outside. The assorted Ceviches Sampler were fresh and flavorful but was a small serving. The fish tacos were perfectly crispy. The special salmon entree was perfectly cooked and plated with extra bowls of black beans and rice - a salad on the side would have been a nice touch. The Tres Leche cake topped with meringue graced with assorted fresh berries were delicious. It's one of the best Mexican Restaurants I have ever eaten in the US and worth the extra tab. What a beautifully decorated restaurant. It was simple,  elegant, and clean - even the ladies room were furnished with the latest Toto toilets.
author: L L.

description: The service here is terrible. Don't go. You'll wait ages for the drinks & longer for the food. I ordered 2 skinny margarita's and the taco of the day. They didn't honor the happy hour price because I ordered them "skinny" . When I asked to speak to a manager, the condescending jerk sealed the deal. Will never go there again, which is a shame because I love the DC location.
author: Toni M.

description: Had a great meal with friends here this week.  The guacamole made fresh at the table was best I have had.  We enjoyed a variety of appetizers and main dishes which were all excellent.  Looking forward to my next visit!
author: Nancy E.

description: I had high expectations; too high as it turned out.  I was disappointed.  The tableside-prepared guacamole was dry and, although it was supposed to be medium spicy, somewhat tasteless.  My unica margarita was on the small side and a bit too sweet.  The carnitas tacos were good enough for me to try the place one more time, however.  I think I will wait a few weeks to give it time to work out  the kinks.
author: Tom C.

description: I was really excited to go to this place but I was very disappointed.  First, for how expensive this place is they give you laminated menus and the check is just a recipe that's thrown on your place. There's no grace or elegance about the process.  Besides that the food isn't that great and very expensive for how much it costs.  We got guacamole and chips for $14 and it was disgusting. No flavor, no spice. It just looks really cool when they bring out a whole cart and prepare the dish in front of you.  Not to mention, the waiter we had gave us judgmental looks when we first didn't want to order alcoholic drinks or appetizers.  The food was alright but now amazing, I've had much better food.  Finally, because our waiter was a douche the whole night we only tipped him 7 dollars and he shook his head when he saw that.  I felt that 7$ for awful service was good and it was better than no tip.  I will never be going back here if I am in SF again and hopefully no one has such a bad experience!
author: Neha K.

description: Started out ok and slid downhill quickly.  Table-side guacamole is fine, not great, but perfectly fine, margaritas were ok, although everything is overpriced.  Empanada's ok, but the ceviche sampler (none real standouts) was served--I kid you not--with a plate on which sat a little glass bowl with 5 saltine crackers!  (There were 4 of us.)  We asked for more crackers; none came.  The entrees showed up at different times (all took a long time); the carne asada meat was cooked nicely, but the sides, including the refried beans, were cold (the waiter replaced them after we asked).  The fresh tortillas were good, as was the smoky salsa, but the chicken tortilla pie was bland.  We ordered dessert, along with coffee and hot chocolate.  2 of the desserts showed up.  No coffee.  No other desserts.   Unfortunately, it's the sort of restaurant where the waiter is all over you at the beginning of the meal, speaking in grandiose terms about the contents of the salsas, or the amazing tequila collection, etc., then disappears.  I eventually had to get up twice to find a waiter to find our waiter.  Later another one of the desserts showed up without much of an apology or excuse.  Then the coffees showed up.  And finally, after I stopped another waiter, we got the hot chocolate (served without the topping promised in the menu).   You'd think after such terrible service, someone would have apologized, maybe even comped a dessert.  No.  No one seemed to care.  There seem to be a lot of employees...I just don't know what they're doing.
author: Keith J.
